title: Tamerici
abstract: Tamerici is an Innovative Start-up with a Social Vocation (SIAVS) that operates in intervention plans to enhance projects, programs and policies of social impact investment in companies and organizations, according to qualitative, ethnographically oriented methodologies on a humanistic basis.
competitiveAdvantages: Promote anthropological and ethnographic methodologies as useful tools for identifying opportunities, dynamics, and relationships that allow businesses and organizations to experiment with new ways of doing business and measure social impact.
description: Innovative Start-up with a Social Vocation (SIAVS) operates in intervention plans to promote projects, programs, and policies for social impact investment in businesses and organizations, using qualitative, ethnographically oriented, humanistic methodologies. It works to enhance research by connecting with the business world, introducing, developing, and disseminating innovative approaches and services to the market, and creating favorable conditions for youth employment growth.
enablingTechnologies:
Anthropological and ethnographic methodologies:

  • anthropology of business and organization;
  • anthropology of marketing and consumer behavior;
  • anthropology of product and service design;
  • anthropology of competitive intelligence and knowledge management.
mainApplications:
New tools for businesses and organizations required to conduct business sustainably and responsibly and assess the impact of their practices and policies:

  • social and cultural project programs in the institutional, private-social sectors, as well as in international cooperation;
  • management of service co-design processes and intervention plans to strengthen the effectiveness of services for users and operators;
  • packages of operational guidelines for training processes in the social and cultural sectors;
  • project implementation of online training processes.
payoff: Anthropology Applied To Human and Social Design
revenueModel: Growth in impact investing, which represents a powerful tool for addressing social risks and needs by combining the generation of financial returns with measurable and intended social benefits.
targetCustomers:
The initiatives are aimed specifically at all individuals and organizations that:

  • work (and intend to work) for social innovation, in developing countries and in Italy;
  • work (and intend to work) in development and cooperation programs for developing countries.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: D-Art
abstract: The startup develops and applies innovative, highly sensitive analytical techniques for the diagnosis of works of art and objects of historical and cultural interest, provides support tools, and develops chemical formulations for the restoration and conservation of artistic objects.
businessTraction: Galleria Borghese, Banca d'Italia, Conart Consortium, Open Care Foundation, Superintendency of Archaeology, Fine Arts and Landscape for the provinces of Barletta-Andria-Trani and Foggia, Consorzio l'Officina
competitiveAdvantages: The startup provides experts with multidisciplinary backgrounds and expertise in various fields, both scientific and applied, capable of providing investigation strategies specifically tailored to the client's needs and the type of object being studied, in compliance with the principles of non- and micro-invasiveness.
description: Development, production, and marketing of micro-sampling and analysis systems based on innovative systems, such as combinations of gels with mixtures of mild solvents and/or micro-dispersion methods, aimed at characterizing chemical compounds and constituent materials of works of art and objects of historical-artistic interest; new spectroscopic analysis protocols with high-sensitivity techniques and signal amplification strategies through nanoparticles and nano-substrates, and new high-sensitivity chromatographic analysis protocols.
enablingTechnologies: Fiber Optic Reflectance Spectroscopy in the UV-Visible, Fourier Transform Infrared Spectroscopy, Standard and Surface-Amplified Raman Spectroscopy, Mass Spectrometry, Interfaced High Performance Liquid Chromatography, Scanning Electron Microscopy
mainApplications: D-ART begins with the client's request and develops a diagnostic plan that addresses the analytical question through a combination of multiple techniques, ensuring completeness and confirmation of the information. Non-invasive and micro-invasive solutions are generally favored, in compliance with the principle of conservation. The investigation addresses a variety of matrices, from archaeological finds to pictorial materials, textiles, and even more complex materials, such as contemporary art, merchandise, archives, and documents.
payoff: Diagnostic in Art Research Technology
revenueModel: Expanding portfolio of cultural heritage services with an integrated offering of competitively priced services and expanding into other sectors, including agri-food, cosmetics, and pharmaceuticals.
targetCustomers: Public and private entities in the fields of cultural heritage, cosmetics and agri-food

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Deep Radars
abstract: Radar solutions to enhance product quality, increase productivity, and improve safety within your company.
competitiveAdvantages: High-precision, contactless solutions for remote monitoring. In addition, the spinoff provides high-value consulting services to support companies, startups, and institutions in adopting digital and technological solutions—offering technical training, strategic support, process optimization, and innovation management.
description: Deep Radars designs and develops advanced electronic devices based on radar technology. Specifically, the company focuses on signal processing algorithm development, software engineering, and hardware implementation. Each solution is the result of an integrated process that begins with research and development and extends through to post-sales support, including product engineering and distribution.
enablingTechnologies: Radar, Software
fundingStageDescription: Founding through bootstrapping.
mainApplications:
• Healthcare: Contactless monitoring of vital signs, enabled by the sub-millimeter accuracy of radar technology. Additionally, radar systems can detect the presence of individuals in a room and accurately determine their position;
  • Contactless structural health monitoring (SHM); a single device can monitor large buildings and infrastructures, enabling predictive maintenance;
  • Industry 5.0: Radar sensors are not affected by environmental conditions (e.g., temperature), allowing the implementation of reliable safety systems in contexts where contact-based sensors cannot be used.

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Modena e Reggio Emilia

payoff: Radar technology for your business
targetCustomers: Companies, SME, startup for the sectors: healthcare and wellness, industry, infrastructures.

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: (Ud'A Lab) – Center for Developmental Age Studies
abstract: Development of protocols for the instrumental assessment of specific learning disorders and their treatment through tDCS micro-stimulation
competitiveAdvantages:
It provides on-site interventions as well as remote services through video conferencing tools.

Instrumental assessment, as a complement to standardized tests, increases objective validity, especially in adults and young adults, who may experience compensation for their disorder.
competitiveScenario: At the local and national level, there are no facilities that offer this type of diagnostic and therapeutic services.
description: Ud'A Lab – Developmental Studies Center is a spin-off of the University of Chieti-Pescara, founded to promote healthy development and lifelong psychological well-being for children and families. Its main specialties include diagnosis and treatment of Autism Spectrum Disorders, Specific Learning Disorders, Language Delays, and emotional and behavioral disorders.
enablingTechnologies: Eyetracking, tDCS
mainApplications: Development of protocols for the instrumental assessment of specific learning disabilities and their treatment through tDCS microstimulation.
payoff: Innovative strategies for the assessment and treatment of neurodevelopmental disorders
targetCustomers: Public and private diagnostic centers

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: SMART GOVERNANCE
abstract: Smart Governance S.r.l. supports Italian SMEs with integrated tools for SMART governance (Sustainable, Measurable, Ambitious, Realistic, Technological), including strategic analysis, business planning, budgeting, and ESG practices to foster growth and competitiveness.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Unique, modular, and scalable platform designed to be accessible and proportionate to the resources of SMEs;
  • It adapts to the entrepreneur’s skill level, enabling the gradual integration of managerial logic and tools without disrupting existing processes;
  • It combines economic-financial data and ESG indicators, automates data collection and analysis, supports strategic planning and real-time monitoring, and promotes sustainability, competitiveness, and the twin green-digital transition at sustainable costs.
competitiveScenario: Compared to platforms such as Cerved Group S.p.A. and CRIF S.p.A. (Italy), which are mainly focused on providing static data and analysis, SMART Governance integrates economic-financial indicators, ESG KPIs, budgeting, and business planning into a single environment, transforming data into actionable and understandable insights fully integrated into the business processes of SMEs.
description: Smart Governance develops, validates, and implements an integrated system of digital tools (software, web platforms, and apps) for SMART Governance – Sustainable, Measurable, Ambitious, Realistic, and Technological – designed for SMEs, startups, technology companies, incubators, and accelerators. It addresses the lack of structured tools to integrate economic performance and ESG sustainability, enhancing decision-making capabilities and supporting the twin green and digital transition through automation, analysis, and strategic monitoring.
enablingTechnologies: SMART Governance is based on Big Data technologies to acquire, aggregate, and normalize economic-financial and ESG information from heterogeneous sources. It leverages AI and Machine Learning algorithms for predictive analysis, trend detection, and the generation of customized KPIs.
fundingStageDescription: No third-party funding or shareholdings have been obtained; the project is currently self-financed
mainApplications: • Implementation of SMART Governance in SMEs, providing a single platform for sustainability reports, economic-financial analysis, budgeting, business planning, and balance indicators.
payoff: Bringing forward-thinking governance to your business, today
revenueModel: The spin-off will monetize through annual licenses of the SMART Governance platform, with fees scaled according to company size and activated features, along with premium customization and integration services. The model is scalable thanks to its cloud architecture.
targetCustomers: Potential clients include micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises across various sectors, innovative startups, technology companies, business incubators and accelerators, as well as corporate groups requiring integrated governance tools. The primary target is SMEs focused on the twin green and digital transition and on measuring both economic and ESG performance.

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: Grant Spider
abstract: Grant Spider is a cloud-based one-stop-shop platform for participating in R&D calls (Horizon, ERC, PRIN, etc.), offering matchmaking, document generation, and deadline tracking.
competitiveAdvantages: The platform offers end-to-end automation that reduces manual work by up to 70%. It features intelligent grant-to-organization matching powered by semantic AI. With a strong focus on the customer, universities and research centers are fully integrated into the workflow. The system provides professional documents using pre-validated templates. This creates a multiplier effect, enabling more applications and increasing the success rate, while reducing the time-to-grant by 70%.
description:
Grantspider Srl has developed GrantSpider, a cloud-based, one-stop-shop platform for accessing research and development funding opportunities such as Horizon Europe, ERC, PRIN, and others.

The problem: Universities, research centers, and SMEs spend excessive time searching for and managing grant applications.
Current limitations: Manual processes, inefficiencies, and poor system integration.

GrantSpider automates the matching between funding calls and organizations, generates application templates, provides deadline-tracking dashboards and personalized reports—reducing time-to-grant by up to 70%
enablingTechnologies:
• Artificial Intelligence (NLP & semantic matching);
  • Cloud Computing & System Integration;
  • Big Data Analytics (analysis of calls and KPI metrics);
  • Platform/App (web dashboard + mobile).
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
Main application: full support for R&D grant applications for universities and research centers (Horizon, ERC, PRIN), including alerts, matchmaking, and automatic document generation.

Other potential sectors:

  • SMEs and startups focused on technological innovation
  • Professional firms and grant consultants managing applications on behalf of third parties
  • Non-profit organizations engaged in research and social innovation
  • Extension of the service to post-award grant management.
payoff: Automate Your Grant Workflows
targetCustomers:
• Universities and research centers, involved as pilots and early adopters;
  • R&D-focused SMEs and startups;
  • Consulting firms / grant consultants;
  • Non-profit organizations active in social innovation.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Erreditre Ingegneria (RD3)
abstract: Support to entrepreneurial and productive entities interested in the development or the characterization of products and components tied to the world of construction, with particular reference to structural applications.
businessTraction: Regional finalist of the 2024 CNA Cambiamenti Award.
competitiveAdvantages:
The construction and manufacturing firms are seeking constructions that reduce on-site time and operations, aiming at cutting costs and improve safety as much as possible.

Today the construction landscape is still lacking for highly industrialized solutions that enable such approach and advancements; buildings are still mostly traditional, involving a high number of on-site operations. The industrialization of components also reduces construction uncertainties and assembly errors, at the same time increasing safety and durability.
competitiveScenario: In the competitive landscape of building components, universities and research bodies offer advanced know-how but cannot meet the commercial expectations of companies. Conversely, providers are more business oriented but cannot apply such advanced approaches. Erreditre positions itself as the intermediary, bridging this gap and integrating scientific research with business needs.
description: Innovative sustainable and high tech building products and components for structural optimization, aimed at saving construction materials and decreasing the environmental impact of construction by applying the principles of circularity, flexibility and integrability of the structural solutions combined with the energy, buildings and architectural components. Providing support to entrepreneurial ventures for the validation and optimization of the existing or new solution, through a constant interaction between the scientific knowledge and the business ventures.
enablingTechnologies: The development of the modules is based on optimized calculation models and customized software, both developed in-house by the company.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: The main products are modules with a high level of industrialization, designed for walls, floors, and roofs. They are developed with the criteria of adaptability, flexibility, low environmental impact over the life cycle, circularity, and incremental application for enabling the construction of a new generation of safe, efficient, and adaptable modular buildings.
payoff: Erreditre promotes the transformation of building systems and existing building heritage for safe , sustainable and resilient communities
revenueModel: Erreditre adopts a B2B business model, with revenues coming either from direct consulting for customized development of modules across all phases or from the direct sale of commercial exploitation rights for the developed products.
targetCustomers: The company’s main target clients are firms operating in the construction market and building companies (both small and large enterprises) that aim to develop, produce, and market building products, components, or structural systems with high innovation content and low environmental impact over their life cycle.

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: Deeplomacy
abstract: Deeplomacy is an AI platform that monitors and predicts geopolitical instability, providing alerts and weekly analyses to support strategic decision-making in high-risk contexts.
competitiveAdvantages:
The solution developed stands out for three main advantages:

  • predictive capability,
  • operational accessibility,
  • model transparency.
competitiveScenario: Unlike many existing tools that provide only descriptive analyses or qualitative reports, Deeplomacy offers explainable weekly forecasts on geopolitical instability, based on a proprietary index and AI models trained on real-world data. The system is accessible through an interactive dashboard designed also for non-technical users, and it is built to be scalable and modular.
description: Deeplomacy has developed a predictive early warning platform based on artificial intelligence, which enables the monitoring and forecasting of crises and geopolitical instability in over 180 countries. The solution was born out of the growing need for tools that allow governments, NGOs, and companies to anticipate critical events in an increasingly unstable and interconnected world. The problem it addresses is the difficulty faced by stakeholders involved in crisis management in accessing reliable and predictive information in a timely manner.
enablingTechnologies:
The technologies underpinning the solution proposed by Deeplomacy include:

  • Artificial Intelligence (AI)
  • Deep Learning
  • Explainable AI (XAI)
  • Big Data Analytics
  • Geospatial Analysis
  • Platform/Web App
  • Natural Language Processing (NLP)
  • System Integration
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications: The main application of Deeplomacy’s platform is the monitoring and forecasting of geopolitical crises, supporting governments, international organizations, NGOs, small and medium-sized enterprises operating abroad, and professionals in the field of information and media. This represents the company's killer application, as it directly addresses the growing need to anticipate instability and conflicts in a timely and reliable manner for governments, organizations, and SMEs, as well as the demand for accurate, real-time information in the case of the media.
payoff: Monitor. Predict. Prevent Geopolitical Risk.
targetCustomers: Clients include a wide range of actors operating in complex and high-stakes decision-making environments. These include Ministries of Foreign Affairs and Defense, international organizations, NGOs, multinational corporations, and small and medium-sized enterprises. They can use the platform to anticipate crises, plan interventions, protect investments, and strengthen their strategies.

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: Arzanya
abstract: Arzanya is an innovative biotechnology platform for the rapid and sustainable development of precision biopharmaceuticals. It generates new versatile and biocompatible therapeutic molecules through a low environmental impact process, overcoming traditional chemical hazards.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Generate and select large, structurally diverse libraries of genetically encoded biomolecules against targets of interest;
  • Rapidly determine the binding affinity, specificity, and stability of selected biomolecules;
  • Further enhance the properties of desired biomolecules using custom libraries and selection strategies.
description: Arzanya is an innovative and flexible biotechnology platform for the rapid and sustainable development of next-generation biopharmaceuticals for precision therapy. The technology offers new types of precision therapeutic molecules that are versatile and biocompatible. Arzanya is flexible and sustainable because it uses a biocompatible biotechnological process to generate biopharmaceuticals with low environmental impact, reducing the hazards of traditional chemical processes.
enablingTechnologies: biotecnologia industriale
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: Platform for the discovery, characterisation and optimisation of new and genetically encoded biomolecules.
payoff: A biotechnology platform designed to select genetically encoded and highly specific biomolecules for therapeutic applications.
revenueModel:
The business model is based on incremental services, starting with:

  1. Design service;
  2. Screening service;
  3. Biomolecule production and purification service;
  4. Biomolecule engineering service.
targetCustomers: Pharmaceutical companies that want to develop or already have R&D activities for drugs based on nano-biomolecules. The versatility of the platform does not exclude the possibility of tapping into additional market sectors such as cosmetics.

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: Secura Factors
abstract: Secura Fartors develops verification tools for industrial IoT and robotic systems. The company also offers tailored training and consulting services on application security and secure coding.
businessTraction: PoC project with Antonio Zamperla S.p.A.
competitiveAdvantages: Automation of heterogeneous tasks and collection of physical data from remote machines, continuous monitoring tools and intuitive interfaces for operators. The system overcomes the limitations of Virtual Machine (VM) and Cloud-based solutions when it comes to sudden load spikes. VMs offer flexibility but can lead to wasted resources, while the Cloud is scalable but complex in terms of costs. Both suffer from sudden load spikes, compromising system reliability.
description: Secura Fartors develops verification tools for industrial IoT and robotic systems. The company also offers tailored training and consulting services on application security and secure coding.
enablingTechnologies: IoT
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications: It offers microservices architecture in a highly scalable serverless solution. It focuses on task automation and scheduling, with tools to distribute loads based on priorities and available resources, favoring the system flexibility and adaptability, improving energy management and monitoring via advanced dashboards and two-step logging.
payoff: Advanced security solutions for robotic, industrial, and IoT systems.
revenueModel: The reference model is that of a product development and sales company (software licences) because this makes it possible to scale the business by focusing efforts on technology development and monetising licences.
targetCustomers: B2B market, manufacturing companies in the context of Industry 5.0

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: VeniSIA
abstract: Deep Tech Venture Builder specialising in the creation of sustainable technology-push start-ups.
businessTraction: Eni S.p.A. con Joule Scuola d’Impresa, Enel, Cisco, Mundys, Aquafil, OVS, Snam, Siemens, De Longhi Group
competitiveAdvantages:
The solution automates the collection of companies' needs and the search for startups in structured databases. By integrating AI and LLM into the Co-Innovation programme, it allows you to:

  1. optimise the selection of the most promising start-ups, based on trends with the greatest potential;
  2. support the most attractive ones, with an environmental impact and vision in line with future trends;
  3. make the process more efficient and extend the offer to new segments currently excluded from manual procedures.
description: VeniSIA has developed a ‘Co-Innovation’ programme together with major Italian companies (Partners) keen to increase their environmental, economic and/or social sustainability. Co-Innovation offers various packages, ranging from the basic package (Seed), which involves only defining the Partner's sustainability objective and searching for solutions within a basket of start-ups in line with the challenge posed, to more complex packages (Main and Premium), which include a series of add-ons, up to the development of a pilot project (POC).
enablingTechnologies: Large language model (LLM)
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: Startup scouting methodology as a software as a service (SaaS) solution that uses machine learning to identify the best innovative startups in relation to specific sustainability challenges proposed by major industrial partners.
payoff: Deep Tech Venture Builder specialising in sustainable technology-push start-ups.
revenueModel: The ‘Co-Innovation’ programme, aimed at large companies, is based on various levels of affiliation depending on the number of start-ups and POCs to be implemented. The funding obtained from the Partners allows VeniSIA to cover the costs of the programme, including communication activities.
targetCustomers: SME and big company

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: RARA Factory
abstract: RARA FACTORY uses AI and the physics of matter, with a proprietary algorithm, to create artificial compounds. Its mission is to replace critical raw materials (e.g. rare earths) with new innovative, environmentally friendly and readily available materials with specific functions.
businessTraction: Motor Valley Accelerator - first awarded funding (2024)
competitiveAdvantages: It creates customised alternative materials for virtually any industry and application.
description: RARA FACTORY's mission is to create artificial compounds capable of replacing any critical raw material, such as rare earth elements. By fully exploiting the incredible power of artificial intelligence applied to the physics of matter, thanks to a proprietary algorithm, the company aims to identify and synthesise new materials with desired characteristics and functions, in particular to replace critical resources with innovative, environmentally friendly and easily available alternatives.
enablingTechnologies: Advanced materials, AI
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: RARA Factory has developed a revolutionary new method for creating 'selected materials on demand’ with the desired characteristics.
payoff: Deep Tech start-up that develops innovative and sustainable materials by combining material physics, network theory and artificial intelligence.
targetCustomers:
• SECTORS: renewable energy, electric mobility, industry, ICT, space and defence;
  • TECHNOLOGIES: Li+ batteries, fuel cells, electrolysers, wind turbines, traction motors, photovoltaics, electric arc furnaces and Fe with reduced H2 content, data transmission networks, data storage and servers, mobile semiconductor devices, additive manufacturing, robotics, drones.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: Upskill 4.0
abstract: Upskill 4.0 supports the growth and digital transformation of companies by bringing together young students and businesses, with the support of technology partners.
businessTraction: Artigiani 4.0: an acceleration programme promoted by the Lombardy Region and implemented by Upskill 4.0, supporting the growth of 11 companies.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Proprietary digital platform;
  • Since 2019, UPSKILL 4.0 has coordinated more than 90 innovation projects with SMEs from different sectors, involving more than 400 students in 15 Italian regions;
  • The ITS 4.0 project has enabled the introduction of new teaching methods and the development of new and renewed relationships between HTIs and the SME system.
  • This has generated new growth opportunities with companies to develop innovation projects.
description:
Since 2020, Upskill has been a Benefit Corporation and is involved in the promotion and development of innovative, high-tech services. it manages collaborative projects between businesses and educational institutions, via the Upskill 4.0 platform, conceived and designed by the team.

Upskill 4.0 has a distinctive approach to innovation and uses innovative process management methodologies such as Design Thinking.
enablingTechnologies: Information and communication technologies (ICT).
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications:
• Customised strategies: supporting business growth, starting from their needs;
  • Thematic workshops and business acceleration projects, while promoting team empowerment;
  • Digitisation and regeneration projects to make businesses and territories more competitive;
  • Product and process design, promoting a culture of innovation.
payoff: Digital platform to promote connections between Higher Technical Institutes (HTI) and the business world.
targetCustomers: PMI e HTI

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Cheers2Life
abstract: Cheers (Circular Economy for Energetic Recycling Solutions) offers innovative solutions for upcycling: it identifies waste from the agricultural, manufacturing, textile and multi-utility production chains, launching advanced scientific research projects to convert them into ‘secondary raw materials’
businessTraction:
Collaborations with:

  • So.La.Is srl for the experimental development of innovative binders and materials for thermal, acoustic and electrical insulation in the automotive sector;
  • Omnitech srl for the prototype development of multifunctional thermoplastic polymer composites, with the integration of a filler derived from the company's own waste.
competitiveAdvantages:
Cheers transforms your waste into opportunities, slashing disposal costs and fostering new sustainable materials.

We offer high-tech services, beginning with an in-depth analysis of your industrial by-products and waste materials. We develop tailored solutions to create new products, with a strong focus on sustainability and eco-innovation, by concretely applying insights from multidisciplinary scientific research.
description:
Cheers2Life recycles production waste and converts it into secondary raw materials.

Case studies:

  • ENERGY: thanks to the regeneration of wine lees, it has been possible to create photovoltaic cell modules with organic dye (DSSC), integrated into a specially designed and manufactured glass support;
  • CONSTRUCTION: Cheers has developed, in collaboration with an automotive company, an injectable material derived from industrial waste with high thermal insulation capacity, eco-sustainable, 100% recyclable, resistant to high temperatures without releasing toxic gases.
enablingTechnologies: Advance materials
mainApplications:
The company promotes applied scientific research, development and innovation in order to:

encourage and/or implement sustainable innovative processes and technology transfer,

  • facilitate reuse, recycling and regeneration processes at the end of a material's life cycle,
  • create new high-value products and materials from company waste.
payoff: Disposal costs reduction, waste recycling and new sustainable materials development: we transform your resources into opportunities.
targetCustomers: SMEs and large manufacturing companies in the agricultural, textile and multi-utility sectors.

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: Advanced Drug Delivery (ADD)
abstract: ADD srl is an innovative start-up aiming to develop ColOrPlat, an advanced technology for targeted drug release in the proximal colon. ADD seeks to expand its portfolio of oral delivery platforms over time, addressing the needs of the pharmaceutical and biotechnology industries.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Versatility (“One fits all”): suitable for a wide range of drugs, regardless of their physicochemical properties;
  • Scalable production: use of established and easily scalable manufacturing processes;
  • Safe and accessible materials: use of GRAS certified raw materials, widely available and at low costs;
  • Better drug targeting: targeting already approved molecules for better therapeutic outcomes;
  • Health economics: better management of IBD and other colon pathologies.
competitiveScenario: Safe and accessible materials: use of GRAS-certified raw materials that are widely available and cost-effective. Improved drug targeting: optimized targeting of already approved molecules for better therapeutic outcomes. Health economics: improved management of IBD and other colonic diseases.
description:
ADD srl develops innovative technologies for the oral administration of drugs, including small molecules and biologics, enabling more effective treatments with fewer side effects. ColOrPlat, a platform for targeted colonic release, exemplifies our expertise in designing solutions that overcome the limitations of current oral therapies, facilitating technology transfer from research to industry.

Download here the ADD - Pitch Deck.
enablingTechnologies: Polymeric carriers for targeted delivery and protection of sensitive active ingredients. Delivery systems of various types and sizes. In vitro assays to predict the behavior of the systems within the gastrointestinal tract. GMP-compliant manufacturing processes for the production of dosage forms.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
• Main application: oral delivery of various drugs for the treatment of inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD), irritable bowel syndrome, diverticulitis, intestinal fibrosis, adenomatosis, and viral, bacterial, or parasitic infections;
  • Further application: oral delivery of live probiotics and/or bioactive molecules with stability and permeability issues in the upper gastrointestinal tract.
payoff: We bridge the gap between academic research and industry in oral administration of drugs.
revenueModel: Service sales, consulting and licensing.
targetCustomers:
• Pharmaceutical companies developing drugs for IBD and other colonic diseases;
  • Biotechnology companies interested in oral formulations of biologics;
  • Companies engaged in drug repositioning of approved molecules;
  • CDMOs focusing on advanced oral dosage forms; Investors.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: FoodLife.next
abstract: FoodLife.next is an innovative startup from the University of Udine developing Tool4Food, advanced software for food companies and labs to accurately estimate the Minimum Shelf Life (MSL) of long shelf-life packaged foods.
businessTraction: The project is supported by strategic partnerships: a specialized company handles software development, design, and maintenance from initial to operational phases. The startup collaborates with the Universities of Udine and Trieste to support applied research. A food industry company joined as a partner to test the MVP in a real environment, providing essential feedback to refine the solution.
competitiveAdvantages:
To predict the shelf life of a product, Tool4Food offers:

  • Results within 1 month;
  • High prediction accuracy (>95%);
  • Reduced cost;
  • Few analyses required (<10);
  • Specific protocols for testing;
  • Guided procedure with minimal expertise required.
competitiveScenario: Laboratories performing chemical and sensory analyses on food and predictive software from the pharmaceutical sector (e.g., ASAP Prime) are commonly used. However, these solutions have several limitations: long timelines (>12 months), high costs (up to €8,000), over 50 required analyses, inflexible standard protocols, risk of inaccurate estimates, and the need for advanced expertise.
description: FoodLife.next is an innovative startup from the University of Udine developing Tool4Food, advanced software for food companies and labs to accurately estimate the Minimum Shelf Life (MSL) of long shelf-life packaged foods. Based on decades of scientific research, it reduces analysis time and costs while ensuring reliable results. By minimizing MSL estimation errors, it helps cut food waste and related economic and reputational risks. Tool4Food is intuitive, customizable, and tailored to specific business needs.
enablingTechnologies: The software uses advanced tools like Global Multilevel Modelling, Bayesian Neural Networks, and resampling to deliver accurate estimates, adapt to dynamic conditions, and predict future scenarios, reducing time and helping prevent economic losses from complaints or unsold products.
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications: The determination of the Minimum Shelf Life (MSL) is necessary for: new products (mandatory shelf life study), process changes (equipment or operations affecting stability), variations in storage conditions (packaging, atmosphere, temperature, humidity), internal monitoring (routine tests for MSL validation), and compliance with quality standards (BRC, IFS, ISO 22000 require documented shelf life procedures).
payoff: Smarter Dates. Zero waste.
revenueModel: The B2B SaaS model offers annual/multi-year subscriptions for a shelf life prediction and optimization platform. Revenue comes from recurring base licenses and upgrades, and non-recurring R&D and training. Studies and courses enhance the platform and benefit clients.
targetCustomers: Companies that perform in-house MSL analyses or use historical data can use the software to simplify experimental plans and speed up results. Those relying on external labs can reduce the number of outsourced analyses and accelerate data acquisition, optimizing costs and timelines while improving shelf life estimation accuracy.

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: 3DFlix
abstract: 3DFlix by GG Short develops unique and tailor-made products, making 3D printing accessible to all.
businessTraction: In the first 12 months of activity, revenues of €20,000 were recorded from a total of 24 customers.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Total customization;
  • Reduced production times;
  • No minimum order quantity;
  • Design flexibility and rapid testing.
competitiveScenario: 3DFlix creates unique objects from scratch using 3D printing, unlike competitors who only customize or print pre-existing projects.
description:
3DFlix develops, and produces custom objects using 3D printing. Design, model and manufacture unique and tailor-made products, breaking the limits of traditional production thanks to the flexibility of design, fast turnaround times and maximum customization. The mission is to make 3D printing accessible to everyone: from creatives to students, from companies to individuals.

It also offers practical and engaging training courses for schools, families and enthusiasts, with workshops dedicated to digital making and design, integrating cutting-edge technologies to train the creators of the future.
enablingTechnologies: The enabling technologies of 3DFlix are 3D printing and 3D CAD modeling, allowing fast and personalized creation of tailor-made objects.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
• On-demand personalized production;
  • Digital education in schools;
  • Co-design and prototyping;
  • Sustainable production with zero waste.

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Modena e Reggio Emilia

payoff: 3DFlix is a creative 3D printing hub
revenueModel: 3DFlix’s revenue model is based on direct sales of customized objects, commissioned design services, and the delivery of workshops and courses.
targetCustomers: Companies and events dissatisfied with standard gadgets, marketing agencies, and personalization businesses interested in white-labeling services.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: PepTiDa
abstract: SIMBA2 is a first-in-class therapy that selectively inhibits JNK3, reducing neuronal death. In animal models (Alzheimer 5xFAD and stroke) showed strong neuro-protection, with -50% infarction/edema, +30% flow, improving motor and cognitive functions.
businessTraction: Academic GRANTs, SEED4 and SEED4IP, consultancy by Elena Paola Lanati
competitiveAdvantages: SIMBA2 is an innovative and selective peptide for JNK3, a kinase involved in neurodegeneration. It acts in a targeted way, avoiding JNK1/2 isoforms and reducing side effects. It is chemically stable and resists plasma degradation. Crosses the blood-brain barrier, ensuring good brain bioavailability. It is a promising candidate to treat stroke, Alzheimer’s, Parkinson’s and other neurodegenerative diseases.
competitiveScenario: Currently there are no approved selective JNK3 inhibitors. Pan-JNK inhibitors have low specificity and high toxicity. SIMBA2 is distinguished by selectivity, plasma stability and ability to cross the blood-brain barrier. Approved therapies include thrombotics for stroke and monoclonal antibodies for Alzheimer’s.
description:
SIMBA2 is a first-in-class therapy developed by PepTiDa srl, an academic spin-off. It acts selectively on JNK3, a kinase linked to neuronal death, showing unprecedented neuroprotective efficacy. In pre-clinical models of Alzheimer’s and stroke, SIMBA2 reduces heart attack and edema by 50%, improves blood flow by 30% and preserves synaptic integrity, Thus allowing a recovery of the capacities mnemonic and motor seriously compromised in these diseases opening new perspectives in the treatment of neurodegenerative diseases.

Download the Pitch Deck - PepTiDa
enablingTechnologies: SIMBA2 is based on innovative enabling technologies in the field of peptidomimetics and brain-penetrant carriers, with structural optimization through molecular modelling. Includes advanced drug design, peptide carriers and selective delivery to the central nervous system.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
• Treatment of ischemic stroke: reduces post-stroke neuronal damage;
  • Alzheimer’s disease: counteracts the pathological phosphorylation of APP;
  • Parkinson’s disease: protects dopaminergic neurons from degeneration;
  • Head trauma: limits JNK3 activation and inflammation;
  • Rare neurodegenerative diseases: potential use in orphan care settings.
payoff: PepTiDa redefines brain health with neuroprotective peptide
revenueModel: The business model involves licensing the SIMBA2 patent to a pharmaceutical company after clinical Phase 1, with an expected upfront fee and subsequent milestones linked to clinical and commercial developments, maximizing the return on innovation.
targetCustomers: Potential customers of SIMBA2 are national or European pharmaceutical and biotech companies as well as American/Chinese companies active in the field of neurodegenerative diseases, in particular Alzheimer’s and ischemic stroke, interested in in-licensing innovative first-use therapiesin-class with solid preclinical validation.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: Glutensens
abstract: Rapid sensor for detecting gluten contamination in food service.
businessTraction: Glutensens is establishing an agreement with the Associazione Ambasciatori del Gusto for the validation of the sensor; in addition, contacts have been made with the Italian Celiac Association and several gluten-free food manufacturers.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Speed: results in a few minutes, compared to hours/days with traditional tests.
  • Portability: compact device usable anywhere, including in the kitchen or while traveling.
  • Ease of use: no need for technical staff or advanced training.
  • Accuracy: high sensitivity in detecting gluten traces (<20 ppm).
  • Affordability: lower cost compared to laboratory analyses.
  • Digitalization: integrated app for traceability and result storage.
competitiveScenario: Glutensens differs from Nima Sensor (USA) due to higher accuracy on complex food matrices and lower costs. Unlike GlutenTox Home (Spain), it does not require external reagents or manual steps. Compared to standard ELISA tests, it offers portability, speed, and real-time digital traceability. Moreover, it does not require lab equipment or qualified personnel.
description:
Glutensens has developed a portable device for the rapid detection of gluten in food, designed for restaurateurs and food producers. The Spin-off addresses the issue of unintentional gluten contamination, which is critical for people with celiac disease and very common in the food service sector. Current methods are limited by long analysis times and poor accessibility to reliable on-site tools: Glutensens offers a fast, accurate, and user-friendly solution based on innovative biosensors, enhancing both safety and traceability.

Download here the Pitch Deck - Glutensens
enablingTechnologies: Biosensors, IoT, AI (for data analysis and interpretation), Platform/App (for result management and traceability), Cloud Computing (secure storage), Big Data Analytics (for large-scale optimization and monitoring).
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
• Killer application: food service – rapid gluten detection in ready-to-eat dishes to prevent contamination and protect celiac customers.
  • Food industry: verification of gluten-free standards during production.
  • Retail: in-store testing of bulk or artisanal products.
  • School and hospital canteens: ensuring food safety for vulnerable users.
  • Home use (future): support for families with celiac individuals.
payoff: Glutensens ensures food safety with an innovative device that detects gluten in real time in restaurants. Eating out is now safe!
revenueModel: The business model includes the sale of the device, certification (issued by an external body), and consumables. Scalability is ensured by expanding into new markets (food service, retail, consumer) and by the potential for large-scale B2B and B2C models.
targetCustomers: Target customers include actors in the HoReCa sector: restaurants, restaurant chains, school and hospital canteens, food companies (production and packaging), distributors, and large-scale retail (GDO).

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: ZH
abstract: ZH was founded with the goal of developing and commercializing innovative system solutions for the exploitation of renewable energy sources and the energy efficiency of buildings.
competitiveAdvantages: The spin-off’s main strengths lie in its high level of innovation, strong integration between academic research and industrial know-how, and its ability to develop customized solutions optimized for architectural integration. The technical quality of the products, a highly qualified scientific team, and established partnerships with leading companies enable the delivery of advanced, reliable, and flexible technologies, offering performance superior to standard products on the market.
description: The spin-off was founded with the aim of developing and commercializing innovative system solutions for the use of renewable energy sources and the energy efficiency of buildings. Leveraging the expertise of faculty and researchers from Politecnico di Milano and in collaboration with industrial partners, the company integrates research and development, consulting, design, and production, focusing on high-tech products intended for buildings with high energy and environmental performance.
enablingTechnologies: The technologies are based on air- and water-based PVT collectors, micro-cogeneration systems with integrated storage, and software for adaptive/predictive control. The solutions are supported by advanced computational models and optimized hardware, developed using C/C++ and Python environments.
mainApplications: The company offers three product lines: hybrid photovoltaic-thermal (PVT) solar collectors, available in air- and water-based versions, for the combined production of heat and electricity; micro-cogeneration systems with integrated storage, based on internal combustion engines that can run on various fuels, including bioethanol; and intelligent software for adaptive and predictive control of energy flows, optimized for integration with both new and existing buildings, and capable of ensuring high energy performance.
payoff: Technological solutions for the exploitation of renewable energy sources and the energy management of buildings.
targetCustomers: The target includes professionals in the building and systems engineering sectors, ESCOs, designers, public administrations, and companies focused on energy efficiency. Additional ideal customers are found in emerging markets, where limited access to the power grid makes autonomous systems based on renewables and cogeneration particularly advantageous.

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: WatAjet
abstract: WatAJet Srl is a new reality in the field of high precision machining and a valid alternative to already established processing such as EDM and laser.
competitiveAdvantages: The µAWJ technology developed by WatAJet enables ultra-precise cuts (±10 µm), holes under 500 µm, and surface roughness below 1 µm. Thanks to innovative jet control, it monitors component wear in real time and reduces forces on the workpiece, minimizing vibrations. Unlike traditional technologies, it is a cold process that does not alter the material, works on any substance, produces no burrs or internal stresses, and ensures fast setup and cutting times. Flexible for both prototyping and production, it is also environmentally friendly: it consumes little energy and uses no harmful substances.
description: WatAJet Srl is a spin-off from the Department of Mechanical Engineering at Politecnico di Milano. Specializing in Abrasive Waterjet (AWJ) technology, it has achieved precision levels up to ±10 µm, offering a valid alternative to EDM and laser. The company combines high technology, continuous research, and design support to deliver ultra-precise cutting solutions, promoting the “Think-Design-Make-Inspire” cycle. Thanks to its strong connection with the Politecnico, WatAJet is constantly evolving to become a leading player in the sector.
enablingTechnologies: WatAJet technology originates from academic research and enables the use of abrasive waterjet cutting in micromachining applications, overcoming the limitations of conventional AWJ technology. Its innovation lies in the advanced control of process parameters and the miniaturization of components.
mainApplications: The new company was established to become a center of excellence in mechanical micromachining, offering comprehensive support from design to prototyping and production. Built on experience gained at Politecnico di Milano, it enhances Abrasive Waterjet (AWJ) technology with innovative solutions developed by its founders. The goal is to maintain a high level of innovation, gradually incorporating new manufacturing technologies to effectively meet the needs of a constantly evolving market.
payoff: High-quality and precision mechanical processing using innovative Micro Abrasive Waterjet technology.
targetCustomers: Target customers are national and international companies, leaders in high-tech sectors, strongly focused on innovation and the use of specialized materials that are difficult to machine with conventional technologies. The new start-up aims to position itself as an industrial partner and provider of high value-added services.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: TTOP - True Tissue On Platform
abstract: The TToP microphysiological platform offers a modular and versatile design that allows researchers to replicate complex human biology and simplify research procedures.
businessTraction:
• Switch2Product 2021
  • StartCup Lombardia 2021
  • Proof Of Concept agreement with Poli360 fund.
competitiveAdvantages: TToP is the only technology that allows controlled recovery of the biological sample without damaging it, enabling post-treatment analysis or reuse through sequential treatments to recreate the complex spatiotemporal microenvironment of the human body. The cartridge is compatible with standard laboratory instruments and procedures, facilitating integration and thus accelerating adoption.
description: TToP was founded at Politecnico di Milano to address the clear limitations of conventional in vitro cell and tissue culture systems. Following initial technical validation, the platform was integrated into a research group at San Raffaele Hospital, where it underwent extensive biological validation.
enablingTechnologies: TToP's patented technology is based on the structure and material selection of its cartridge and modules. The cartridge is designed to house two overlapping layers: one hydrophobic and one double-sided adhesive. A hole is present within these layers, into which the biological sample is loaded.
mainApplications: TToP is a versatile, modular, and user-friendly microphysiological platform designed to make the in vitro process more efficient by replicating the complex physio-pathological conditions of the human body, while minimizing the controversial use of animal models. At the core of TToP's technology is a thin cartridge suitable for both conventional membrane-based cell cultures and cutting-edge methodologies. This cartridge is compatible with existing laboratory equipment and provides direct access to the biological sample for treatments or analysis.
payoff: Systems for in vitro cell and tissue cultures.
targetCustomers: The main identified segments are: (i) pharmaceutical companies, (ii) CROs, and (iii) public and private research centers. The goal is to engage with pharmaceutical companies and CROs through co-development projects for customized in vitro models. Looking ahead, the aim is to develop a service-fee business platform, offering safety testing and validation services.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: Triadi
abstract: Triadi guide entities and organizations from the world of business, finance, third sector and public system on the path to deep purpose, sustainability and generating positive impact for society and the environment.
competitiveAdvantages:
The applications ensure compliance with ESG and SFDR regulations, support sustainable and inclusive organizational models, and include a sector-specific regulatory database. They facilitate the digitalization of the third sector and public administration, enabling real-time impact management and advanced data analysis.

They define innovative sector-based metrics and promote data science for good. The solutions are built on qualified and recognized expertise, thanks to the reputation of TIRESIA and strong institutional relationships at both national and international levels.
description:
The spin-off was founded out of TIRESIA – Innovation and Research for Social Impact, a research center at Politecnico di Milano, with the goal of supporting sustainable finance, hybrid enterprises, and public institutions in managing and measuring social and environmental impact.

It combines academic expertise with advanced technology to deliver intelligent software and strategic advisory services. By integrating AI and business intelligence, the spin-off simplifies data analysis and supports the definition of impact strategies, reporting, and the creation of shared value.
enablingTechnologies: The software features differentiated front-ends tailored to specific user targets and integrates AI and NLP modules for both ex-ante and ex-post impact analysis. It is mobile-accessible for direct data input by beneficiaries and offers interactive dashboards for real-time monitoring.
mainApplications:
The spin-off offers a modular platform for impact management and assessment, with three dedicated front-ends for sustainable finance (SFDR compliance), hybrid enterprises/third-sector organizations, and public administration. It integrates AI and business intelligence to support all phases of the investment cycle and public policy design.
The offering is complemented by customized strategic, technical, and legal advisory services to help funds, enterprises, non-profit organizations, and public institutions integrate impact and sustainability into decision-making processes.
payoff: Software for assessing social and environmental impact in the finance sector.
targetCustomers: Target clients include funds and financial institutions involved in sustainable and impact finance; corporations transitioning toward impact-oriented models (e.g., B Corps, Benefit Corporations); hybrid and third-sector organizations required to report on impact; and public administrations engaged in evaluating complex policies and public–private partnerships.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Tediel
abstract: TEDIEL S.r.l. is a spin-off of Politecnico di Milano, founded in 2019 to commercialize Time-to-Digital Converters (TDCs), ultra-high-performance time measurement devices.
competitiveAdvantages:
• full programmability
  • fine-tuning of the circuit’s functional characteristics
  • portability of data processing architectures across different host electronic devices
  • low power consumption
  • high processing speed
  • reduced migration costs to more advanced technology generations
  • lower sensitivity to interference (cross-talk, switching noise, and substrate coupling).
description:
TEDIEL is developing an innovative electronic system (Felix) for time measurement based on a Time-to-Digital Converter (TDC), capable of achieving picosecond-level precision. Fully programmable on FPGA or SoC, the system is highly reconfigurable and adaptable to various industrial and scientific applications, including medical diagnostics, robotics, quality control, and autonomous driving.

Compared to competitors, Felidae offers greater flexibility and customization potential, including the ability to transfer the architecture onto existing devices.
enablingTechnologies: The enabling technology is a digital architecture based on FPGA and SoC that leverages the principles of Time-Mode Computing. By using advanced digital circuits and programmable logic, it allows for the measurement of time intervals with ultra-high precision and full reconfigurability.
mainApplications: Felix is a high-performance time measurement system based on a Time-to-Digital Converter (TDC), fully implemented on programmable logic (FPGA/SoC). The device enables precise measurement of time intervals with resolution down to the picosecond, making it highly configurable and adaptable to a wide range of industrial and scientific applications.
payoff: Programmable time measurement system based on a Time-to-Digital Converter (TDC).
targetCustomers: The system is ideal for applications in medical diagnostics, robotics, telecommunications, nuclear electronics, and embedded systems, offering a stand-alone digital solution that is flexible and transferable across different devices.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Tech.Kno
abstract: Tech.Kno provides manufacturing companies with an innovative methodology and a set of digital tools to manage and exploit the technological knowledge of machining.
competitiveAdvantages:
The proposed service has been validated on real industrial cases, ensuring practicality and reliability. Key strengths include:

  1. the ability to transform existing part programs without requiring prior knowledge of the code;
  2. compatibility with mechanical simulators for conversion verification;
  3. reduced operational time and cost thanks to the modularity of the NPP;
  4. service scalability across different production contexts;
  5. increased manufacturing flexibility to meet the challenges of customization and lean production.
description:
The spin-off originates from research at Politecnico di Milano, with the goal of transferring innovation to the manufacturing sector. Its mission is to make advanced technological tools and services available to optimize production processes, starting from in-depth knowledge of mechanical machining.

The project combines scientific excellence with industrial application, aiming to transform the management of part programs into reusable, efficient, and flexible digital assets—addressing the competitiveness needs of modern enterprises.
enablingTechnologies: The service is based on a 3D virtual environment machining simulator and a proprietary software method for identifying elementary operations from a part program. The system generates an NPP (Network Part Program), enhancing flexibility, recovery, and optimization of the production process.
mainApplications:
The spin-off offers an innovative service for converting CNC part programs from a linear structure to a Network Part Program (NPP), allowing the breakdown of instructions into modular, reusable elementary operations.

The service is based on a patented method and proprietary software that interacts with mechanical machining simulators. This enables companies to transform their programs into flexible digital assets, making it easier to resume interrupted cycles, manage small production batches, and dynamically adapt to changing production conditions.
payoff: Development, acquisition, design, distribution, and maintenance of software application packages.
targetCustomers: Target customers are manufacturing companies with CNC machining centers, operating in sectors such as mechanics, hydraulics, firearms, and automotive. These companies have adopted—or plan to adopt—NPP and CAM software, and are looking for solutions to increase flexibility, efficiency, and reusability of part programs, while reducing production time and costs.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: Symlogik
abstract: SymLogik represents a breakthrough in risk engineering and management. Thanks to its unique (and proprietary) algorithm and cloud-based platform, it helps companies take more risks — but in a calculated way.
competitiveAdvantages:
SymLogik’s key strengths include:

  1. the ability to analyze complex systems that cannot be addressed with traditional methods;
  2. a unified approach applicable to all types of risk;
  3. proprietary cloud-based software and unique algorithms capable of generating complete scenario partitions and evaluations even in the absence of historical data;
  4. advanced decision-making support;
  5. adaptability across multiple sectors;
  6. scalability of the model and low operational impact for clients.

In addition, integration with academic research ensures continuous innovation.
description:
SymLogik is a spin-off of Politecnico di Milano specializing in integrated risk analysis and management through an innovative approach based on artificial intelligence.

The company offers a unique business model: providing semi-processed content and a proprietary platform that enables partners and clients to perform autonomous risk analysis.

Born out of academic research, SymLogik positions itself as a highly specialized player in risk engineering, focusing on automation, scalability, and decision-making impact.
enablingTechnologies: SymLogik employs a proprietary cloud-based software platform and a Bayesian artificial logic algorithm capable of generating complex scenarios. It integrates methods adapted from systems analysis with original algorithms for modeling logical, stochastic, and phenomenological risk.
mainApplications:
SymLogik offers a service based on the HORAM method (Holistic Risk Analysis and Modelling), which leverages artificial logic and Bayesian algorithms to model complex scenarios. The product is structured into:

  1. consulting services for high-complexity issues;
  2. provision of pre-analyzed modules (semi-processed content) that can be adapted to partners’ needs;
  3. access to a cloud platform for simulations and customizations.

The goal is to enable companies to independently identify and manage risk using predictive and adaptable tools.
payoff: Risk analysis and management.
targetCustomers:
Target clients include companies and organizations operating in the chemical, healthcare, financial, aerospace, automotive, and transportation sectors. This also includes consulting firms, insurance companies, and investors seeking to enhance their risk analysis capabilities.

The model is designed for partners who require flexible, customizable, and scalable tools.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: SWAN Networks
abstract: SWAN networks is a spin-off created to offer innovative software solutions for data network management, leveraging strong expertise in network control.
competitiveAdvantages: SWAN-Orc allows network operators to increase operational efficiency, reduce costs, and offer new value-added services. By automating networks, it improves resource usage and enables more flexible business models. It reduces time-to-service, enhances service quality, and increases customer satisfaction. A medium-sized operator using SWAN-Orc could save up to €80 million annually. It also helps counteract the disruptive effects of technologies like SD-WAN, providing long-term competitive advantages.
description: SWAN networks is a spin-off created to offer innovative software solutions for data network management, leveraging strong expertise in network control. It is a B2B company focused on network operators (Service Providers), aiming to innovate the networking market through emerging technologies. Although still in its early stages, it participated in acceleration programs, developing a business plan oriented toward rapid growth and scalability.
enablingTechnologies: The core technology is Software Defined Networking (SDN), which separates control from physical network management. SWAN-Orc acts as an orchestration module, coordinating SDN controllers and enabling programmable, flexible, and easier-to-manage networks.
mainApplications: SWAN networks’ main product is SWAN-Orchestrator (SWAN-Orc), a software module for orchestrating Software Defined Networks (SDN). SWAN-Orc coordinates SDN controllers to automate network management, optimize resources, introduce flexible services (like bandwidth on demand and calendaring), and reduce time-to-service. It is designed to integrate into operators' networks, offering centralized control, programmability, and adaptability to Enterprise customer needs.
payoff: Software for telecommunication networks.
targetCustomers: SWAN targets network operators (Service Providers) offering Enterprise Networking services. It focuses on the Business and Corporate customer segments of these operators. Indirect end users include companies using external networks (e.g., WANs) to connect remote sites. SWAN provides value to SPs aiming to modernize and optimize enterprise networks.

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: Smart Robots
abstract: Smart Robots' integrated solution ensures quality control of all manual process operations through artificial vision, guides the operator with augmented reality and digitizes operations for certification and continuous improvement
competitiveAdvantages: The product stands out by not requiring additional safety certifications, relying instead on those already provided by collaborative robot manufacturers. This results in cost reduction and a competitive advantage over alternative solutions that require their own certifications. The system enhances the robot’s ability to collaborate with human operators during both production and training phases, improving overall efficiency. Its simple, intuitive, and potentially automatic configuration represents a further technological and commercial strength.
description: Smart Robots, part of the e-Novia group, has developed an innovative technology based on computer vision to support manual processes in manufacturing. The system, built on a 3D video sensor and proprietary software, detects hands, fingers, and objects, monitoring human operations in real time. This enables the elimination of operational errors, improves product quality, and reduces costs related to defects, positioning the company as a benchmark in Industry 4.0.
enablingTechnologies: The patented device detects the presence and position of the operator, estimates their movements, and communicates with robots to optimize safe and productive trajectories. It supports gestures, voice commands, and wireless communication for remote programming and monitoring.
mainApplications: The product consists of a vision sensor, a set of microphones, and a processing unit. The device interfaces with a collaborative robot to enhance its ability to interact with human operators both during production and programming phases.
payoff: Smart Robots designs and markets a device that integrates a 3D vision sensor with artificial intelligence algorithms.
targetCustomers:
Market Characteristics: Global, with an estimated annual growth rate (CAGR) of 50.88% (source: TechNavio, October 2015).

Target Customers: Italian, European, and global SMEs equipped with collaborative robots or planning to adopt this technology.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: SMARTMechanical Company
abstract: SMARTMechanical is a spin-off of the Politecnico di Milano, created to bring to market the technologies developed at the Laboratory for Transport Safety (LaST).
competitiveAdvantages: SMART_ products offer high accuracy, ease of use, and low production costs. SMART_InTenso is unique in delivering complete inertial property measurements quickly. SMART_Wheel is the first "smart wheel" capable of measuring forces acting on individual wheels. Both product lines stem from academic research and offer significant market potential and competitive profit margins.
description: SMART_ is a spin-off of the Politecnico di Milano, created to bring to market the technologies developed at the Laboratory for Transport Safety (LaST). The company aims to commercialize two innovative product lines: SMART_InTenso, for measuring the inertial properties of bodies, and SMART_LC/SMART_Wheel, high-performance load cells and dynamometric hubs for applications in research, automotive, and aerospace sectors.
enablingTechnologies: The technologies are based on patented mechatronic systems, proprietary software, and algorithms for determining mass, center of gravity, and inertia tensor (SMART_InTenso), as well as advanced strain gauge load cells (SMART_LC/SMART_Wheel). All solutions are university-developed.
mainApplications: SMART_ offers innovative systems for measuring the inertial properties of bodies (SMART_InTenso) and six-axis load cells/dynamometric hubs (SMART_LC/SMART_Wheel). The products are highly accurate, easy to use, and scalable—ideal for both scientific research and industrial applications, including automotive and aerospace. All technologies are patented internationally and supported by partnerships with leading companies.
payoff: Design, development, and production of innovative, high-tech products and services for parts and accessories for motor vehicles and motorcycles.
targetCustomers: SMART_ targets research labs, automotive companies (OEMs and suppliers), aerospace institutions, industrial vehicle manufacturers, and universities. SMART_Wheel is intended for prototype markets and, later, mass production. SMART_InTenso serves clients needing high-accuracy inertial measurements.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: SSiS – SECOND SKIN INSULATION SYSTEM
abstract: SSiS is an Industry 4.0 process for thermally insulating buildings through an innovative, fast, reversible, and sustainable technology.
businessTraction:
• First in the Cleantech&Energy category, Startcup Lombardia 2020
  • Winners Switch2Product 2019
competitiveAdvantages: SSiS panels offer an innovative and industrialized solution for the energy retrofitting of buildings, even those with complex geometries. They eliminate thermal bridges, integrate and conceal existing systems, and can replicate historic decorations or introduce new aesthetic elements. Thanks to prefabrication and CAD-CAM/3D printing processes, they reduce time, costs, and disruption, eliminate the need for scaffolding, and make construction sites safer, more sustainable, and more efficient—supporting large-scale urban regeneration.
description:
SSiS is an Industry 4.0 process for the design, production, and application of an innovative and comprehensive system for thermal insulation cladding and waterproofing of buildings.
The cladding system consists of prefabricated, self-supporting, modular, and reversible shells, designed and 3D-printed on demand. The same system can also be used in new frame buildings as a prefabricated element for composing façades of any type.
enablingTechnologies: SSiS applies Industry 4.0 principles to the construction sector by integrating 3D laser scanning, BIM, and energy simulations with CAD-CAM and multi-axis 3D printing technologies. The system is on-demand and adaptable, enabling the automated production of customized, high-performance panels.
mainApplications: The SSiS system is a high-performance, three-dimensional prefabricated cladding designed to perfectly adhere to the complex façades of existing buildings. Manufactured through CAD-CAM processes and 3D printing, it replicates architectural decorations, eliminates thermal bridges, incorporates building systems, and enhances insulation. It is lightweight, customizable, quick to install without scaffolding, and reduces both time and costs compared to traditional insulation systems, while offering innovative aesthetic solutions and high living comfort.
payoff: System for the creation of thermal insulation elements on new and existing buildings.
targetCustomers: The current customers of cladding insulation systems are primarily property owners. However, the largest market share for SSiS will be found among companies specializing in façade insulation—those whose core business is the energy retrofitting of entire buildings—as they work directly with end users.

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: ReActiv Powder Technology
abstract: ReActiv aims to become an industrial partner for the development, characterization, and activation of micro- and nano-structured powders.

categories.name: Building Materials, Composites And Innvoative Solutions

competitiveAdvantages: ReActiv combines fast operations, highly specialized expertise, and a strong network with Politecnico di Milano. It uniquely integrates consulting, characterization, development, and production of innovative powder-based materials. Its proprietary mechanical and mechano-chemical activation technologies—currently under patenting—allow the creation of more reactive, safer, and higher-performing materials. The lean and flexible structure ensures quick response to market needs.
description: ReActiv is a spin-off of Politecnico di Milano, born from the experience of the SPLab, with over 40 years of research in energetic materials. The company aims to become an industrial partner for the development, characterization, and activation of micro- and nano-structured powders. Its mission is to industrialize innovative technologies applicable to strategic sectors such as energy, defense, aerospace, and additive manufacturing, offering consulting, R&D, and technology transfer services.
enablingTechnologies: ReActiv employs advanced technologies for producing, modifying, and characterizing micro- and nano-structured powders. These include mechanical and mechano-chemical activation, patented processes, pre-dispersion techniques, and high-precision morphological and functional analysis tools.
mainApplications: ReActiv provides three main services: industrial consulting on powder use and characterization; industrial R&D (IR&D) of high-performance advanced materials; and support in their industrialization. Products include tailored dispersed systems and activated powders for specific applications. The offering is enhanced by high-value technological services that enable the transfer of innovative solutions into industrial processes.
payoff: Particles, powders, and dispersed systems: enhancement of existing products or processes for industrial applications.
