targetCustomers: ReActiv targets companies in energy, defense, aerospace, additive manufacturing, catalysis, electronics, and composite materials. Both SMEs and large industries working with dispersed systems or advanced powders can benefit. The offering serves both material producers and end users looking for high performance and customized solutions.

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: RAYLAB
abstract: RAYLAB has developed new solutions for neutron spectrometry and radiation protection, to improve people’s quality of life and safety through cutting-edge technologies.
competitiveAdvantages:
DIAMON is a compact spectrometer (<10 kg), lighter and more efficient than traditional systems. It requires only one exposure to measure the neutron field, compared to the six typically needed with equivalent instruments, ensuring speed and precision. It enables continuous monitoring even without a power supply, thanks to battery operation, and drastically reduces the need for technical personnel during measurements, improving both safety and operational efficiency.

STARLITE has an angular response variability on 4π of about 8% with thermal neutrons and up to 4% with faster neutrons.
description: RAYLAB develops high-performance, innovative measurement systems for radiation physics and radioprotection. Its main project, DIAMON, is a real-time neutron field monitoring system designed for both civil and occupational environments, born from an interdisciplinary approach and close collaboration with the academic world. STARLITE is the second product: a revolutionary step forward in radiation protection - designed for effortless handling and maximum operational flexibility.
enablingTechnologies: DIAMON uses neutron-sensitive semiconductor sensors, a dedicated electronic acquisition system, and a deconvolution algorithm that enables real-time measurements of the neutron field spectrum. The system is compact, active, and free of critical materials such as helium-3.
mainApplications:
DIAMON is compact and transportable for active neutron field monitoring, performing real-time measurements over a wide energy range. Replaces bulky tools such as Bonner’s Balls, reducing time, effort and the number of exposures required. Enables integration into continuous radio-protective monitoring systems, even in dynamic environments.

STARLITE measures neutron dosimetric quantities in the field (equivalent ambient dose rate and H*- new dosimetric value recommended by ICRU) and provides a real-time reconstruction of the 3D neutron field distribution.
payoff: Sale of products for the monitoring and characterization of complex photon and neutron fields.
targetCustomers: The target market includes all facilities that require periodic or continuous monitoring of neutron fields. Key customers are radioprotection services in the nuclear sector and hospital centers. Additionally, research institutions with particle accelerators or those using neutron sources are also potential users.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Photon Path
abstract: PhotonPath is an innovative spin-off of Politecnico di Milano developing advanced optical solutions for telecommunications.
businessTraction: 2025: €5.1M Serie A round led by Join Capital together with Deep Ocean Capital and Levante Capital. The new investors join existing shareholders RoboIT (CDP Venture Capital), 360 Capital and Brembo Ventures.
competitiveAdvantages: PhotonPath products leverage integrated photonic circuits to deliver compact, efficient, and scalable solutions. They enable real-time reconfiguration without disturbing other channels, offering greater network capacity and lower energy consumption. The open-source software ensures interoperability and management flexibility. The fabless model reduces industrial costs and accelerates time-to-market, making the offering unique in the optical telecom landscape.
description: PhotonPath is an innovative spin-off of Politecnico di Milano developing advanced optical solutions for telecommunications. The company designs reconfigurable optical amplifiers based on photonic integrated circuits, enabling increased network capacity and reliability. With a fabless model, it combines in-house design and testing with outsourced manufacturing, delivering compact, interoperable, high-performance products for telecom and data center markets.
enablingTechnologies: The technology is based on reconfigurable photonic integrated circuits built on a SiON platform. Design and calibration are in-house, while manufacturing is outsourced to partner foundries. The system combines dedicated electronics and open-source software to ensure high performance and flexibility.
mainApplications: PhotonPath offers three products: the Photonic Dynamic Equalizer, the Optical Amplifier Module, and the Optical Amplifier White-Box. These compact, modular devices are fully remotely reconfigurable. Based on photonic integrated circuits, they deliver superior performance and are compatible with multi-vendor systems. Open architecture and open-source management software facilitate integration and reduce operating time and costs for network operators.
payoff: High-performance optical amplifier installed on the nodes of the optic fiber telecommunication networks.
targetCustomers: PhotonPath targets network equipment manufacturers, telecom operators, large internet companies, and ICT infrastructure providers. Ideal customers operate in multi-vendor environments and seek compact, efficient, interoperable devices. The market includes data centers, 5G networks, and high-capacity optical transport systems.

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: PIONIRS
abstract: pioNIRS develops and commercializes compact, low-cost devices based on Time-Domain Near-Infrared Spectroscopy (TD-NIRS), for monitoring tissue oxygenation.
competitiveAdvantages: Thanks to the targeted development of optical and electronic components, and extensive experience in physical modeling and data analysis algorithms, pioNIRS has developed a compact and accessible TD-NIRS system. Equivalent solutions using off-the-shelf components would be ten times more expensive and significantly bulkier, requiring specialized personnel for assembly. pioNIRS leverages decades of expertise from DEIB and DFIS in TD-NIRS data acquisition and interpretation, and includes dedicated software for system control and automated data analysis.
description: pioNIRS is a spinoff born from the collaboration between DEIB and DFIS of Politecnico di Milano, with the goal of developing and commercializing compact, low-cost devices based on Time-Domain Near-Infrared Spectroscopy (TD-NIRS). This non-invasive technique enables continuous, real-time monitoring of hemodynamic parameters in biological tissues, opening new opportunities in fields such as medicine, sports, neuroscience, and psychology.
enablingTechnologies: The pioNIRS product integrates high-tech components, with significantly reduced size and cost thanks to innovative design solutions. It includes drivers for picosecond-pulsed lasers, single-photon detectors, TCSPC-based acquisition electronics, and compact probes for in-vivo measurements.
mainApplications: pioNIRS will offer a compact hardware system capable of real-time measurement of the optical properties of diffusive materials (including, but not limited to, biological tissues). When applied to the clinical field, these measurements—processed in real time—enable the accurate, non-invasive, and continuous monitoring of hemodynamic parameters and blood oxygen saturation.
payoff: Near-infrared spectroscopy devices. Photonics for health and agri-food. Biomedical devices.
targetCustomers: pioNIRS will initially target research centers, universities, and biomedical companies. After 1–2 years, the offering will expand to clinical settings (e.g., intensive care) and the consumer market (e.g., sports). Later, the business will grow into agri-food and pharmaceutical sectors for quality control and process characterization.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Phononic Vibes
abstract: Phononic Vibes develops anti-vibration and/or soundproofing devices based on phononic crystals and metamaterials, with innovative operating principles, for industrial and infrastructure sectors.
competitiveAdvantages: The vibration isolation solution is installed without removing the tracks, cutting costs and disruption. It uses recycled materials (plastic and rubber), ensuring sustainability. Its lifespan reaches up to 50 years. The acoustic panel cuts noise by up to 50 dB, is lighter than current solutions, scalable, configurable, and compatible with recycled, lead-free materials.
description: Phononic Vibes is a spin-off born from PhD research at Politecnico di Milano. It develops anti-vibration and/or soundproofing devices based on phononic crystals and metamaterials, with innovative operating principles. It has prototyped products for railway infrastructure and industrial applications, achieving noise reductions up to 50 dB. The strategy includes prototyping, testing, industrial validation, and commercialization with specialized partners.
enablingTechnologies: The technology uses metamaterials, particularly phononic crystals with periodic internal structures optimized to reduce vibrations and noise over wide frequency bands. It delivers high performance with reduced thickness and can be made from recycled materials, surpassing traditional solutions.
mainApplications: Phononic Vibes offers two innovative solutions: a meta-barrier for vibration isolation in rail infrastructure and acoustic panels for industrial noise reduction. The modular barriers, made of concrete, steel, and recycled materials, are easy to install without removing tracks. The acoustic panels, also in recycled materials, provide high performance thanks to a design independent of the material used.
payoff: Acoustic panels for noise control and insulation in the industrial and infrastructure sectors.
targetCustomers: Phononic Vibes targets municipal utilities managing rail/tram lines, and manufacturers of heavy machinery, trains, vehicles, and industrial equipment. They seek high-performance, easy-to-install anti-vibration and noise-control solutions, compliant with regulations and based on circular economy principles.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: One-Off Innovation
abstract: One-Off Innovation develops measurement systems, machine vision technologies, IIoT solutions, and big data analysis platforms, with a focus on the metal forming industry.
competitiveAdvantages: OOI combines expertise in machine vision, artificial intelligence, and data science to deliver advanced IIoT systems. While many SMEs invest in sensor upgrades, they often lack analysis models. OOI develops technologies ready for market, addressing that gap. It offers general-purpose data acquisition systems and customized analytics tailored to the metal forming sector, adding value and adaptability to industrial processes.
description: One-Off Innovation is a spin-off founded through the collaboration between One-Off Solution, engineer Alessandro Bruneri, and Professor Marco Tarabini from the Department of Mechanical Engineering. The company develops measurement systems, machine vision technologies, IIoT solutions, and big data analysis platforms, with a focus on the metal forming industry. The offering also includes custom interfaces for machines and quality systems, along with consulting services for production data interpretation.
enablingTechnologies: OOI solutions use open-source electronics, Python and OpenCV for development, and microcontrollers for data acquisition. A 3D scanning system for forged parts is based on DSE hardware and in-house Python algorithms. AI enhances machine vision performance in specific metal forming applications.
mainApplications: OOI offers two advanced solutions: a reconfigurable system of smart sensors and cameras for condition-based maintenance, using edge computing and AI to detect anomalies, and a UV laser scanning system for 3D reconstruction of forged parts, currently under patent. These solutions are designed as modular, integrable products for industrial processes.
payoff: Machine vision, IIoT products, and big data analysis systems for companies operating in the field of metal plastic deformation.
targetCustomers: OOI targets both manufacturers of metal forming equipment and producers of metal semi-finished products (ingots, bars, strip, wire). It provides measurement systems for new machinery and retrofitting solutions for existing lines. The typical customer lacks in-house data science expertise but is actively adopting Industry 4.0 technologies.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Nova Labs
abstract: Nova Labs is developing R2P, a modular hardware/software platform for rapid prototyping of robotic and mechatronic systems. It provides scalable, plug-and-play, high-performance solutions for robotics, automation, and IoT.
competitiveAdvantages: Nova Labs offers a complete, modular, and scalable ecosystem. R2P modules are plug-and-play, high-performance, and easy to integrate. The decoupled architecture simplifies development, maintenance, and upgrades. Compatibility with open standards ensures fast and versatile prototyping.
description: Nova Labs was born at AIRLab, Politecnico di Milano, to fill the gap of a modular, standard hardware platform for rapid development of complex mechatronic systems. Based on the Rapid Robot Prototyping (R2P) approach, it enables the creation of flexible, scalable, and professional solutions in robotics, mechatronics, and IoT, reducing time, cost, and complexity.
enablingTechnologies: R2P uses standard hardware modules linked via daisy chain using RTCAN protocol and publish/subscribe middleware. Its distributed architecture ensures modularity, fault tolerance, real-time performance, and scalability. Each module features an ARM MCU and CAN bus support.
mainApplications: R2P is a modular hardware/software platform for rapid development of robotic and mechatronic systems. It includes interoperable modules connected via real-time middleware, enabling high-performance distributed systems. Modules cover motor control, sensing, and communication, and support ROS or CANopen integration.
payoff: Design and marketing of innovative hardware and software components for the development of robotic applications.
targetCustomers: Nova Labs targets service robot and mechatronic device manufacturers, research labs, and universities. Ideal customers operate in high-innovation fields and seek flexible, professional, and easily integrable solutions for robotics, automation, and embedded development.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Nautilus - Navigation in Space
abstract: Nautilus offera interplanetary navigation services for SmallSats. Leveraging NASA software and proprietary algorithms, it delivers cost-effective, end-to-end solutions for deep space scientific and commercial missions.
businessTraction: 2024: MoU signed with Tyvak International Srl. Objective: to develope innovative solutions for space exploration and small satellite applications.
competitiveAdvantages: NautiluS is the first European private operator specialized in interplanetary navigation for SmallSats. It provides a full, tailored, high-knowledge service at 50% lower cost than agencies. Technical expertise, lightweight infrastructure, and a lack of direct competitors ensure a strong competitive edge.
description: NautiluS is a spin-off from Politecnico di Milano and the University of Bologna offering interplanetary navigation services for SmallSats. The goal is to reduce ground operation costs by 50%, making deep space scientific and commercial missions economically viable through advanced expertise in Orbit Determination and Control.
enablingTechnologies: The technology leverages NASA’s MONTE software, in-house developed algorithms, and advanced physics-based models. It supports all navigation phases and uses lightweight, flexible tracking infrastructure tailored to SmallSat missions.
mainApplications: NautiluS offers full navigation services for SmallSats on interplanetary missions—from pre-launch trajectory design to flight control and approach. Using NASA's MONTE software and proprietary algorithms, each service is mission-customized and delivers agency-grade performance at significantly reduced cost.

owners.name: Alma Mater Studiorum Università di Bologna

payoff: Small satellites for deep space navigation.
targetCustomers: In the short term, NautiluS targets public space agencies (ESA, ASI) for scientific missions. In the long term, it will serve private companies conducting commercial operations in deep space, such as asteroid or planetary resource extraction.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: Narvalo
abstract: Narvalo develops high-performance urban masks to improve air quality, integrating BLS filters, environmental sensors, and sustainable fabrics.
businessTraction: Winner of Switch2Product 2019, Narvalo was accelerated by PoliHub.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Advanced protection with BLS activated carbon filter against fine dust, viruses, bacteria, and pollen
  • Optimal comfort for commuters and athletes
  • Italian design developed at Politecnico di Milano
  • Eco-sustainable materials and recyclable filters
  • Smart mask with integrated sensors
  • Digital platform for monitoring and user support
  • Full product life cycle management with industrial partner.
description: Narvalo develops high-performance urban masks to improve air quality, integrating BLS filters, environmental sensors, and sustainable fabrics. The project supports a circular economy by recovering end-of-life components.
enablingTechnologies: Narwhal Urban Mask is available in both Base and Smart versions. The Smart version includes electronics, sensors, a fan, and a mobile app to monitor breathing, filter status, and air quality. It is equipped with a BLS FFP3 filter, customizable 3D fabric, and antibacterial treatments.
mainApplications: Narwhal Urban Mask is a hi-tech face mask designed for urban commuters: it protects against smog, viruses, pollen, and odors with a replaceable activated carbon filter. Made from breathable, washable, and durable 3D fabric, it ensures comfort with a discreet fastening system. The smart version features an air-regulating fan to reduce heat and humidity. Connected to a digital platform, it tracks usage, filter status, and air quality. Sustainable and design-forward, it also includes filter replacement and recycling services.
payoff: Research, development, and design of high-tech respiratory protection devices.
targetCustomers:
Our main target groups are:

  • Urban Commuters (aged 35–55), individuals who travel daily in cities and are exposed to urban pollution;
  • Urban Athletes, people who train in urban environments with high respiratory risks;
  • Medical users, individuals with respiratory vulnerabilities such as asthma, allergies, or weakened immune systems.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Modelta
abstract: MODELTA is a spin-off born from the collaboration between TU Eindhoven and Politecnico di Milano, aiming to provide advanced software solutions and consulting for membrane reactors.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Based on widely adopted software platforms;
  • Implement proprietary correlations for predicting performance and losses within membrane reactors;
  • Calibrated using experimental data from unique laboratory setups in the membrane reactor sector;
  • Deep understanding of chemical processes for optimal integration, maximizing cost and performance benefits compared to traditional solutions.
description: MODELTA is a spin-off born from the collaboration between TU Eindhoven and Politecnico di Milano, aiming to provide advanced software solutions and consulting for membrane reactors. Leveraging experience from European projects (REFORCELL, FERRET, FLUIDCELL, BIONICO, MACBETH), it develops models and simulations for hydrogen production and industrial process optimization. The team works closely with academic and industrial partners to deliver cutting-edge tools and keep models state-of-the-art.
enablingTechnologies: MODELTA develops advanced membrane reactor models, overcoming the limitations of commercial software through detailed and accurate simulations. It offers licenses for its proprietary codes and consulting services for the efficient integration of membrane reactors into industrial processes.
mainApplications:
The spin-off's offering is structured into three main activities:

  1. Development and licensing of software related to membranes or membrane reactors, enabling integration with commercial simulation tools for industrial chemical processes;
  2. Design of membrane reactors and their implementation to optimize and enhance industrial processes;
  3. Modeling services for processes involving membranes and/or membrane reactors.
payoff: Development of process models with membranes or membrane reactors, along with related software development and sales activities.
targetCustomers: MODELTA’s target customers are medium and large companies in the chemical-energy sector seeking to reduce environmental impact and operational costs. Potential end-users include biodiesel producers (Oleon, Total, ADM), pharmaceutical and biolubricant companies (Roche, Bayer, Croda), and marine engine manufacturers (MAN Diesel).

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: MIRAITEK
abstract: Miraitek is a company that designs, develops, and markets innovative IT systems for the connection, monitoring, control, and maintenance of industrial equipment. It also offers services that support digital transformation, helping companies enhance their value.
competitiveAdvantages: The application allows manufacturers and users of industrial equipment to stay constantly connected to their devices, recording operational parameters, warnings, and alarms in real time. The analytics modules process the data to generate indicators such as Overall Equipment Effectiveness (OEE) and Remaining Useful Life (RUL), enabling condition-based maintenance. The system easily integrates custom algorithms for anomaly detection, predictive maintenance, and machine learning, including the use of Python libraries tailored to the specific process.
description: The entrepreneurial project was born in the context of the Fourth Industrial Revolution, characterized by the adoption of enabling technologies such as IoT and cloud computing in the industrial sector. Within the Manufacturing Group of the School of Management, research projects like White-R and Touchplant led to the development of a digital platform for monitoring the operational data of industrial equipment. The project builds on these results by offering the platform to machinery manufacturers, positioning itself at the forefront of technological innovation.
enablingTechnologies: The monitoring technology implies a web application accessible from mobile devices, high configurability and flexibility, quick installation, compatibility with standard communication protocols, and data transmission via MQTT.
mainApplications:
The initiative focuses on:

  1. the design, development, management, and commercialization of innovative IT solutions for the connection, monitoring, control, and maintenance of industrial equipment and objects;
  2. related training and innovation activities;
  3. the design and creation of high-tech hardware, software, and applications;
  4. technical support for proprietary or third-party products and systems;
  5. software updates related to its own products and advanced technological solutions.
payoff: Software production and related activities.
targetCustomers:
The target customers are:

  • users of industrial equipment, with heterogeneous machine fleets and the need for standard monitoring (e.g., runtime, counters, alarms) through low-cost gateways;
  • machinery manufacturers, who require advanced monitoring, remote access via VPN, and integrated solutions, adopting embedded PCs for comprehensive management of their machine fleets and related services.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: MgShell
abstract: MgShell is a spin-off from Politecnico di Milano that develops an innovative medical device for the controlled release of anti-VEGF drugs in the treatment of age-related macular degeneration.
businessTraction: 2025: closed a €1’140’000 seed funding round, led by Capital Cell with participations from existing investors (Club degli Investitori, Italian Angels for Biotech, and Bios Line Holding).
competitiveAdvantages: MgShell offers an innovative solution for age-related macular degeneration (AMD), delivering the equivalent of monthly treatment with a single injection—reducing risks, costs, and hospital visits. It improves patient adherence, expands the treatable population, and helps prevent vision loss. The device is biodegradable, biocompatible, autonomous, and requires no external activation. In a market lacking comparable systems, it addresses the rising incidence of AMD and offers high scalability for other clinical applications.
description: MgShell develops an innovative medical device for the controlled release of anti-VEGF drugs in the treatment of age-related macular degeneration. Born from a real clinical need, the system reduces the number of required intravitreal injections, improving patient compliance and easing the burden on healthcare systems. A single administration ensures effective and less invasive treatment, with the potential for global impact.
enablingTechnologies: MgShell’s enabling technology is its shell-by-shell structure made of biodegradable magnesium alloy, engineered to release the drug at predetermined intervals without external input. Miniaturization will be achieved through techniques such as water jet cutting or stent manufacturing processes.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: MgShell is an innovative biodegradable medical device for the controlled release of anti-VEGF drugs in the treatment of age-related macular degeneration. Composed of concentric shells made of a magnesium alloy, it autonomously releases monthly doses of the drug through the programmed degradation of the material. Biocompatible and already clinically approved for other applications, it significantly reduces the number of annual injections, improves patient compliance, and effectively replicates current therapy.
payoff: Intraocular device for drug delivery in the treatment of macular degeneration.
targetCustomers: MgShell primarily targets patients over 70 affected by age-related macular degeneration (AMD), improving their quality of life while reducing the burden on family members and caregivers. The secondary customers are ophthalmic pharmaceutical companies seeking to innovate AMD treatment. Healthcare systems will also benefit through increased efficiency and reduced costs.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: MCE – Multiscale Catalysis & Engineering Solutions
abstract: MCE – Multiscale Catalysis & Engineering Solutions has developed MULTICAT, an innovative multiscale software platform for the modeling, analysis, and optimization of chemical reactors.
competitiveAdvantages: MULTICAT enables accurate modeling of catalytic reactors with up to a 60% reduction in development time and a computational speed-up of 1,000 times, while maintaining high accuracy. Its user-friendly interface simplifies usage even for non-expert users, making chemical reaction engineering more accessible. Thanks to its hybrid physical/data-driven approach, it overcomes the limitations of simplified or black-box models, enabling reliable, scalable simulations that integrate seamlessly with process simulators for optimization and control.
description: MCE – Multiscale Catalysis & Engineering Solutions s.r.l. is a spin-off specialized in chemical and catalytic engineering, developing MULTICAT, an innovative multiscale software platform for the modeling, analysis, and optimization of chemical reactors. Based on machine learning and physical models, it provides advanced tools for industry and research, aiming to revolutionize catalysis with a focus on sustainability.
enablingTechnologies: MULTICAT is built on a multiscale modeling platform that integrates proprietary machine learning algorithms with rigorous physical models, enabling the complete simulation of catalytic reactors—from the atomic scale to the process scale—with high accuracy and low computational cost.
mainApplications: MULTICAT is an advanced multiscale software platform for the modeling of catalytic reactors, capable of simulating the entire reactor from the atomistic to the process scale. Leveraging proprietary machine learning algorithms and physical models, it enables the automatic generation of accurate and lightweight surrogate models, ideal for real-time monitoring, control, and integration with process simulators. The offering includes software updates, training, and customized professional services.
payoff: A software platform designed to optimize the analysis, design, and control of chemical reactions through a multiscale approach.
targetCustomers: The target market for multiscale simulation software (including kinetics, spectroscopy, and reactor simulations) in the field of chemical industry and process control consists primarily of chemical manufacturers, refineries, laboratories, and research and educational institutions.

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: LyoTech
abstract: LyoTech designs and develops innovative systems with high technological value to monitor the well-being of the person who lives alone at home and reassure family members and caregivers.
competitiveAdvantages: LyoTech stands out for its system modularity, scalability, and integration with already certified and widely used hardware devices. Its true added value lies in proprietary machine learning algorithms for behavior analysis, anomaly detection, and the calculation of well-being indicators. The system has been validated in real-world environments (e.g., “Il paese ritrovato”) and offers a significant competitive advantage in personalized monitoring, the ability to adapt to a patient’s evolving condition, and seamless integration with existing infrastructures.
description: LyoTech is a spin-off from Politecnico di Milano established to develop advanced technological solutions for monitoring elderly and vulnerable individuals in home and residential settings. The company offers a modular, scalable, and non-intrusive system based on sensors and intelligent algorithms to enhance quality of life, ensure safety, and promote independence. LyoTech operates within the silver economy, a rapidly growing sector both nationally and internationally.
enablingTechnologies: The technology combines environmental and wearable sensors, IoT infrastructure, cloud computing, and machine learning algorithms. The innovation lies in the software, which transforms raw data into indicators of well-being, social interaction, and physical activity.
mainApplications: LyoTech offers an integrated monitoring system consisting of a hardware platform (environmental sensors, wearable devices, antennas) and software components (analysis algorithms, notifications, and a mobile app). Services include activity and anomaly detection, localization, analysis of physical, social, and mental well-being, monitoring of ADLs and HRQoL, and data collection through apps and web interfaces. The system is configurable for assisted living facilities, nursing homes, day centers, and private residences. It is designed to be flexible, adaptable, and easy to install.
payoff: Systems for active aging, supporting cognitive decline and aiding in the management and monitoring of an individual’s condition.
targetCustomers: LyoTech’s target customers include senior residences, nursing homes (RSA), day centers, social and healthcare facilities, families with vulnerable individuals, public entities, social cooperatives, and municipal administrations. The system is designed to improve the quality of care services, optimize costs, prevent critical issues, and support clinical and management decision-making.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Lithium Lasers
abstract: Development and production of Ultrafast lasers, capable of emitting light extremely concentrated in time and space, enabling R&D, industrial, and medical applications with a level of precision unattainable using traditional techniques.
competitiveAdvantages:
LithiumLasers' strengths include:

  1. a patented technology (Non Linear Mirror Soliton Mode Locking) that eliminates thermal issues, enhancing reliability and lifespan;
  2. a proprietary platforms for development and production that reduce time and costs;
  3. highly customizable products with fast delivery;
  4. competitive pricing up to 30% lower than market leaders;
  5. strategic academic ties with Politecnico di Milano;
  6. commercial partnerships with global distributors experienced in the photonics sector.
description: LithiumLasers is a spin-off focused on the design and production of high-performance ultrafast lasers for scientific and industrial applications. The company was founded with the goal of overcoming the reliability limits of traditional lasers, thanks to a patented technology that drastically reduces heat within the laser cavity. Based in Lecco, LithiumLasers benefits from its connection with Politecnico di Milano and positions itself as an innovative, competitive, and highly specialized player in a rapidly growing market.
enablingTechnologies: LithiumLasers employs the patented Non Linear Mirror Soliton Mode Locking technology, which replaces traditional SESAMs by eliminating thermal absorption in the laser cavity. It also uses two proprietary platforms (SDP and SMP) for fast and scalable design and production.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
LithiumLasers develops two main products:

  • LithiumSix, compact and reliable ultrafast lasers delivering 100 fs pulses and power up to 15 W, ideal for advanced research and biomedical imaging;
  • LithiumSeven, a high-energy system for industrial micromachining, capable of pulses up to 100 μJ at low repetition rates for precision ablation.

Both products offer optional features such as harmonic generation and spectral broadening, and are built on proprietary platforms to enable rapid customization and cost efficiency.
payoff: Development and production of Ultrafast lasers.
targetCustomers: Target customers include research laboratories, universities, and companies active in biomedical imaging, neuroscience, femtochemistry, and nonlinear optics (for LithiumSix), as well as system integrators and industries in micromachining, ophthalmology, and medical devices (for LithiumSeven). Potential clients also include companies like Canon, Zeiss, and innovative start-ups such as Femtoprint.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: Innovative Security Solutions (ISS)
abstract: Intelligent Bin Picking: with 3D CPS systems, the model of the set piece is located within the point cloud regardless of the color of the object and normal ambient lighting conditions.
competitiveAdvantages:
In the field of quality and process control, ISS is able to offer the customer innovative and customized solutions tailored to specific needs for in-line production quality control.
In particular:

  • dimensional conformity checks
  • assembly correctness checks
  • surface integrity inspections
  • alphanumeric code reading using OCR algorithms
description:
ISS has extensive experience in various industrial measurement fields, including:

  • 2D and 3D vision systems
  • active triangulation systems
  • time-of-flight systems
  • traditional sensors
    and the most advanced data analysis methodologies.

In particular, ISS develops and markets innovative, high-tech solutions for:

  • 3D robot guidance
  • quality and process control

Effective implementation of these technologies is the foundation of high-quality, flexible production systems—key features for staying competitive in today’s global industrial market.
enablingTechnologies:
Laser triangulation and coded structured light scanning technology, featuring:

  • sub-millimetre measurement accuracy
  • minimum sensitivity to external light
  • high scanning speed.

It uses 3D pattern matching algorithms based on a surface-based approach.
mainApplications:
ISS’s flagship product is the 3D CPS (3D Control and Picking Solution), an innovative embedded 3D robot guidance system that integrates all the measurement and analysis functions needed to enable any robot to pick parts randomly arranged in a bin or container.

3D CPS eliminates the need for traditional machine feeding strategies, making the entire procedure highly flexible and easily reconfigurable.
payoff: Welcome to the age of Smart Bin Picking
targetCustomers: ISS's target customers include the industrial sector (video surveillance companies), the forensic sector (courts, law enforcement, expert consultants), the banking and insurance sectors (for branch and ATM security), local authorities (for urban surveillance), and public and private research centers active in the security field.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Idea Bioprocess Technology
abstract: Idea Bioprocess produces and commercializes laboratory equipment for scientific/industrial research and service laboratories in the field of environmental biotechnology.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Innovative methodology for measuring both the gas produced and the gas consumed;
  • User-configurable solutions regarding mixing and heating modes. Competitors do not offer this flexibility, providing only a single option for mixing and heating;
  • Marketing of optional technical tools and Excel/OpenOffice macros that simplify data analysis;
  • The possibility to sell even a single fermentation unit. This allows the customer to test the product with a very limited expense before making a more significant investment.
description:
Idea Bioprocess is an innovative startup focused on the production and commercialization of laboratory equipment for scientific/industrial research and service laboratories in the field of environmental biotechnology.

Its goal is to develop instruments that enable the study of the following biological processes:

  • anaerobic digestion,
  • aerobic processes for organic matter removal,
  • anammox and biological denitrification processes,
  • fermentations in general,
  • ruminal reactions.
enablingTechnologies: The technology combines volumetric and manometric principles to measure gas production continuously and safely. It uses a cell with a barrier liquid that acts as a hydraulic valve, preventing high pressures, moving parts, and actuators, ensuring simplicity, low cost, and high reliability.
mainApplications: We intend to manufacture products composed of fermentation/bioreaction units arranged in parallel, supplied under batch or continuous conditions and equipped with means to control temperature, pH and mixing, as well as with devices to measure gas volume. The possibility of developing control units—modifiable by an experienced client—based on software such as MATHWORKS (MATLAB) and/or National Instruments (LABVIEW) is also being taken into account.
payoff: Development and production of laboratory bioreactors.
targetCustomers:
Target customers include:

  • academic and industrial research laboratories
  • service laboratories for full-scale plants
  • plant operators
  • biotech companies
  • animal feed industry companies.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: HMDrive
abstract: HMDrive develops the technology required for creating in-vehicle AR experiences through holographic glasses. HMDrive is the future of vechicle-driver interface.
competitiveAdvantages:
The main strength of HMDrive lies in its innovative real-time localization system, based on commercial-grade sensors, which enables the stable and accurate use of AR holographic glasses onboard moving vehicles.

This technology allows for immersive AR experiences—previously only possible in static environments—enhancing visual engagement, safety, and productivity. Applications range from motorsports to industry, enabling advanced interaction between the user, the vehicle, and the environment through wearable devices.
description:
HMDrive originates from research conducted by the Move group at DEIB, Politecnico di Milano, and aims to develop, engineer, and commercialize a hardware/software platform for Augmented Reality experiences onboard moving vehicles.

The team will focus primarily on algorithm and software development, while hardware production will be carried out in partnership with technology companies. The goal is to deliver innovative AR solutions to enhance safety, navigation, and infotainment in the automotive sector.
enablingTechnologies: The HMDrive platform combines advanced sensors, computational systems, and a high-tech AR headset. It employs innovative localization algorithms, including computer vision-based methods. It goes beyond traditional Head-Up Displays by offering an immersive, stable, and realistic AR experience.
mainApplications:
The HMDrive product integrates a computational module and a holographic headset equipped with sensors capable of real-time localization of the AR device relative to both the vehicle and the external environment.

This innovation enables stable and realistic AR content visualization, either vehicle-locked or anchored to the outside world. The system leverages sensor and vehicle data to ensure precision and continuity in visualization, opening new possibilities in onboard safety, navigation, and entertainment.
payoff: Improving driving experience and safety with automotive augmented reality
targetCustomers: HMDrive’s target customers are manufacturers of industrial vehicles and high-performance sports cars. The former seek solutions that enhance safety, productivity, and the driving experience, while the latter look for cutting-edge technologies to increase engagement and enjoyment. Both aim to differentiate themselves in the market through innovation.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: HelioSwitch
abstract: HelioSwitch develops solutions to optimize the use of flexibility in the electricity balancing market.
businessTraction:
• Users of the services: agsm aim, Nova aeg, Iren, Bluenergy, Raiffeisen Energy, Inxieme energia;
  • Users of custom-made algorithms: Terna, Entso, Illumia.
competitiveAdvantages:
HelioSwitch overcomes the limitations of deterministic forecasting by offering probabilistic predictions that integrate meteorological and model uncertainties—crucial for optimizing flexibility in the dispatching market.

By combining machine learning with Monte Carlo simulations, the platform enables early identification of critical moments in the power system, maximizing operator revenues through the optimal dispatch of resources such as storage, demand response, and electric vehicles.
description:
HelioSwitch S.R.L. is an innovative startup that develops solutions to optimize the use of flexibility in the electricity balancing market.
Born from experience in the TERNA and ENTSO-E sectors, it combines advanced nuclear simulation methods with Bayesian neural networks to manage the uncertainty and complexity of renewable energy sources.

It offers a cloud-based platform to support energy operators in maximizing the value of flexible assets, addressing the challenges of an increasingly distributed and variable power system.
enablingTechnologies: HelioSwitch adopts an innovative approach based on probabilistic weather forecasts (ENSEMBLE) with Uncertainty Quantification, Bayesian neural networks to estimate zonal imbalances, and Monte Carlo optimization for hourly resource dispatch, integrating dynamics across energy markets.
mainApplications:
Using Monte Carlo simulations, Perturbation Theory, and Bayesian neural networks, it supports BRPs in improving consumption forecasting and reducing imbalance costs, and helps BSPs optimally dispatch the flexibility of their assets—such as Virtual Power Plants—by estimating generation, demand, and price spike risk.

The platform provides predictive tools that combine uncertainty modeling with high forecasting accuracy.
payoff: Research and experimental development in other natural sciences and engineering.
revenueModel: HelioSwitch offers a B2B cloud platform delivering advanced services for the electricity market in a SaaS model.
targetCustomers: During the initial development phases, the emerging needs of small and medium-sized energy traders and renewable energy producers were carefully assessed. These actors often struggle to operate in a rapidly evolving context, lacking software tools to manage forecast uncertainties related to weather data.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: GReD
abstract: Research and experimental development in other natural sciences and engineering.
competitiveAdvantages:
GReD enables high-precision monitoring and positioning at accessible costs by leveraging single-frequency GNSS receivers and proprietary algorithms.
It reduces costs compared to traditional geodetic technologies and complements existing systems by providing independent and absolute information.

Its strong connection with the academic world ensures continuous scientific updates and cutting-edge solutions, delivered through a flexible, adaptable, and technologically advanced approach.
description:
GReD (Geomatic Research and Development) is a spin-off of Politecnico di Milano, founded in collaboration with Galileian Plus. It positions itself as a center of excellence in the research and development of innovative solutions based on geomatic technologies.

The company leverages the expertise of the Geomatics Laboratory at the Como campus, aiming to transfer knowledge and technology to the market—particularly in the fields of infrastructure monitoring, precision navigation, and territorial analysis.
enablingTechnologies: GReD’s enabling technologies include GNSS systems, satellite remote sensing, and photogrammetry, all integrated with proprietary algorithms developed for advanced geospatial data processing. The use of low-cost receivers enables innovative and accessible applications.
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications:
GReD develops algorithms for GNSS data processing, designs solutions for precision positioning and the monitoring of infrastructure and territory, analyzes satellite and gravimetric data, and provides engineering services and training in the field of geomatics.

It also offers end-to-end systems for structural deformation monitoring and mobility-related safety applications. GReD delivers customized software tools and solutions based on low-cost GNSS receivers.
payoff: Research and experimental development in other natural sciences and engineering.
targetCustomers:
GReD’s target customers include professional surveyors, public authorities, companies operating in infrastructure monitoring, positioning service providers, port authorities, tourism operators, and space agencies such as ASI and ESA.

The commercial approach is primarily B2B, with offerings also directed toward major institutional clients.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: Gel Proximity
abstract: GEL Proximity is Europe’s leading technology fully dedicated to Out-of-Home (OOH) logistics services. Its software acts as a technological connector, offering access to hundreds of thousands of Pickup Points and Lockers managed by major national and international last-mile logistics operators.
businessTraction: More than 300,000 Collection Points available between newsstands, stationeries, post offices, lockers, tobacconists and service stations belonging to the main national and international Out Of Home operators.
competitiveAdvantages:
GEL Proximity is revolutionizing last-mile logistics by offering online shoppers greater control and flexibility through thousands of Pickup Points, all accessible via a single integration. It enhances the shopping experience, reduces cart abandonment, and supports local returns.

By promoting sustainable logistics, GEL helps cut urban traffic and pollution. With ready-to-use, easily integrable solutions, it is also ideal for SMEs and fosters both social and environmental innovation—becoming a trusted partner for merchants, logistics providers, and local governments.
description:
GEL Proximity is Europe’s leading technology fully dedicated to Out-of-Home (OOH) logistics services. Its software acts as a technological connector, offering access to hundreds of thousands of Pickup Points and Lockers managed by major national and international last-mile logistics operators.

The company’s mission is to promote sustainability and support the growth of the eCommerce channel, with a strong focus on environmental responsibility, urban logistics, and emission reduction—favoring delivery and pickup point systems.
enablingTechnologies: GEL Proximity integrates multiple logistics operators into a single flexible platform via API, managing labels, tracking, returns, and analytics. It supports ready-to-use eCommerce plugins and incorporates AI, IoT, and Blockchain technologies to optimize logistics, security, and parcel traceability.
mainApplications:
GEL Proximity is a B2B platform that aggregates the main last-mile operators, offering merchants a single technological integration to access a wide network of pickup points. It reduces costs, time, and IT complexity, simplifying logistics management.

GEL expands the reachable customer base compared to individual networks, delivering value to eCommerce businesses, logistics providers, and couriers—especially in a fast-growing market accelerated by new post-Covid consumer habits.
payoff: A platform that brings together the main Italian proximity-based delivery networks.
revenueModel: B2B platform that aggregates the main last-mile operators, offering merchants a single technological integration to access a wide network of pickup points.
targetCustomers:
GEL is a B2B-only service dedicated to all players in Italy involved in the sale, preparation, handling, and delivery of parcels. GEL targets:

  • Merchants (stores and marketplaces)
  • Fulfillment providers (logistics operators)
  • Couriers

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: EYE4NIR
abstract: EYE4NIR is a spin-off of Politecnico di Milano and Roma Tre University, born from the development of an innovative dual-band VIS/SWIR image sensor based on germanium-on-silicon thin films.
businessTraction: Winner of awards such as S2P, StartCup Lombardia, and PNI.
competitiveAdvantages:
Thanks to its innovative germanium-on-silicon technology, EYE4NIR makes SWIR imaging accessible at low cost, enabling new applications in automotive, security, and quality control.
The VIS/SWIR sensor integrates pixel-level image fusion and enables electro-optical hyperspectral imaging without filters or moving parts.
Compatibility with standard microelectronics processes ensures reliability, scalability, and large-scale manufacturing, offering competitive advantages and flexibility in selecting production partners.
description:
EYE4NIR is a spin-off of Politecnico di Milano and Roma Tre University, born from the development of an innovative dual-band VIS/SWIR image sensor based on germanium-on-silicon thin films. The technology enables advanced imaging at low cost, overcoming the limitations of traditional InGaAs SWIR sensors.

EYE4NIR aims to revolutionize sectors like automotive, security, and industry with sensors compatible with standard CMOS manufacturing.
enablingTechnologies: The EYE4NIR sensor integrates Ge and Si photodiodes in a back-to-back configuration, operating across the VIS and SWIR bands. By switching the bias polarity, the active band is selected, while the sensor’s nonlinear voltage response enables compact spectrometry.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
EYE4NIR is developing a low-cost SWIR image sensor based on germanium thin films integrated on silicon, compatible with standard CMOS processes. The sensor detects both VIS and SWIR light (up to 1.6 µm) through a back-to-back dual-diode structure, which enables spectral discrimination by switching the polarity of the applied voltage.

Moreover, by leveraging the device’s nonlinear response, it is possible to achieve hyperspectral imaging through a fully electro-optical method, unlocking new applications across multiple sectors.
payoff: Sensors for spectrometer implementation.
revenueModel: EYE4NIR will operate in the B2B market, targeting camera module manufacturers.
targetCustomers: EYE4NIR main customers will include camera suppliers for the automotive sector, such as DENSO, Bosch, and Continental AG. EYE4NIR will position itself among sensor suppliers, within a value chain that also includes companies like FLIR and Xenics.

trl.label: 2 - Formulation of a technological concept

title: ES+
abstract: The spin-off was founded to develop and commercialize decision support systems (DSS) for companies across all sectors.
competitiveAdvantages:
The DSS tools offered adopt a scientific approach to strategic decision-making, providing indicators useful for business plans and industrial planning. They are neutral with respect to the sale of technologies or services and are based on benchmarks derived from rigorous, nationally recognized research.

Offered in an “as-a-service” model, they are also accessible to SMEs.
The databases behind the tools are continuously updated through collaboration with the Department of Management Engineering.
description:
The spin-off was founded to develop and commercialize decision support systems (DSS) for companies across all sectors. Built on over 20 years of research, it offers tools for innovation and energy management, with planned extensions into patents, circular economy, and new product launches.

The goal is to make DSS solutions accessible via a web-based platform in SaaS mode. The initiative includes system design, continuous updates, technical support, and training—enabling more informed, faster, and more effective strategic decisions in complex environments.
enablingTechnologies: DSS tools of ES+, built on unique databases resulting from 200 research projects, provide strategic support to companies through qualitative and quantitative assessments. They are delivered in SaaS mode, constantly updated, and accessible from any device.
mainApplications:
The spin-off has developed two DSS tools: the first supports companies in innovation management by comparing their processes with best practices based on a database of over 1.2 million companies and identifying key areas for improvement.
The second helps businesses assess the economic feasibility and environmental impact of technologies for energy production or savings, estimating potential benefits—including grid services—under different regulatory scenarios.
payoff: Software for strategic decision support (DSS – Decision Support Systems)
revenueModel: SaaS, directly accessible through the web platform.
targetCustomers:
The market analysis identifies three target groups:

  1. industrial and tertiary energy users, who seek savings but rely on non-neutral assessments;
  2. energy producers, who evaluate investments without up-to-date scientific tools;
  3. technology/service providers, who would benefit from third-party evaluations to support the adoption of efficient solutions.

trl.label: 2 - Formulation of a technological concept

title: Enigma
abstract: ENIGMA is the first system that ensures product authenticity and traceability at every stage of production through a unique, secure, cost-effective, and easy-to-use multi-ink code.
competitiveAdvantages:
ENIGMA is virtually impossible to replicate: it uses nanostructures that are invisible to any microscopic technique, unstable in air, and present in minimal quantities within the inks. The optical reader, simple and low-cost, detects only the unique spectral signature of the active material.

Codes are generated from customized ink sequences with distinctive optical signals. Replicating them would require identifying each material, reading technique, and wavelength, and developing advanced instrumentation—making reverse engineering extremely difficult, even for experts with dedicated equipment.
description:
ENIGMA is the first system that ensures product authenticity and traceability at every stage of production through a unique, secure, cost-effective, and easy-to-use multi-ink code.
With over 10²⁵ possible combinations, the system is highly scalable and impossible to replicate thanks to the continuous development of new inks.

The optical reader uses a highly selective physical technique to accurately recognize each ink, ensuring the unique identification of the code and delivering a higher level of security compared to current market technologies.
enablingTechnologies: ENIGMA introduces printed codes using unique nanotechnology-based inks that are non-replicable and verifiable only with a proprietary optical reader based on an innovative physical principle, offering accuracy two orders of magnitude higher than current systems.
mainApplications:
ENIGMA offers a physical multi-ink code based on nano-engineered inks that are difficult to replicate and can be printed directly on products or as labels. The portable optical reader uniquely identifies each ink with high reliability, sending the data to a database that verifies the product’s authenticity.
The system is easily integrable into production processes and enables label miniaturization. ENIGMA ensures traceability, security, and versatility across sectors such as packaging, documents, and artworks.
payoff: Development and commercialization of a multi-ink code system offering numerous unique combinations.
targetCustomers: The technology is extremely versatile and potentially applicable to many other markets requiring more secure anti-counterfeiting systems, such as pharmaceutical packaging, medical device packaging, the precious materials supply chain, the design industry, and selected sectors of the food market (e.g., certified “Made in Italy” export supply chains).

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: Enersem
abstract: ENERSEM offers advanced energy technology services to public and private customers, integrating expertise on electricity markets, smart grids, renewables, energy efficiency and regulation.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Regulatory compliance and updating: continuous support in adapting to national and European regulations;
  • Flexibility and exploitation of consumption: active demand management (DSM), useful to reduce costs and access new markets (MSD);
  • Reliability for critical systems: dedicated solutions for Data Centers (CED) with energy ratings and certifications according to ANSI/TIA-942 standards;
  • Strategic support for investors: market analysis, business plans and feasibility studies to guide investments in innovative energy technologies and models.
description: ENERSEM offers advanced energy technology services to public and private customers, integrating expertise on electricity markets, smart grids, renewables, energy efficiency and regulation. Provides technical-scientific, application, normative and economic analyses to support strategic decisions and investments in the energy sector. The approach includes complex plant studies (e.g. CED), techno-economic assessments and ongoing advisory, helping producers, consumers and investors to seize opportunities and manage risks in the context of the energy transition.
enablingTechnologies: ENERSEM uses low cost, MODBUS-compatible and non-invasive wireless sensor networks. The data collected is managed by dedicated software for analysis, visualization and archiving. Dynamic simulation models, based on real data, estimate the effectiveness of interventions.
mainApplications: ENERSEM provides feasibility studies, energy diagnostics, SEU/RIU management support, participation in the MSD and design of complex systems such as CEDs. The solutions are based on HW/SW tools for monitoring, simulation and optimization, offering strategic and technical support to investors and operators in the energy sector.
payoff: The solutions that others do not see.
targetCustomers:
ENERSEM targets three segments:

  • residential (focus on large property managers interested in smart and green building solutions),
  • tertiary (SMEs, large companies, public and private bodies, including ESCOs and utilities), and
  • industrial (large consumers and SMEs through consortia), offering advanced services for efficiency and innovation.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: Drone Radio Beacon
abstract: Drone Radio Beacon (DRB) is a hardware+software system developed by Nuvidea srls to enhance drone flight precision by complementing GPS with centimeter-level localization.
competitiveAdvantages:
Currently, there are no comparable solutions to DRB for UAVs. The system, based on a ground-based radio reference, ensures centimeter-level accuracy and consistent reliability regardless of lighting, fog, smoke, or reflections. The onboard transceiver is low-power, as is the ground station, with no impact on drone autonomy.

The device is compact, cost-effective, and easily integrable via serial bus. The RF signal is electronically steerable, making DRB effective even in complex environments—for example, for landings in tight spaces or where obstacles obstruct the line of sight.
description:
Drone Radio Beacon (DRB) is a hardware+software system developed by Nuvidea srls to enhance drone flight precision by complementing GPS with centimeter-level localization.
Launched in 2015 from a project selected by Switch2Product, the system is ideal for precision landings, industrial inspections, and urban deliveries.
enablingTechnologies: DRB consists of an onboard UAV transceiver (DD) and a ground station (RBD). The algorithm processes RF signals (RSSI, phase, propagation time) to estimate the drone’s relative position and guide it with centimeter-level accuracy, dynamically adapting the beamforming in real time.
mainApplications:
DRB is a system that supports autonomous drone flight by complementing GPS. It consists of a ground station and an onboard receiver installed on the UAV (Unmanned Aerial Vehicle). The pad is compact and includes a transmitter, antennas, and batteries, making it adaptable to various scenarios. The receiver can be easily integrated with the drone’s hardware.

Using a proprietary algorithm, the system calculates the drone’s relative position, enabling precise landings and enforcement of No-Fly Zones with centimeter-level accuracy, thereby enhancing safety and reliability in complex operations.
payoff: A system designed to enable safe and reliable automatic drone services with remote management and AI cloud reporting.
targetCustomers:
Initially, we will focus on selling DRB ground pads and providing consulting services to industry professionals and service providers using drones.
Subsequently, we will integrate the necessary expertise to develop and directly offer complete solutions across various sectors where DRB enables innovative applications of drones in automated and autonomous operations.

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: Domopti
abstract: Domopti develops and markets a home automation system for the optimized management of electrical systems, including photovoltaic installations, batteries, electric vehicle charging stations, and household appliances.
competitiveAdvantages:
The competitive advantage lies in the use of a product that leverages years of experience in the development of both optimization models and load forecasting models. In these two areas, the proponents are internationally recognized for the quality of their work.

Another key competitive advantage is the possibility to develop and test the product within the MG2Lab at Politecnico di Milano, and later through collaborations with fellow beta testers. This significantly accelerates the transition from development to real-world application.
description: The business idea is to develop and commercialize a home automation system for monitoring and optimizing energy management, with the goal of minimizing both the cost of electricity supply and the environmental impact associated with powering the home.
enablingTechnologies: The product uses a linear programming optimization model, integrating forecasts from neural networks and LSTM models for energy, loads, and electric vehicles. Two architectures will be tested: local router-based optimization (robust) and cloud-based optimization (more accurate and scalable).
mainApplications:
Compared to existing solutions on the market, the proposed system optimizes the management of components that produce, store, and consume electricity in residential homes, based on the forecast of energy consumption and generation.

The two innovative aspects that distinguish the product from current market offerings are:

  1. optimization through advanced mathematical algorithms, and
  2. forecasting of electricity generation and consumption.

These features make the proposed product unique in today’s market.
payoff: Home automation system for the optimized management of photovoltaic systems, batteries, electric vehicle charging stations, and household appliances.
targetCustomers:
The initial target market for the product is the residential segment with electricity connections above 6 kW; this market includes around 1 million users, representing an ideal size for the product’s initial entry.
Later, once the product is consolidated and development/production costs are reduced, the focus will also expand to lower-capacity markets.

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: CRI
abstract: Cambridge Raman Imaging (CRI) s.r.l. develops advanced Coherent Raman Scattering (CRS) microscopy using ultrafast lasers to digitally image molecular structures in human tissues, distinguishing cancerous from healthy cells without chemical staining.
competitiveAdvantages: CRI scanning CRS microscope accurately distinguishes cancerous from healthy tissue without chemical staining, reducing biopsy times and diagnostic errors. Enhanced by tunable Raman frequencies, it identifies precise chemical compositions, supporting personalized treatment. Future plans include AI-driven diagnostics, endoscopy, automated fluid screening, therapeutic monitoring, infection diagnosis, and single-cell cytopathology, improving outcomes through earlier, less invasive care.
description: Cambridge Raman Imaging (CRI) s.r.l. develops advanced Coherent Raman Scattering (CRS) microscopy using ultrafast lasers to digitally image molecular structures in human tissues, distinguishing cancerous from healthy cells without chemical staining. The company initially targets cancer diagnostics, therapeutic monitoring, and surgical support within the global histopathology market.
enablingTechnologies: CRI fiber-based coherent Raman spectroscopy technology uses synchronized tunable lasers (800-2000 nm), simplifying real-time chemical imaging, reducing cost, and enabling non-specialist clinical use, surpassing traditional Raman microscopy in speed, sensitivity, and diagnostic accuracy.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: The first product is a CRS scanning microscope for hospitals and clinics. Future expansions include endoscopes, automated fluid screening, and diverse industry applications. The system quickly and quantitatively differentiates cancerous cells without chemical staining, addressing current diagnostic limitations like subjectivity, complexity, and cost. Initial applications target rapid histopathology, in-vivo endoscopy, tracking tumour progression without repeated biopsies, and detecting circulating tumour cells in blood.
payoff: Ultrafast lasers and their application in CRS microscopy to detect specific molecular structures and proteins in tissues and cells.
targetCustomers: CRI market entry requires strategic partnerships with established healthcare service providers due to fragmented global supply chains, stringent regulatory certification (e.g., FDA, IVDR), and dominant incumbent relationships. Providers increasingly offer digital storage and second-opinion services, especially in Asia, necessitating collaboration for effective market penetration.

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: Cohaerentia
abstract: Cohaerentia develops, manufactures, and markets an innovative fiber optic sensor called the “Sinottico,” designed to provide an “overview” of complex systems.
competitiveAdvantages:
A key strength of the business idea is the ability to produce a single type of sensor for multiple applications, thereby reducing the number of distinct “products” that need to be developed.
Another strength—stemming from the first—is the business model, which involves the full participation of the client company in the development of the specific application.
description:
Cohaerentia develops, manufactures, and markets an innovative fiber optic sensor called the “Sinottico,” designed to provide an “overview” of complex systems. The sensor is minimally invasive, coherent, agnostic, and intrinsic—ideal for monitoring and diagnostics of production lines and large civil or industrial structures.

The company also works on the development of optical, photonic, electronic, and IT technologies related to sensors and measurement systems, as well as optical communication solutions across various scales, from long-range to ultra-short distances.
enablingTechnologies: The originality of the system lies in its ability to simultaneously collect mechanical, thermal, and magnetic information along the entire sensing fiber. This is made possible by an innovative reception scheme that fully analyzes the phase and polarization state of the optical signal.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
The new fiber optic sensor is minimally invasive, made with standard telecommunications fibers, without active elements or Bragg gratings, ensuring flexibility, durability, and reliability.
It is intrinsic: it directly transduces mechanical, thermal, and magnetic changes in the environment within the fiber itself.
It is coherent: it uses coherent detection to access all components of the signal—amplitude, phase, frequency, and polarization.
Finally, it is agnostic: it collects all environmental information indiscriminately, acting as a passive, neutral, multiphysics transducer.
payoff: Fiber optic sensors.
targetCustomers:
The target market is divided into three main sectors:

  • Complex production lines, involving motion, measurement, and control equipment
  • Large machinery, such as transformers, switchgear, and safety-critical machines in industrial and strategic environments
  • Large industrial and civil infrastructures, including viaducts, tunnels, refineries, and pipelines

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: Cherrydata
abstract: CHERRYDATA is a spin-off from the Department of Electronics, Information, and Bioengineering, specialized in big data & analytics.
competitiveAdvantages:
CHERRYDATA's technological independence will be a key competitive advantage in two ways:

  • Cost efficiency: enabling lower service costs than competitors;
  • High-performance software: developing optimized solutions unburdened by industrial-scale, but inefficient, software stacks.
description: CHERRYDATA is a spin-off from the Department of Electronics, Information, and Bioengineering, specialized in big data & analytics. It provides end-to-end services—from consulting to prototyping—delivering measurable performance impact for businesses. Leveraging EU project experience (e.g., earth observation), it aims to become a commercial service leader, capitalizing on ties with JRC and ESA for revenue and international growth.
enablingTechnologies: CHERRYDATA develops solutions completely independent of proprietary software or open-source libraries licensed under terms other than UPL. This technological independence will be the core principle guiding its platform development.
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications: The company develops advanced big data analytics software, leveraging machine learning and statistics. Technical challenges demand high-efficiency components optimized to handle massive datasets without just scaling computing power. These solutions enable strategic applications like classification, forecasting, recommendations, and optimization—ensuring sustainable speed and cost to maximize client ROI.
payoff: Development and commercialization of a platform for creating and deploying large-scale data management functionalities.
targetCustomers: The target market is cross-sector, covering both service providers and manufacturers across multiple industries, including: large-scale retail, transportation, utilities, earth observation, security, digital marketing, banking, and finance.

trl.label: 2 - Formulation of a technological concept

title: Captive Systems
abstract: MagnetoSponges: the innovative technologies for waste water and gas stream treatment.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Increase in product value;
  • Reduction in wastewater and soil treatment costs;
  • Applicable in case of environmental disasters.
description:
The project originated from a patent filed by Politecnico di Milano, whose inventors are Prof. Davide Moscatelli, Prof. Maurizio Masi, and Eng. Ruggiero Maria Pesce.
Prof. Moscatelli presented the potential of the patent to the companies Gaser and Tecnochimica S.p.A.

The idea is to use the materials covered by the patent to remove metals from the solutions currently used in electroplating companies. In this sector, the two companies would act as promoters of the spin-off’s activities.
enablingTechnologies: The magnetic amphiphilic NPs are water-soluble, oil-affine, and magnetic-field responsive. They are used in treating hydrocarbon-contaminated water, environmental remediation (e.g., oil spills), removal of oils/lubricants, and recovery of bitumen and polluted soils.
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications:
Rather than a single product, this is a class of magnetic materials that can be used to recover pollutants from water, air, and soil. These are amphiphilic magnetite nanoparticles (NPs), stable in water and with affinity for oily phases.

The nanoparticles, produced via co-precipitation of iron salts, are stabilized in water by sulfate groups and aggregate into microparticles with high surface area due to interactions between their lipophilic chains.
The bond between oleic acid and magnetite is covalent, ensuring the stability and functionality of the system.
payoff: MagnetoSponges: the innovative technologies for waste water and gas stream treatment.
targetCustomers: Initially, the target market will be galvanic applications, later expanding to other sectors (e.g., hydrocarbons, chlorinated compounds, silicones, etc).

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: Cap_able
abstract: Cap_able is an innovative startup that combines design and technology to raise awareness about current social issues. Its first project is a patented fabric that, thanks to a proprietary algorithm, blocks facial recognition without covering the face.
competitiveAdvantages:
The Manifesto Collection is the first knitwear fashion line capable of blocking facial recognition, both online and offline. It is the world’s first physical application of adversarial machine learning technology in designer garments.

These items offer full 360-degree protection for the individual, while remaining legal and functional—unlike helmets or masks. Unique in their kind, no other knitwear products protect facial biometric data while remaining wearable and commercially viable.
description:
Cap_able is an innovative startup that combines design and technology to raise awareness about current social issues. Its first project is a patented fabric that, thanks to a proprietary algorithm, blocks facial recognition without covering the face.

Cap_able manufactures in small, certified Italian knitting workshops, promoting craftsmanship and innovation in the Made in Italy tradition.

Through fashion and technology, the company aims to engage young people, build an active community, and grow into a global brand—investing locally and fostering Italian talent.
enablingTechnologies: Cap_able uses an artificial intelligence algorithm to generate adversarial patches—images optimized to confuse facial recognition systems. The patches are translated into jacquard patterns and knitted using computerized machines, ensuring both effectiveness and wearability.
mainApplications:
The Cap_able project introduces a unique innovation: knitted garments that integrate adversarial patches specifically designed to fool person recognition systems.
Unlike printed solutions, these adversarial images are optimized and directly woven into jacquard fabric using electronic knitting machines, ensuring effectiveness, texture, and durability.
