The first collection is made with Filmar cotton, 100% Made in Italy and compliant with the ethical and environmental standards of the Better Cotton Initiative.
payoff: Clothing with integrated adversarial patterns.
targetCustomers: The target customer of Cap_able is between 18 and 35 years old, lives in large cities, is educated, informed, and culturally curious. They care about privacy, human rights, and sustainability. They seek innovative, tech-driven, and design-oriented products with strong ethical value, and view purchasing as a conscious and identity-defining act.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: AS.CAR.I
abstract: The AS.CAR.I project originates from the successful experience of the PoliMove team at the Indy Autonomous Challenge. The founding team, a key player in these competitions, aims to transfer this know-how into driver assistance systems for sports cars—an industry undergoing rapid growth.
competitiveAdvantages:
A key strength of the AS.CAR.I products lies in the sophistication of the implemented algorithms, which enable a level of performance in driving evaluation and active vehicle intervention that cannot be achieved by systems relying solely on satellite positioning or inertial sensors.

Another major advantage is the product’s origin in a racing environment, which has provided valuable know-how on how to best manage high-performance autonomous driving.
competitiveScenario:
The AS.CAR.I passive “coach” has only one competitor: the Garmin Catalyst, a device based on GPS, accelerometers, and a camera. However, it lacks integration with vehicle data, which limits its accuracy.
As for the “active track assistant,” there are currently no commercial alternatives available on the market.
description:
The passive “coach” uses cameras, GPS, and vehicle data to accurately assess driver performance and, through a graphical interface, provides real-time suggestions on racing line and braking.

The “active track assistant” leverages the same data sources and operates in two modes:

  • an autonomous driving mode (SAE Level 2) on the track, used to demonstrate professional driving techniques;
  • an active assistance mode (SAE Level 3), where the driver maintains control, but the system intervenes in hazardous situations.
enablingTechnologies: AS.CAR.I uses advanced state estimation, centimeter-accurate sensor fusion localization, and Model Predictive Control for trajectory management. Unique on the market, its system predicts and reacts to critical situations, integrating actuators for high-performance autonomous driving.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
The AS.CAR.I project originates from the successful experience of the PoliMove team at the Indy Autonomous Challenge. The founding team, a key player in these competitions, aims to transfer this know-how into driver assistance systems for sports cars—an industry undergoing rapid growth.

The first two products are: a passive “coach” that evaluates driver performance, and an active system capable of autonomous driving or intervening in hazardous situations.
payoff: Driver assistance systems for sports cars
revenueModel: AS.CAR.I will enter into a research agreement with Politecnico di Milano to develop autonomous driving technologies through joint projects. Additionally, a licensing agreement is planned for the “virtual fence” patent, which is currently owned by Politecnico di Milano.
targetCustomers:
Manufacturers of mid- to high-level sports vehicles (e.g., Ferrari), hypercar manufacturers (e.g., Dallara), and operators of racetracks for high-performance or safe driving experiences.
This market is experiencing strong growth, with a projected compound annual growth rate (CAGR) exceeding 10% over the next decade.

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: RESCOMP Engineering
abstract: Rescomp Engineering develops and commercialises innovative tools for the design and monitoring of polymer matrix composite materials. Born from more than over 20 years of research, it promotes reliability and sustainability in the industrial, aerospace, automotive, sports and clean energy sectors.
businessTraction: We are currently analysing case studies with leading companies in the automotive, hydrogen and professional sporting goods sectors for structural optimisation using the FLA code and the application of the SHM monitoring system. In parallel, commercial and technical contacts are being developed to expand the adoption of our solutions in various industries.
competitiveAdvantages:
• High computational efficiency for fast and accurate analysis, reducing design and production time and costs, with fewer test campaigns;
  • Accurate predictions thanks to reliable and validated models;
  • Technical support to assist the customer at every design stage;
  • Ability to design components with high mechanical performance and low weight, improving reliability, economic and environmental sustainability, reducing transports emissions.
competitiveScenario:
In the market for advanced composite design software, there are no real competitors to FLA, a tool for fatigue design based on damage evolution. Our structural monitoring system integrates the approach, offering real-time monitoring of the structures' integrity.

Concorrenza
description:
Rescomp is the result of over twenty years research by the composite materials design group of the Department of Management and Engineering of Industrial Systems of the University of Padua. This company offers advanced solutions to optimise the structural reliability of polymer composite matrix components.

Products include:

  • Rescomp FLA ((Fatigue Life Analysis), a software suite for fatigue design based on damage evolution;
  • Rescomp SHM, (Structural Health Monitoring) technology for continuous monitoring of structural integrity in service.
enablingTechnologies:
• Fatigue Life Analysis (FLA) for fatigue design of composites;
  • Structural Integrity Monitoring (SHM) system for real-time control.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
• Performance improvement in terms of lightness, performance and safety for automotive, naval, aerospace, eVTOL and the professional sporting goods industry (high-end bicycle frames and handlebars, pedal cranks, etc.);
  • Safety-oriented design of hydrogen and high-pressure gas storage tanks;
  • Wind energy applications, with a focus on lightness and structural strength.
payoff: We understand composites
revenueModel:
The start-up commercialises software licences (FLA) in customised or standard versions, annual maintenance and upgrades, training and technology assessment with a B2B model.

The SHM system is offered both as an integrated and stand-alone solution for structural monitoring.
targetCustomers:
• Industrial automation companies, professional sporting goods and FEM software manufacturers;
  • High-end cycling companies for structural components (frames, handlebars, cranks);
  • Aerospace (including eVTOL), shipbuilding, automotive sectors;
  • Hydrogen and high-pressure gas storage sector.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: AI2B
abstract: AI2B offers specialized consulting in generative AI. We help companies leverage cutting-edge AI technologies to create unique content, designs, and experiences. A parallel line of business focuses on designing contests for students, STEM graduates, and company personnel.
businessTraction: AI2B is already operating on the market and has concluded between the second half of 2024 and the first half of 2025 several contracts with some SMEs and multinationals, for both its business lines. So far it has not used any third-party capital.
competitiveAdvantages:
Building applications with open-weight Large Language Models (LLM) offers many advantages over the use of proprietary solutions. Here is a clear and concise list of the main advantages:

  • greater completeness,
  • low long-term costs,
  • privacy and data security,
  • technological flexibility;
  • innovation and rapid experimentation.
competitiveScenario: The competitive scenario of AI consulting sees few realities, university origin, able to propose applications and customizations on LLM. Regarding the aspect of edutainment there are several subjects on the market that propose contests and hackathons but no subject has the technical.scientific background of AI2B.
description: AI2B is an academic spin-off of the University of Bari specializing in Generative Artificial Intelligence. It offers advice and customized solutions for companies and institutions, integrating advanced natural language technologies, intelligent RAG agents, recommendation systems and linguistic models adapted to specific domains. With a team of experienced researchers and a strong commitment to innovation, AI2B also carries out edutainment projects for the training and development of skills.
enablingTechnologies: Artificial intelligence
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications: Large Language Models open-weight specific to the Italian language: Llamantino. Original edutainment activities produced by the AI2B team based on artificial intelligence and machine learning.

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Bari Aldo Moro

payoff: Empower your business with Generative Artificial Intelligence!
revenueModel: Specializing in customized AI consulting, we offer proprietary/bespoke models through API/cloud, plus expert training. We integrate LLM into operations, build vertical SaaS using custom models and engage in R&D with industrial/institutional partners.
targetCustomers: P.A., SMEs and Corporates

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: CARBONCHANGE
abstract: Spin-off with an exclusive trading right on the ARMOSA model, which simulates carbon and nitrogen cycles in agriculture. The software solution suite is designed to adapt to the needs of the project and is aligned with CRCF - EU guidelines
competitiveAdvantages:
• Contains application costs;
  • Facilitates access to the method also for agricultural SMEs;
  • Consider possible emissions of GHGs (greenhouse gases) that could be recorded outside the project area;
  • Ensures complete, consistent, transparent, conservative and certified quantification.
description:
The ARMOSA model, developed with cutting-edge methodologies and based on the latest scientific literature, is constantly evolving thanks to advances in research into carbon and plant growth.

Already calibrated for EU27, Ukraine and Moldova, in line with the Verra VM0042 methodology and module VMD0053.

We bring together experts from crop systems modelling, data science and environmental consulting to ensure an effective application of the ARMOSA model in line with your objectives.

We offer flexible solutions, tailor-made quantification services with API access.
enablingTechnologies: Highly scalable and replicable cloud-native software interfaces.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
• Assess the mitigation potential of agricultural practices through a process analysis conducted with a dynamic, physical-based model;
  • Calculate the storage of organic carbon in soil resulting from a change in activity or management technique;
  • Calculate on a daily basis the variables related to soil (e.g., content of organic carbon, nitric and ammoniacal nitrogen, leaching, emission of CO and N O) and crops (e.g. yield, aerial biomass, nitrogen content).
payoff: Digital services for the capture and exploitation of CO2 in agriculture
revenueModel: "Software as a Service" approach which is provided through the operation of a "Carbon Calculator".
targetCustomers: Small and medium-sized farms.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Deplotic
abstract: Deplotic develops IDRA, an inflatable and modular robotic arm designed for more sustainable and efficient space missions. Our technology enables space logistics and in-orbit services operators to expand their capabilities, reducing costs and integration times.
businessTraction:
Deplotic

  • has received grants of €250k and awards of €42k;
  • has been admitted to the ESA-bic incubator. It has won prestigious awards such as the PNI Cube 2024 in the industrial category and the Intellectual Property Award in the space category;
  • has started several collaborations.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Compact at launch: thanks to the inflatable and retractable structure, IDRA takes up very little volume during launch.
  • Extended operating space: once deployed, IDRA reaches a large working area, ideal for maintenance and capture operations.
  • Modularity: the configuration can be customized according to the needs of the mission: number of links, length and degrees of freedom.
  • Retractability: The arm can be closed after use, reducing exposure to space debris.
  • Reduced costs: materials, production process and plug-and-play philosophy reduce overall costs.
competitiveScenario:
The competitive scenario includes established players such as MDA and Maxar, and start-ups such as GITAI, Motiv and Kinetic Space.

The concept of modularity is a common start-up trend and Deplotic is one of them. Deplotic stands out for the advantageous packaging ratio that allows to reach a size of the robotic manipulator greater than competitors.
description:
Deplotic develops IDRA, an inflatable and modular robotic arm for space applications.

In-orbit services such as satellite maintenance or debris removal require robotic manipulators, but current ones are expensive and cumbersome. IDRA unfolds in orbit reaching large working spaces while taking up little volume at launch. Its modular structure makes it easy to integrate, reducing time and costs for space logistics operators.
enablingTechnologies:
• Controlled inflatable technology: inflatable modular links that extend and retract in a controlled way (patented system)
  • Autonomous Robot: classic and advanced control (visual servoing, AI) allowing reliability and precision
  • Digital Twin, modular SW, orbital robotics simulations.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
• In-orbit servicing: in particular for inspection, repair, upgrade of satellites; removal, reallocation of satellites and space debris; self-maintenance of medium to large satellites.
  • Other space applications: on-board space stations, on-board rovers/hoppers for exploration of the lunar or martian soil.
  • Terrestrial applications: use in hostile environments with limited space (e.g., civil, nuclear), on board of mobile platforms, or as collaborative robot.
payoff: Robotic arms for space sustainability
revenueModel:
Deplotic’s revenue model is based on the modular sale of HW and an annual SW subscription.

The system is highly customizable: it includes OBC, joints, inflatable elements and tools. First revenues will come from contracts with space agencies (ASI, ESA) and public funding.
targetCustomers:
Target customers include space logistics and in-orbit servicing operators interested in robotic systems for satellite maintenance and removal.

In addition, space agencies and aerospace and defence companies are looking for innovative robotic solutions.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: INFLANT
abstract: INFLANT develops novel NLRP3 inflammasome inhibitor drugs directed to the intestine, offering a cheaper, more effective and safer solution to treat chronic intestinal inflammation and prevent exacerbation of IBD (ulcerative colitis and Crohn's disease)
businessTraction: 2024: PNI Cube winners, Life Sciences - MedTech award
competitiveAdvantages:
INF176 is the only direct NLRP3 inhibitor with local action in the intestine. By directly inhibiting the main player of inflammation, it reduces the inflammatory response without altering the overall action of the immune system against infections. It is orally administrable and being a synthetic small-molecule, its production cost remains low compared to biologics. INF176 has already demonstrated its efficacy and safety for the in vivo treatment of IBD in laboratory studies.

INFLANT Ex.Sum.
competitiveScenario: No NLRP3 inhibitor is currently available on the market. The most advanced molecules in clinical trials (Roche, Novartis, Olatech, Nodthera, Zydus) are systemic drugs, with indications mostly other than IBD, and most of them were developed starting from MCC950, the first NLRP3 inhibitor to enter clinical trials, but abandoned due to hepatotoxicity.
description:
By 2030, at least 10 million people in the Western world will be affected by chronic inflammatory bowel disease (IBD). In IBD, the chronic inflammatory state can cause damage to the intestinal barrier, promoting the spread of inflammation to other organs. The drugs used today may have poor efficacy, side effects or high costs. INFLANT proposes INF176, a new drug that inhibits an important driver of inflammation (NLRP3 inflammasome) directly in the gut, reducing inflammation and preventing intestinal damage with a higher safety profile.
INFLANT pitch
enablingTechnologies: Oral Small molecule
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
Clinical applications in IBD:

  • Moderate to severe disease with loss of response to biologics
  • Moderate to severe refractory disease in combination with biologics
  • Moderate to severe acute disease requiring rapid onset of action

Future developments: Science has shown that the gut and brain are closely linked through the gut-brain-axis. By preserving the intestinal barrier, INF176 has also been shown to prevent inflammation in the brain and cognitive decline in animal models of Alzheimer's disease.
payoff: Treating chronic intestinal inflammation for a healthier life
revenueModel:
De-risking activities: completion of IND-enabling studies and certified studies.

If the drug profile is safe, INFLANT will start Phase I studies in humans, at the end of which INFLANT will have an estimated value of ~400M EU (comparable: Inflazome) and can be acquired by pharmaceutical companies.
targetCustomers: Pharmaceutical companies

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: QSENSATO
abstract: QSENSATO is an innovative start-up developing integrated vapour cells and quantum atomic sensors for ultra-precise measurements.
businessTraction: Collaborations with CNR-IFN, ICFO (Barcelona), TASI, INRIM and ASI.
competitiveAdvantages:
• 3D versatility;
  • Integration with photonic structures;
  • Miniaturization of high precision sensors.
competitiveScenario: Quantum sensing and metrology
description:
QSENSATO is an innovative start-up developing integrated vapour cells and quantum atomic sensors for ultra-precise measurements.

Using our innovative atomic vapour cell approach, we are designing and manufacturing integrated atomic vapour cells for portable quantum sensors. Our methods allow us to create sensors for many strategic industries and can be customized according to your detection and metrology needs.
enablingTechnologies: Quantum atomic sensors, magnetometers, atomic clocks, radio frequency sensors, gyroscopes
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
• Biomedical Industry: laser-written vapor cells can be used in optically pumped magnetometers (OPMS);
  • Space&Defence Industry: Rydberg based radio-frequency sensors delivering light weight packages suitable for space deployment (chip-scale atomic clocks, navigation and timing PNT applications);
  • Research&Metrology: our LWVCs can be integrated into atomic frequency references to stabilize laser systems and synchronize experiments;
  • Lab-on-chip: integrating other microoptics and microchannels on the same glass atomic-photonic chip, enabling chemical analysis and characterization, ultra-to-low field NMR

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Bari Aldo Moro

payoff: Integrated Atomic Quantum Sensor
revenueModel: B2B, Prototyping, Third Party Account
targetCustomers: Research Groups, Quantum Startups, Large companies

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: NanoMuG
abstract: Drug delivery system based on mucin-based glycosylated nanoparticles with mucosal properties and antibiofilm for the targeted, stable and prolonged release of drugs in mucosal environments.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Targeted and prolonged release of drugs directly into mucosal tissues with increased permeability and reduction of systemic exposure and side effects;
  • Mucological properties for increased local retention; glycans allow selective interaction with pathogens and target cells, facilitating therapeutic targeting;
  • Intrinsic antimicrobial film activity, useful against resistant infections and protection of active ingredients from enzymatic degradation;
  • One-pot production process, patented and sustainable, scalable and adaptable to different clinical contexts.
description: NanoMuG has developed a patented platform for targeted drug release based on nanoparticles of glycosylated mucin, called "mucosomes", which can effectively carry active ingredients in the mucosal districts, Overcoming the physiological barriers that normally hinder the penetration and action of drugs. Mucosomes offer high stability, controlled release and site specificity due to their mucosal capacity and the presence of natural glycans that selectively interact with pathogens, immune cells and tumours.
enablingTechnologies: Carriers & nanovesicles, drug delivery platforms, bioinspired materials, advanced nanomaterials
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
• Carrier for mucosal administration, local and prolonged, of antibiotic inhalers (respiratory infections, resistant and chronic): penetration of infected mucus and intrinsic antibiofilm activity;
  • Functionalization of medical devices: therapeutic and antibacterial properties (e.g. for therapeutic long-release drug contact lenses);
  • Other contexts: mucosal oncology therapies, delivery of antivirals, peptides and vaccines, treatments for ophthalmic, gastrointestinal and genitourinary pathologies.

The NanoMuG technology is designed as a high impact cross-platform.
payoff: Reinvent Drug Delivery with Mucosomes
revenueModel: The business model includes licensing and co-development opportunities, also in collaboration with Contract Research Organizations (CRO) and industrial partners.
targetCustomers:
• Pharmaceutical companies: delivery of antibiotics, antivirals and oncology drugs, especially for infectious diseases and oncology;
  • Medical device companies: controlled and localised release systems;
  • Manufacturers of supplements/nutraceuticals and functional foods;
  • Health institutions and research centres dealing with antimicrobial resistance, pandemic preparedness and mucosal therapies.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: AiCulture
abstract: i-MUSE is a mobile app that transforms the visit to the museum into a personalized and interactive experience, suggesting works and made-to-measure routes and helping museums to know their public.
businessTraction: The activity involved at first regional museums, then gradually expanded on a national scale. Below, the list of the first entities that have subscribed to the service: Museo Egizio, MAO, Museo d’Arte Orientale, Galleria d’Arte Moderna (GAM), Museo Nazionale del Cinema, Palazzo Madama, La Venaria Reale, Museo Nazionale dell’Automobile, Museo della Liquirizia “Giorgio Amarelli”, Musei Civici di Cuneo, Museo A come Ambiente.
competitiveAdvantages:
i-MUSE:

  • Uses recommendation algorithms to suggest tailor-made routes, increasing visitor engagement and stimulating the discovery of new connections between works;
  • Collects/returns anonymous and aggregated data on user preferences and behaviour;
  • Offers evaluation and analysis tools to guide curatorial choices and optimize the management of spaces and flows;
  • Suitable also for medium-small institutions;
  • Cost-effective and user-friendly interface;
  • Scalable and adaptable technology model, allowing integration into museum networks and cross-cutting thematic projects.
description:
Less than 20% of Italian museums have apps (ISTAT 2023), limiting the ability to collect information on visitors, personalize content and enhance museum heritage. The metadata collected is incomplete and non-standardized, and solutions, if any, are fragmented, unsuitable for inter-institutional connections.

i-MUSE is accessible, scalable and customizable, suggests thematic paths, connects works across the board, stimulating discovery and exploration of new museums. It also allows you to analyze visitor behaviors and make data-driven decisions.
enablingTechnologies:
The solution is a cross-platform mobile app that, thanks to AI and Big Data Analytics, offers personalized thematic routes and useful data to museums. Content is managed in the cloud and synchronized across multiple museums with back-end integration.

On-site interaction is facilitated by QR code.
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications:
The app allows museums to offer routes based on visitor preferences, increasing engagement and facilitating discovery of new works. In parallel, i-MUSE gathers aggregated data to better understand audiences, optimise layouts and manage data flows.

Starting with the museum application, i-MUSE is proposed as a scalable platform for contexts where it is useful to guide the user in the intelligent discovery of cultural content (temporary exhibitions, tourist-cultural itineraries, educational contexts, exploitation of the heritage of large geographical areas)
payoff: A new way of living the Museums
targetCustomers: The search for potential clients has focused mainly on private, public, state and business museums, as well as on similar realities such as galleries, parks and cultural institutions which, thanks to their own collections - displayed or in storage - could benefit from the subscription to our Service.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: CrioPurA
abstract: CrioPurA, created by a team of CNR researchers, introduces an innovative technology based on macroporous polymer cryogels that offer an eco-friendly solution for the removal of toxic contaminants and other heavy metals from industrial waste water
businessTraction: Starting from 2020 we have validated CrioPurA in lab scale, during the PoC funded by MISE and later, during the two years of the PoC with Eureka TT S.r.l., we have validated the pre-industrial production of the material. We are currently signing a series of NDAs in order to undertake collaborations that lead to the realization of new PoC, aimed at increasing the validation of CrioPurA, declining it in the most relevant applications.
competitiveAdvantages:
The main advantages over commercial resins are:

  • Approximately 98% active chelating material;
  • Peculiar macroporous interlinked architecture obtained by cryo-synthesis.

CrioPurA is capable of complexing greater quantities of metal ions than current commercial resins, providing rapid water diffusion routes and determining full access to all available chelating sites, thus increasing the sequestration of the ions.
competitiveScenario: Thanks to the introduction of 85% chelating active material and typical interlinked porous morphology, CrioPurA uses significantly less material than current commercial resins on the market, obtaining the same chelating yields. This is a significant advantage in terms of production costs and final disposal of the material.
description: CrioPurA operates in the global industrial water and waste treatment market, introducing an innovative technology based on an advanced polymeric criogel based on N-methylglucamina (NMG), designed to remove toxic contaminants such as arsenic from water, chromium, boron, phosphates and other oxyanions, with an efficiency at least five times higher than the current solutions available on the market, offering an eco-sustainable and customizable solution.
enablingTechnologies:
Advanced materials.

Advanced production technologies.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
CrioPurA finds a perfect place as resin in the treatment of waste water, for the abatement of As (V) from groundwater, Cr(VI) from waste water of tanning and textile companies, boron (B) from waste water of microelectronics industry.

In particular, the high adsorption capacity of arsenic (76.3 mg/g) and chromium (130.9 mg/g), compared to the commercial analogue IRA 743, with values of 14.7 mg/g (As) and 29.3 mg/g (Cr), is remarkable.
payoff: An environmentally sustainable solution for water treatment
revenueModel: B2B
targetCustomers:
• Companies with need for process water treatment in output (tanneries, farms, paints, agritech, areonautica, nautical etc.);
  • Companies with need for water treatment in input (microelectronics, agritech, food processing, pasta factories etc).

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: SMARTOTUM
abstract: Smartotum aims to revolutionize home automation with a fully local, distributed and cloud-independent wireless system that guarantees privacy, resilience and ease of installation without invasive interventions.
businessTraction: Partner of European research projects, selected in innovation projects such as CTE Next Torino, collaboration with architects, technological partnerships with manufacturers, first pilots installed in smart buildings and private homes, first sales to end customers.
competitiveAdvantages: The system is local and does not require a permanent connection to the Internet, unlike competing solutions. Privacy is total, the risk of service loss due to network/cloud failures is eliminated. Distributed architecture makes the network resilient and self-adaptive, reducing maintenance and management costs. Quick installation, no additional wiring, also suitable for existing environments.
competitiveScenario: The smart home market is dominated by cloud-centric solutions (Google, Amazon, Apple, Samsung). Smartotum is positioned as a European alternative with attention to privacy, resilience and ease of use, targeting B2B partners (installers, construction companies) and end customers.
description: Smartotum aims for a new paradigm in home automation: its system is based on a distributed and fully local wireless network, which does not depend on the cloud and thus preserves privacy and business continuity. Each device in the network can operate independently and cooperate with others to ensure reliability, resilience and scalability. The installation is designed to be non-invasive and fast, suitable for both new construction and retrofit. The software architecture is developed in-house and integrates consumption optimisation, comfort and safety.
enablingTechnologies: Wireless mesh networking, edge computing, distributed artificial intelligence, interoperability with standard devices (WiFi, Bluetooth, RF), advanced security protocols, modular and scalable software platform.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: A single app to control the whole house.
payoff: Home automation without compromises
revenueModel: Direct and indirect sales through intermediaries; after-sales services (maintenance, updates, customization); licensing of the software platform to manufacturers/partners.
targetCustomers:
• Customers: elderly and disabled people, b&b and holiday homes, owners of properties who are renovating their home;
  • Intermediaries (B2B): architects, designers, construction and renovation firms.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: RoseBio
abstract: RoseBio develops innovative molecular diagnostic technologies, focusing on liquid biopsy to detect cancer mutations from ctDNA. Aims to improve precision medicine, focusing on personalized therapy and monitoring, with oncology applications.
businessTraction: The company has a collaboration contract for the development of biosensors with a start up in Boston, USA.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Versatile, responsive and user-friendly platform;
  • Compatible with standard laboratory instruments;
  • Scalable model: instruments on loan, profit from kit;
  • High margins (over 70%) on products;
  • Co-development and contract research services;
  • Collaboration with biomarker developers;
  • Immediately applicable in oncology on clinical mutations;
  • Adaptable to digital methods for increased expandability.
competitiveScenario: The technology proposed by RoseBio competes with technologies such as digital PCR and NGS. Compared to digital PCR, it is faster, automated, less expensive and easily upgradable with new biomarkers. The NGS, although gold standard, is very expensive and complex. ZipArray offers a more affordable and flexible solution for the analysis of known mutations.
description: RoseBio is a spin-off dedicated to the development of innovative molecular diagnostic technologies, with a focus on liquid biopsy. This non-invasive technique allows the identification of tumour mutations in circulating DNA (ctDNA), improving the accuracy and timeliness of diagnoses. The main applications are personalised therapy and disease monitoring, contributing to the spread of precision medicine and responding to a growing clinical need in oncology and chronic disease management.
enablingTechnologies: The technology proposed by RoseBio is based on microarray technology starting from the chemical derivatization of surfaces to the fluorescence analysis of hybridization products, also makes use of standard methods of molecular biology such as PCR.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: The killer application of RoseBio is liquid biopsy oncology, to identify mutations in ctDNA with the ZipArray platform, accurate, automated and low cost. Other applications include tissue biopsy, drug resistance analysis in infectious diseases, post-transplant monitoring, detection of emerging infectious agents and analysis of other rare biomarkers (miRNAs, exosomes, methylated DNA), with potential extension to reproductive medicine, chronic medicine and environmental monitoring.
payoff: Advanced Technologies for Liquid Biopsy
revenueModel: RoseBio aims to enter the market with RUO biopsy products, forging alliances with KOL and pharmaceutical companies for co-development. Forecast break-even at 4 years and turnover >13M€ at 5°, with growth boosted by exit strategy via M&A with biotech or pharma companies.
targetCustomers: RoseBio is active in the Life Sciences & MedTech sector, focusing on innovative diagnostic devices and precision medicine. It serves hospitals, laboratories, research centres and pharmaceutical companies. In Europe, the potential market exceeds 30 million tests per year. With CRC Array, it aims for over 2 million tests and $80 million in annual revenue.

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: Regenerative Protein Biotech
abstract: 5.6% of the world population suffers from skin ulcers caused by ischemia of blood circulation and sores that are not treatable today (diabetic foot and/ or pressure sores). RPB has developed a molecule in order to make a drug specifically for these diseases
businessTraction: The steps that have supported the current state of the molecule have been developed in Italian university laboratories. The next stages of research development can be carried out in private specialised laboratories or in qualified university laboratories.
competitiveAdvantages: The therapies of PAD and NHW are poorly effective and limited to the control of symptoms, as there are no drugs aimed at revascularization that represent elective therapy. Therefore, the development of a new innovative drug by RPB which aims at tissue revascularization will determine a real and sustainable competitive advantage towards products in use today.
competitiveScenario: For both PAD and NHW, renin-angiotensin antagonists, statins, beta-blockers, ACE inhibitors and platelet antiaggregants have low efficacy. Although more than 70 products (dressings, etc.) are available on the market, only 3 have been approved by the FDA: 2 cell therapies based on skin substitutes (Dermagraft™ and Apligraf ™) and recombinant PDGF (Becaplermin™ gel).
description: RPB has developed a molecule in order to make a drug specific for the following pathologies, of which suffers 5.6% of the world’s population: skin ulcers caused by ischemia of blood circulation and sores that are not treatable today (diabetic foot and/or pressure sores).
enablingTechnologies: Biotechnology, development of patented human protein, revascularization therapy.
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications: Care of skin sores: the identified molecule is able to lead to the regeneration of the skin affected by pathologies, such as Peripheral Arterial Disease (PAD) (with global prevalence of 5.6%, with association to diabetes. Estimated market: US$3.8 billion in 2022, CAGR 9% for the period 2022-2029), or Non Healing Wounds (NHW) (with global prevalence of 2%. Estimated market: US$ 12 billion in 2022, CAGR 6.7% for the period 2022-2029 ), secondary to PAD.

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Napoli Parthenope

payoff: The new treatment for skin ulcers
revenueModel: The revenue model of the initiative foresees the sale of the molecule to the pharmaceutical industry when it has reached/completed Phase 1.
targetCustomers: Industrie farmaceutiche internazionali

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: Rocitoo
abstract: Rocitoo is a start-up founded by Robosense and the University of Trento with the goal of transferring cutting-edge research in the field of mechatronics to industry and clinical applications.
competitiveAdvantages:
The RoboEye project aims to support individuals affected by severe disabling conditions that lead to progressive loss of mobility, such as Amyotrophic Lateral Sclerosis (ALS) or muscular dystrophy.

The work has focused on developing a plug-in module for commercial wheelchairs that enables users to move independently and effortlessly using eye gaze control.
description:
Rocitoo S.r.l. develops cutting-edge solutions by leveraging 3D vision powered by artificial intelligence and employing advanced calibration techniques to integrate data from heterogeneous sources such as 3D cameras, traditional cameras, LIDAR sensors, and laser triangulation systems.

In the field of clinical devices, Rocitoo applies Mixed Reality and Mobile Robotics technologies to support the recovery of walking ability in tetraplegic patients and others affected by severe conditions.
enablingTechnologies: Robotics, advanced sensing technologies, artificial vision systems, control and data analysis (including the possible use of AI algorithms)
mainApplications: RoboEye: a plug-in module for commercial wheelchairs that enables autonomous movement using eye gaze.
payoff: Robotic and advanced sensor solutions for Industry 4.0
targetCustomers: Manufacturing companies across various sectors (automotive, food, pharmaceutical, etc.), and businesses interested in industrial automation and robotic solutions.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Automation Intelligence and Control
abstract: Automation Intelligence and Control creates innovative software solutions by integrating Artificial Intelligence (AI) into control systems. Ad-hoc solutions are designed to ensure sustainability, increase operational efficiency and catalyze growth.
businessTraction: On-Air Consulting & Solutions SRL; Quavlive SRL; Technip Energies NV; Mama Industry SRL; WeFair SRL
competitiveAdvantages: This initiative addresses the limitations of current methods, which can struggle to handle complex or heterogeneous data or require expensive and poorly scalable hardware. The project brings automatic data analysis and classification capabilities (including through computer vision), control logic synthesis through machine learning, and process optimization. This translates into more efficient, scalable, and cost-effective software solutions compared to dedicated alternatives.
competitiveScenario: The main advantage over solutions on the market that require dedicated hardware is the offer of software solutions that are much more scalable and potentially much lower cost. This approach improves existing techniques, facilitating customer adoption and increasing efficiency.
description: Automation Intelligence and Control SRL creates innovative software solutions by integrating Artificial Intelligence (AI) into control systems. It addresses the limitations of current methods, which may struggle to manage complex or heterogeneous data or require expensive and poorly scalable hardware. The project provides automatic data analysis and classification capabilities (including visual), control logic synthesis through machine learning, and process optimization. This results in more efficient, scalable, and cost-effective software solutions.
enablingTechnologies: AI, Machine Learning, reti neurali, VIsione Artificiale, LLM, Text Mining, Cloud Services
mainApplications: The main applications it is focusing on include a software platform for the simulation and control of drone swarms and a software for the automatic classification of materials, the latter identified as the first commercial solution. Other sectors include industrial plants, networks of various nature, satellite systems, and systems for personalized medicine, such as software for the analysis of medical records and stratification of disease risk. In general, the market prospects extend to the space and energy sectors.
payoff: AI-CO: Artificial and Automatic Intelligence for Innovative Solutions
revenueModel: The scalability of the model is a strong point, being based on software solutions that have a potentially much lower cost and a significantly greater scalability than dedicated hardware alternatives.
targetCustomers: Companies in high added value and innovation-receptive sectors such as Technip Energies NV, On-Air Consulting & Solutions SRL (for drone simulator), and Quavlive SRL (for medical software). Collaborations with Mama Industry SRL and WeFair SRL. Further target sectors are industrial plants, networks, satellite systems, personalized medicine, space and energy.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: LegisRatio
abstract: Graph-based technology solutions to improve navigation and access to legislative acts, supporting legal divisions of multinationals, law firms and individual users. Our platforms go beyond simple research: they offer legal assistance and advanced decision making
competitiveAdvantages: We combine extensive experience in graph database modelling and usage with open-source LLM agents, enabling a system that is easily navigable, integrated, semantically rich, and cost-effective thanks to the use of open-source, pre-trained LLMs.
description: We develop graph-based technology solutions for more effective navigation and access to legislative acts, supporting legal divisions of large multinational companies, law firms and interested individuals. These solutions go beyond a simple search engine and are designed as advanced legal and decision-making assistance platforms, capable of transforming the way professionals and users interact with regulatory complexity. The key difference with competitors is our ability to structure legislation as Knowledge Graph, which can empower AI of a strong backbone to derive the information needed.
enablingTechnologies: Knowledge Graphs, Property Graphs, LLMs
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
• API Services: Provides programmatic access to a rich, explorable legislative knowledge graph.
  • Advanced Search Engine: Delivers highly accurate legislative searches using natural language and AI.
  • Legislative Monitoring Systems: Automatically alerts users about relevant legislative changes or impacts.
  • Data Integration Services: Seamlessly integrates new data sources based on customer needs.
payoff: Powering AI with smarter legislative knowledge
targetCustomers: Large corporations with legal departments, law firms and lawyers, other startups, public administration and individual clients.

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: SiPHA'
abstract: The startup develops a pilot plant for the process and production of biodegradable polymers from organic waste and using mixed microbial cultures.
businessTraction: Producers and managers of organic waste, such as municipal waste management companies and large companies in the agricultural, livestock and agro-industrial sectors. The plastics production sector, in transition towards plastics from renewable and biodegradable sources.
competitiveAdvantages: The production process that we intend to develop is absolutely innovative as it is based on a continuous process, unlike all competing processes that are based on discontinuous (batch) sequential processes (sequencing batch). This process innovation can make production cheaper, more reliable and more sustainable compared to competing processes. This allows the use of much smaller sizes for ancillary equipment such as pumps and solid-liquid separation systems as well as a reduction in the number and volume of intermediate storage tanks.
competitiveScenario: It differentiates itself by its continuous process versus the batch/sequential processes of direct competitors such as Paques Biomaterial (Netherlands) and Promiko (Sweden) and by using organic waste instead of dedicated crops used by indirect competitors such as Tianan Biopolymer (China) and Danimer Scientific (USA), with lower costs and greater sustainability.
description: Process development and production of biodegradable polymers (Polyhydroxyalkanoates - PHA) from organic waste and using mixed microbial cultures and product development of applications of such polymers as biodegradable bioplastics in various sectors, such as packaging, agriculture and fisheries.
enablingTechnologies: System Integration, Digital Tween, Big Data Analytics
fundingStageDescription: It mainly involves the use of public grants (competitive calls at national and European level, including programs such as the CBE-JU) and financing in the pre-seed/seed phases by private investors such as business angels. In the first three years, fund-raising activities will be crucial to cover the development costs of the pilot plant, with a minimum capacity for initial self-financing and a potential contribution from the sale of PHA samples from the third year. Alignment with European policies for sustainability is considered a facilitating factor for obtaining funding.
mainApplications:
Production of polyhydroxyalkanoates with mixed microbial cultures on a large scale, in a continuous process line.

A first pilot plant (with volumetry of the order of cubic meters) for the production of polymers from organic waste has been realized. The pilot-scale experimentation will allow: to confirm the efficiency, reliability and cost-effectiveness of the production process (tested in the laboratory scale with synthetic substrates), and to produce the polymers in sufficient quantities for product development (with processing tests on industrial machines and first market tests).
payoff: Waste Transformed Into Revolutionary Bioplastics
revenueModel: SiPHÁ will monetize through PHA technology/plant sales, licenses/patents and PHA product sales. Scalability is provided by the continuous process (more efficient), industry partnerships and large-scale licensing potential.
targetCustomers: Producers/managers of organic waste (municipal, agricultural, agro-industrial companies) and the plastic production sector interested in bioplastics.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: VIS – Virtual Immersion in Science
abstract: Production of multimedia materials for science communication based on innovative digital systems
businessTraction:
• Winner of theNational Geographic Award at MIA and the Lamborghini Prize in 2020;
  • Winner in 2022, the "Sciencia en Acción" award and Best Short Film at the Raw Science Film Festival with the short film Pulsars.
competitiveAdvantages: We craft stories with a tailor-made approach to create unique experiences and spread science and knowledge. Our uniqueness lies in covering the entire process—from a deep understanding of scientific topics to innovative science communication adaptations and top-level media production.
description:
VIS is the first spin-off of the Scuola Normale. It creates multimedia products for the science and knowledge dissemination, including 2D videos, AR/VR applications, interactive museum installations and events.

With expertise in science, creativity, science communication, and multimedia production, VIS develops innovative solutions using the latest technological advancements, making the most advanced science and technology accessible to everyone with multiple communication means and strategies, blending old, new and futuristic technologies in a uniquely creative and entertaining way.
enablingTechnologies: VR, AR, XR, 3D modeling, Digital Twin, Metaverse
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
Virtual Immersion in Science produces:

  • Scientific documentaries and informative videos;
  • Short and comprehensive videos;
  • Internet information pills at the level of television broadcasts.

Virtual Immersion in Science brings together a unique set of complementary skills that enable the in-house management of the entire science communication audiovisual production process, combining:

  • Scientific rigor
  • Engaging storytelling
  • Bottleneck removal and fast time-to-market
payoff: Science, Knowledge and Innovation. Rigorous, Engaging and Accessible
targetCustomers: National and international research institutions, science museums, planetariums, fairs and expos, schools, and high-tech and innovative companies.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: 110 Laude
abstract: 110 Laude is a spin-off of the Università degli studi del Molise, based in Campobasso, which develops innovative solutions able to integrate digital technologies, big data and artificial intelligence.
businessTraction:
• More than 500 active users;
  • Partnership agreements already in operation with 5 banks and several trade associations.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Modular design and optimised UX: intuitive and functional interfaces;
  • Customer profiling: detailed profiling to match the most suitable products and services for each user;
  • Real-time data and custom reports: customized data and reports based on customer needs;
  • Predictive analytics: use of machine learning and deep learning to predict future scenarios;
  • Custom AI models: AI models that enrich quantitative analyses with qualitative data;
  • Proprietary models and algorithms: developed in-house, based on years of experience with banks and companies.
competitiveScenario: On the market there are operators of different size that at the moment do not offer an integrated and fast solution as proposed by 110 Laude.
description: 110 Laude specializes in developing innovative solutions for financial analysis. Thanks to a data-driven approach and the integration of digital technologies, big data and artificial intelligence, 110 Laude aims to improve access to business data, providing the information that the user needs in a usable and immediate way.
enablingTechnologies: AI (Artificial Intelligence), Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Big Data Analytics
mainApplications:
The killer application is FINVISION, an automated decision support system that improves the historical and prospective financial analysis of SMEs, facilitates access to credit and promotes the relationship between the company and its stakeholders (banks, consultants, customers and suppliers).

FINVISION combines the versatility of the mobile app with the efficiency of the web app, offering an integrated experience that allows the user to know the numbers of their company and all companies in Italy and to simulate scenario analysis.
payoff: 110 Laude develops innovative solutions to simplify the financial analysis of SMEs and foster dialogue with stakeholders
revenueModel:
SaaS models: access to the FINVISION platform with subscriptions that can be scaled to meet users' needs.

The company also provides specialist advisory services, tailored to specific needs, to support clients in financial analysis and planning.
targetCustomers: The target customers are Micro, Small and Medium-sized enterprises that wish to simplify and improve their knowledge of their economic and financial health in order to then adopt the most appropriate strategies, as well as banks, associations and networks that by enabling their managers to use PV, they enable them to optimize their time and strengthen the relationship with client companies.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Planckian
abstract: Development and testing of quantum energy control technologies based on qubit architectures. The activity focuses on the development of highly scalable superconducting quantum processors, which are expected to enter the market in 2026.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Increased performance: at least 80% reduction in cabling by design without the need for additional engineering solutions at system level, resulting in a reduction of thermal load. Enabling complex logic operations, resulting in reduced circuit length and probability of error, and more advanced error correction schemes;
  • Greater compactness of superconducting quantum computers,
  • Reduction of the Total Cost of ownership for the customer (fixed and variable costs, including energy, for the installation and operation of the system).
description: Traditional superconducting quantum processors require individual control lines for each qubit, limiting hardware scalability in performance, compactness and cost: they increase the system’s thermal load and crosstalk -more likely to fail in the computational phase- and impose manufacturing limits. Planckian is developing a processor that overcomes these challenges: it manages multiple qubits via shared control lines and natively supports the implementation of more complex logical operations, efficiently executing quantum algorithms.
enablingTechnologies: Quantum computing
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: Superconducting quantum computers
payoff: Powering Next-Gen Quantum Computers
targetCustomers:
• Developers of quantum hardware
  • System integrators
  • HPC centres and research laboratories

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: Janus
abstract: Janus enhances the communication of cultural heritage through the use of high scientific value technologies to improve the traditional model for communicating cultural heritage.
businessTraction:
Janus has served approximately 20 public and private entities, including the Ministry of Culture, the Bank of Italy, Fendi, the University of Tor Vergata and the Free University of
Bolzano. During its activities, Janus has established relationships of collaboration and expansion on the international market with Mozambique, as part of the activities carried out at the Maputo museum.
competitiveAdvantages: The startup stands out for integrating advanced VR, AR and 3D reconstructions with scientifically validated content, ensuring both accuracy and engagement. Unlike existing solutions, it prioritizes immersive storytelling over mere digital replication, making cultural experiences interactive and inclusive. Its modular and customizable approach adapts to different needs, from museums to education and tourism. Janus transforms virtual exploration into an active learning journey, combining accessibility, innovation and cultural value.
competitiveScenario: The startup differentiates itself from other competitors by combining VR, AR and 3D reconstructions with scientifically validated storytelling. Unlike other platforms, Janus offers fully interactive and customizable experiences, improving engagement and accessibility across multiple industries.
description: The startup's goal is to revolutionize the communication of cultural heritage through innovative virtual experiences, overcoming the limits of traditional digitalization and offering 3D, VR and AR reconstructions, which enhance heritage sites without replacing real-world experiences. The mission is to make culture more accessible and engaging by combining technology and storytelling. With a sustainable model, the startup wants to become a key player in the sector, satisfying the growing demand for digitalization by public and private institutions.
enablingTechnologies: VR/AR/XR, 3D reconstructions, AI-powered storytelling, Cloud Computing, Big Data Analytics, Digital Twin, System Integration
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: Improving accessibility to cultural heritage through VR, AR and 3D reconstructions, for immersive virtual museums. The technology extends to education, offering interactive learning tools, and tourism, enriching visitor experiences with digital storytelling. Beyond culture, applications include urban planning, enabling virtual explorations of sites, and healthcare, supporting cognitive therapy through immersive environments.
payoff: Revolutionizing culture with immersive technology
revenueModel: Janus will monetize through a subscription-based model, licensing, and B2B partnerships. The scalable model includes API integrations, premium features, and market expansion into new industries.
targetCustomers: Target customers include SMEs, large companies and public institutions looking for innovative solutions in the field of digitalization of cultural heritage, tourism and education.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: Algortec
abstract: Algortec develops technologies aimed at optimizing the management of power lines through the monitoring of key physical, mechanical, and atmospheric parameters. The technology is designed to operate even in remote and hard-to-access areas.
competitiveAdvantages: The solution provides real-time insights into both the environmental conditions and the electromechanical state of the power line conductors. This enables the determination of the line’s maximum current capacity and the optimization of power transmission. Additionally, through sensor data and cameras, it is possible to remotely monitor the condition of the line in case of faults or adverse weather events, helping to prevent critical situations such as the formation of ice sleeves or the potential falling of trees onto the conductors.
competitiveScenario: There are products on the market for measuring conductor temperature only (e.g. "Micca Informationstechnologie gmbh" - https://www.micca.at/). The new device, on the other hand, provides much more information that allows you to maximize the performance of the line, check its status in real time, and provide all the information to restore its operation in the event of a disruption.
description: Algortec aims to develop technology for optimizing the management of power lines by monitoring key physical, mechanical, and atmospheric parameters, even in the most remote and inaccessible areas, enabling real-time assessment of the transmission lines' transport capacity. The technology is based on a patented solution and is powered directly by the power line. The measurements and collected data are transmitted wirelessly using various technologies and communication protocols, depending on the location.
enablingTechnologies: Sensors for measuring both conductor and ambient temperature, humidity sensor, solarimeter, anemometer, 3-axis accelerometer for recording mechanical shocks, GPS module, and a multi-protocol communication system ensuring signal redundancy and reliable data transmission.
mainApplications: The device can be applied to any power transmission line to enhance its performance and management. It enables the detection, management, and communication of physical and environmental parameters that define the limit values to which a power line can be subjected under various operating conditions. For example, it determines the maximum allowable current capacity based on ambient thermal conditions or assesses the mechanical state of the line conductors under both normal operating conditions and accidental fault scenarios.
payoff: Bringing power lines into the future
revenueModel: The product is expected to be sold to all medium- and high-voltage power grid operators, with an estimated annual sales volume of several thousand units.
targetCustomers: High-voltage power grid operators (e.g., Terna for Italy) and medium-voltage distribution companies (e.g., ACEA, E-Distribuzione, SET, Edyna, etc.).

title: Res Smart
abstract: Within the context of smart cities, the company proposes the development of technological systems and platforms specifically developed to support the well-being and health of citizens
businessTraction: Collaborations with research institutes and universities dealing with smart cities, AI and AR, in order to share knowledge, develop new technologies and conduct joint research to continuously improve solutions.
competitiveAdvantages: Cutting-edge innovative technology gives the company a competitive advantage in the smart cities sector, unique in its kind, which allows it to develop solutions with various applications and tailor-made, which meet the specific needs of cities and their residents in the context of smart cities.
competitiveScenario:
• growing smart cities market, in consideration of growing urbanization and the need for sustainable and efficient urban infrastructures;
  • increase in demand for pollution monitoring and supporting solutions;
  • growing attention to mental health and well-being represents an opportunity for the artificial intelligence and augmented reality system.
description: Within the context of smart cities, specifically for smart health and smart living, or even more generally, in smart applications for citizens, the company proposes the development of technological systems and platforms specifically developed to support the well-being and health of citizens and workers.
enablingTechnologies: Multidimensional and interdisciplinary decision-making platform, which allows the qualitative identification of weak points and possible strategic solutions to different problems, both in the field of citizen/worker well-being and in the energy, urban planning and mobility fields.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
Applications developed:

  • smart UV sensor: low-cost and wearable multisensor system, which has the ability to evaluate erythemal exposure through a specifically identified calculation procedure, in particular for the protection of the health of outdoor workers;
  • well-being management system: complex software that allows you to interact with the subject/individual with effects on the state of mind of the subjects who use it.
payoff: Technologies for the well-being and health of citizens and workers in smart cities
revenueModel: Increase brand awareness and generate interest among potential customers and partners, in order to position itself as a cutting-edge company in the smart cities sector and as a reliable partner for environmental monitoring and people's well-being.
targetCustomers: The reference market of the company and of the identified and future products/services is generally attributable to the smart cities sector and specifically for smart health and smart living, or even more generally, smart applications for citizens, offering innovative products to B2B companies and stakeholders operating in this field.

title: Sibilla
abstract: Sibilla is an innovative startup that uses artificial intelligence and advanced data analysis to identify, organize and make global investment opportunities accessible.
businessTraction: Sibilla is finalizing agreements with strategic entities and innovative companies to accelerate the development and distribution of its solution. These include collaborations with financial institutions for access to exclusive data on investment opportunities and agreements with strategic consultancy companies to integrate the platform into customers' decision-making processes.
competitiveAdvantages: Sibilla's solution stands out for the use of advanced technologies such as artificial intelligence, machine learning and web scraping, which automate and speed up the collection and analysis of investment opportunities compared to traditional manual methods. Its strengths include the creation of a universal database, personalized real-time notifications, interactive dashboards and automated reports. The integrated approach allows for broader and more detailed coverage of information compared to competitors focused on limited segments.
competitiveScenario: Sibilla stands out from its competitors for its advanced integration of artificial intelligence and machine learning in analysis. For example, while TradeDetector (Italy) uses AI to provide financial advice, Sibilla automates the collection and organization of data from global sources, offering personalized notifications and interactive dashboards and making Sibilla unique and innovative.
description: Sibilla is an innovative startup that uses artificial intelligence and advanced data analysis to identify, organize and make global investment opportunities accessible. The company offers tools such as personalized notifications, interactive dashboards and automated reports, as well as comprehensive data processing services and the creation of specific reports based on data provided by customers. Furthermore, it provides automated processing and data entry services to simplify and optimize information management.
enablingTechnologies: AI (Artificial Intelligence), Machine Learning, Natural Language Processing (NLP), Web Scraping, Big Data Analytics, Cloud Computing, System as a Service (SaaS), Automated Reporting, Visual Analytics, Relational and Graph Databases, Data Integration, Digital Dashboards
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: Sibilla's killer application is the automated identification and organization of global investment opportunities for companies and institutions, thanks to the use of AI, web scraping and interactive dashboards. The system can be extended to the management of public tenders, market analyzes and monitoring of government funding. Furthermore, it can support financial institutions and non-profit organizations in the strategic monitoring of investment policies, offering customized reports and predictive analyzes applicable to different sectors.
payoff: Your global gateway to smarter investments
revenueModel: Sibilla monetizes through subscription models based on customized service levels, which include database access, advanced notifications, interactive dashboards and automated reports. The model is highly scalable thanks to the cloud infrastructure.
targetCustomers: Italian and foreign institutions and government bodies, starting with national development banks such as CDP in Italy, international financial institutions (IFIs), non-profit organizations, multinational companies and SMEs interested in global investments, and strategic consultants for fund and project management.

title: AIperTech
abstract: AIperTech is an innovative university startup that aims to bring Artificial Intelligence into the processes of companies, to increase competitiveness in the global market, combining research with business experience.
businessTraction: Collaboration with Polo Tecnologico Alto Adriatico di Pordenone, LEF (Lean Experience Factory), Camera di Commercio

AIperTech is an Innovative University Startup, which combines the experience in the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning sector of prof. Carlo Tasso and prof. Giuseppe Serra and the skills and know-how of the Geomatics Laboratory coordinated by prof. Salvatore Amaduzzi.

4 main applications: forecasting, computer vision, natural language processing, generative AI.
