title: Emc Gems
abstract: EMC Gems is specialized in the fields of electromagnetic simulation software and digital twin models. The company also carries out research, development, production and sale of innovative products using electromagnetic fields
businessTraction: Infineon Technologies, Microchip Technologies, Renesas Electronics America, Analog Devices, Melexis, Vivabiocell, Contelech
competitiveAdvantages: An advantage is given by the fact that the digital twin is physically-driven and not data-driven like that obtained with vibration sensors. Other advantages compared to the latter are the reduced cost of the sensor and the fact that it can capture vibrations at "zero frequency". Finally, the encoder can also be used for motion control. The technique is more applicable than soft sensors which, it is true, allow us to avoid the use of physical sensors, but it is impossible to use them to monitor a rotating shaft other than the shaft of an electric motor.
competitiveScenario: A new technology for condition monitoring is based on a rotary or linear inductive encoder which, in addition to motion control, is also capable of detecting changes due to wear and failure of mechanical components. custom encoders are designed and optimized with a cloud computing platform.
description: EMC Gems is a deep-tech startup specializing in research and development in electromagnetic simulation software and digital twin models. Furthermore, the company researches, develops, produces and sells innovative products that use electromagnetic fields with particular reference to proximity, position and level sensors, power electronic devices, environmental and structural monitoring systems and predictive maintenance in the industrial sectors and automotive.
enablingTechnologies:
• Advanced cloud-native simulation;
  • The digital twin model, created with supervised machine learning techniques;
  • The digital twin determines a mechanical system with data provided by an innovative sensor;
  • The sensor is designed using an end-to-end Software as a Service platform.
mainApplications: Inductive encoders are emerging compared to other technologies thanks to the possibility they offer of customizing their dimensions and above all for their robustness in hostile environments. The sensor design and virtual manufacturing technology, via the export of its digital twin, is currently used under licensing through a cloud platform by key players in the inductive sensor industry such as Renesas Electronics America, Melexis, Microchip Technologies, Analog Devices and Infineon Technologies, all multinationals in the semiconductor sector.
payoff: Think.Design.Get: virtual and physical production of electromagnetic components
revenueModel:
Scalable solutions.
1) Sensor end-users purchase the physical sensor and its digital twin model.
2) Companies that produce sensors and semiconductor multinationals can gain access to the IPSMagic SaaS which allows them to use original business models.
targetCustomers: Semiconductor companies (Infineon Technologies, Microchip Technologies, Renesas Electronics America, Analog Devices, Melexis), Automation, robotics, IIoT, digital twin, electrification. Manufacturing, packaging, steel, oil & gas, automotive, aerospace, agritech, construction, home automation, biomedical, energy production sectors.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Applied Research to Technologies (Ares2T)
abstract: Ares2T aims to develop solutions focused on the creation of synergies between service networks such as intelligent electricity grids, advanced communications (5G, Sat, next gen internet), urban mobility, drive to store.
businessTraction:
• Enel (Italy) for the development and maintenance of ChargeAdvisor and data analysis on the charging infrastructure;
  • IREN (Italy) to test ChargeAdvisor and manage projects with PMS;
  • Exprivia for software evolution;
  • Collaborations with CRAT-Sapienza and European partners in Horizon 2020 projects on 5G and smart grids.
competitiveAdvantages:
• ChargeAdvisor offers dynamic modulation of charging power, optimizing energy based on preferences and network constraints, and evolves with 5G.
  • PMS simplifies the management of research projects with web-based software, also supporting PNRR reporting.
  • COSMOS, CRM/ERP platform, digitizes business processes in SaaS mode, with particular attention to the medical sector.
competitiveScenario: Ares2T stands out with ChargeAdvisor, an advanced platform for controlling the charging of electric vehicles based on predictive algorithms and integrated with 5G and the OCPP protocol. Compared to direct competitors such as Enel and IREN (Italy), it offers more flexible and innovative solutions for the real-time and personalized management of charging infrastructures.
description: Ares2T's objective is the technological transfer and go-to-market of the results of applied research relevant to automatic engineering, with particular reference to services for users and operators of electricity, telecommunications, media and transport networks. It also develops ICT solutions dedicated to resource planning in companies, management and reporting of co-financed projects.
enablingTechnologies: The technologies underlying Ares2T solutions include: IoT, Cloud Computing, Big Data Analytics, 5G, Edge Computing, Machine Learning, SaaS Platforms, System Integration, and Model Predictive Control algorithms for the advanced management of electric vehicles and smart grids.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications: Ares2T focuses on ChargeAdvisor for electric vehicle charging. This platform is designed for users, fleet managers and network operators. Other applications include smart grids and data analytics for various industries. COSMOS, with CRM and ERP functions, supports company digitalisation.
payoff: Integration of energy networks, mobility, communication and economy
revenueModel: It monetizes through SaaS models, providing licenses for platforms such as ChargeAdvisor and COSMOS, integrated with customized services. The model is scalable thanks to the modularity of the solutions, the expansion into the smart energy and ICT markets, and the support of 5G and cloud technologies
targetCustomers: Potential customers include: fleet and charging infrastructure managers (e.g. Enel, IREN), electromobility companies, SMEs interested in CRM/ERP solutions such as COSMOS, and organizations engaged in co-financed projects requiring advanced project management tools like PMS.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Digitalization Renewable Energy Automation Management (DREAM)
abstract: DREAM offers services to create and manage Building Energy Management Systems (BEMS) and supervision, control and data acquisition (SCADA) systems for the management of civil systems.
businessTraction: DREAM has initiated commercial agreements with entities and companies in the automation and energy efficiency sector at a national level, including partnerships with technology suppliers and industrial stakeholders. He has collaborated with universities and research centers to develop and test innovative algorithms. Furthermore, it has launched pilot projects with companies in the construction and infrastructure sectors for the implementation of solutions based on digital twin and IoT.
competitiveAdvantages: The solution focuses on the automation and energy optimization of electrical systems through digital twins and predictive algorithms (“killer applications”). It can be applied to smart buildings, industrial infrastructure and smart cities, extending to sectors such as healthcare, transport and environmental management for monitoring, efficiency and sustainability.
competitiveScenario: Unlike large players, which offer standardized solutions, DREAM integrates innovative algorithms and technologies such as digital twins, ensuring greater adaptability and efficiency.
description: DREAM develops digital twins and automation solutions for electrical systems, optimizing efficiency and integrated management through advanced algorithms. Address issues of inefficiency and poor digitalization with innovative technologies such as digital twins and BIM. With the "energy holter" and proprietary patents, it improves monitoring, predictive maintenance and sustainability
enablingTechnologies: The solution is based on Digital Twin, IoT, System Integration, Big Data Analytics, BIM platforms, predictive algorithms and Cloud Computing. These technologies allow energy optimization, advanced automation and real-time monitoring with customized and sustainable solutions.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: The solution focuses on the automation and energy optimization of electrical systems through digital twins and predictive algorithms (“killer applications”). It can be applied to smart buildings, industrial infrastructure and smart cities, extending to sectors such as healthcare, transport and environmental management for monitoring, efficiency and sustainability.
payoff: Digitize and optimize systems with innovative solutions for efficiency and sustainability
revenueModel: DREAM monetizes through the sale of customized solutions, software licenses and predictive maintenance services. The model is scalable thanks to the adaptability of technologies to different sectors and markets, focusing on strategic partnerships and progressive expansion of customers.
targetCustomers: Potential customers include energy, industrial and technology companies, smart building operators, public administrations and infrastructure operators. The solution is ideal for industries that require efficiency, automation and sustainability, such as healthcare, transportation and environmental management.

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: Insect Pharma Entomotherapy
abstract: Insect Pharma Entomotherapy is based on the so-called Entomotherapy, a practice that links insects and the substances they produce to medicine.
businessTraction: ANID Azienda Nazionale Italiana Disinfestatori; Scuola Sant'Anna di Pisa
competitiveAdvantages: Our company provides completely free and natural removal (without the use of pesticides) of paper wasp nests to those who desire it. Wasps are beneficial as their venom can save the lives of people allergic to their stings. We offer our expertise and knowledge regarding insects, especially social insects, for investigations, collaborations, and consultations with universities and private entities.
competitiveScenario: There are similar entities with comparable products, but our spin-off offers different services focused on environmental impact.
description: Insect Pharma operates in the field of entomotherapy, leveraging nearly 50 years of research on insect breeding conducted by the Entomology Group at the Department of Biology in Florence. We provide insects and their derivatives for diagnosing and treating health and environmental issues. Special emphasis is placed on treating allergies caused by hymenoptera stings (bees and wasps) by supplying venom suitable for immunotherapy, obtained non-invasively from insects raised in semi-natural environments.
enablingTechnologies:
Insect Pharma utilizes:

  • Optical microscopy
  • Collection of insects using specialized suction devices
  • Breeding of various insect species in field and laboratory settings
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications: Pharmaceutical companies and research institutes
payoff: Transforming Insect's Solutions into Health and Healing
targetCustomers: Pharmaceutical companies

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: AR-IOS
abstract: AR-IOS is an innovative startup aiming at developing, producing and marketing a product line based on an innovative modular system for PEF (Pulsed Electric Fields) to be applied in the context of food processing. In January 2022 it officially became a spin-off of ENEA.
competitiveAdvantages: The system proposed is modular, resulting in a considerable adaptability to a wide range of applications. The underlying technology (PEF: Pulsed Electric Field) could have important socio-economic implications. At the production level, industry could benefit from energy savings resulting from reduced costs associated with the storage phase, Reducing and/or eliminating the use of chemicals or thermal pasteurization treatments with direct positive effects on energy savings and thus on market economy.
competitiveScenario: Energy and economic savings could be achieved by eliminating some stages of the conservation chain, resulting in a reduction in the costs of related processes, Both the generation of energy required to power the PEF generator, using renewable energy sources.
description: AR-IOS proposes the application of an innovative system for microbial inactivation using pulsed electric fields (PEF). This would allow consumers to purchase food products with excellent organoleptic characteristics at a lower cost. At the production level, industry could save money by reducing the costs associated with the preservation phase, reducing and/or eliminating the use of chemicals or pasteurization heat treatments that alter the organoleptic properties of many foods.
enablingTechnologies: Biotechnology, innovation and sustainability
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
• Agro-food processing industries:
  • alternative food preservation treatment
  • Improvement of the nutritional and sensory qualities of processed foods
payoff: A Pulsed Electric Fields solution for food processing
revenueModel: The business model is transactional at B2B level with a markup revenue model. Thanks to the modular system there is a significant reduction in production costs that allows you to define a margin of 65% compared to the sales price, while retaining a competitive cost advantage over competitors.
targetCustomers: Processing industries in the agri-food sector

title: Mobyforall
abstract: MOBYFORALL supports local businesses and communities in the transition to more sustainable mobility through a data-driven approach, ESG assessment and sustainability reporting.
businessTraction: A commercial agreement with a firm that offers services to companies, is currently being under finalization. The agreement is linked to the search for clients and the preparation of the Sustainability Report.
competitiveAdvantages: Mobyforall makes social innovation through technology, with a product that is unique on the market (existing ones are uncoordinated activities usually carried out by consultancy firms following standard and traditional approaches). Our platform, thanks to sophisticated algorithms, allows for the collection, analysis and monitoring of behaviors, their measurement and characterization, and the definition of interventions and policies to improve the sustainability of companies and entities, social impact and governance, thanks to a highly technological product but easy to use.
competitiveScenario: Webapp: transport consulting companies (Movesion, TFB Consulting, Mobility Management Consulting). They have a traditional approach, use market platforms (Qualtrics, Lime Survey or Microsoft/Google forms), propose standard questionnaires and do not provide a «push» data analytics product. They have high rates and tend to give traditional advice.
description:
Mobyforall is a Tech and Consulting Company that provides services and solutions to: public transport operators, local government decision-makers, companies, individuals. Mobyforall supports businesses and local communities in achieving sustainable mobility through automated data collection, processing and visualization of mobility behaviors to improve the performance of transport systems ("pro-environment behaviour" report) public and alternative mobility apart from the private transport system.
Mobyforall_pitch2024
enablingTechnologies: Software, cloud computing, cybersecurity, IoT, Big Data, Simulation: related to the digital transformation for data collection in safety, their storage and analysis, but also to visualization and human-machine interface.
mainApplications:
Mobyfor all develops:

  • Mobility manager software and webapp;
  • Platform for collecting data and psycho-social variables from users and measuring pro-environment behaviour, for sustainability budgets;
  • Data collection systems and mobility surveys (traditional, or via mixed approaches such as/quantitative, and data-fusion algorithms);
  • Behavioural models to identify (latent) mobility demand;
  • Integrated IoT sensor systems (Automated Passenger Counter-APC) installed on local public transport, to facilitate planning, programming, management and monitoring of "data-driven" mobility services.
payoff: Mobyforall, the best technology and mobility partner
revenueModel: Platform for mobility managers: SaaS with entry fee for platform installation and its full functionality. Customised deliveries on multi-year contracts: from the second year fixed fee (entry fee reduced between 10 and 20%), depending on the complexity and size of the company.
targetCustomers: Customers are companies and corporate (for mobility management) (B2B), public transport companies (B2B), freight transport companies (B2B), local, regional, national (B2B) administrations with a user base that will also involve individual citizens (B2C).

title: GeDy TrAss
abstract: GeDy TrAss develops software to speed up and improve the design of mechanical transmissions. Using a high level of problem knowledge and patented numerical techniques, the software is able to deliver state-of-the-art accurate results in dramatically reduced time.
businessTraction: CNH, MotorValley Accelerator
competitiveAdvantages: Calculatory speed and accuracy.
competitiveScenario: Main competitors use techniques which are in some cases less precise and in most cases more time-consuming in terms of modelling and problem solving.
description:
GeDy TrAss provides engineers with software that allows them to design a transmission in detail and quickly. By means of patented numerical techniques it is possible to quickly evaluate all the dynamic loads generated by the transmission in order to correctly dimensioning gears, bearings, shafts and carcasses. The software shortens the time-to-market of a gearbox, because it allows you to study in a precise but fast way all possible working conditions of a gearbox.

These elements will be implemented in a SAAS solution.

GeDy TrAss_2024
enablingTechnologies: Saftware As A Service, Algorithms for assisted transmission design.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
• Determination of the static transmission error and contact patch, considering all the deformabilities present in the transmission, within the hour;
  • Determination of the dynamic response of the system over one working day
payoff: We create innovative tools and solutions for your challenges in mechanical design.
revenueModel: B2C via Software As A Service
targetCustomers: All those who have to design mechanical transmissions with toothed wheels.

title: PLASFER
abstract: Plasfer develops new cell therapies based on platelets for the treatment of solid tumors.
competitiveAdvantages: • Innovative approach in the manipulation and engineering of human platelets
competitiveScenario: The initial target markets are North America and EU, representing approximately 202,000 patients for pancreatic cancer treatment and a value of at least $914 million. The achievable market is estimated at $594 million, corresponding to approximately 131,000 patients per year. The main competitors are: Stellar Bio; HemostOD; STRM.BIO; Cellphire.
description: Platelet-based therapies are a new class of transformative cell-based therapies. Plasfer is developing PTT, platelet transfer technology, an innovative and proprietary platform technology capable of transforming platelet concentrates into highly innovative, life-changing medicines aimed at treating a range of diseases with unmet medical needs.
enablingTechnologies: Biopharmaceutical Technologies specialize in the development of platelet-delivered drugs
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000

payoff: Unlocking the Power of Platelets
revenueModel:
Potential revenues obtainable through milestone payments and/or royalties based on commercial agreements that can be signed with different pharmaceutical partners.

At full capacity, the company can achieve revenues of $385M per year, with an EBITDA of approximately $231M per year.
targetCustomers: Patients suffering from cardiovascular diseases (atherosclerosis, cardiac hypertrophy and fibrosis, cardiac arrhythmogenesis), neoplasms (solid tumors of various origins, leukemia, myeloma), diseases due to eukaryotic pathogens (mycosis, malaria) or viral pathogens (AIDS, viral hepatitis).

title: Borea Therapeutics
abstract: Borea Therapeutics develops new therapeutic options based on the use of innovative viral vectors for patients with genetic or chronic diseases.
businessTraction: Seed investment by Sofinnova Partners (June 2024)
competitiveAdvantages:
• Alteration of viral vector tropism
  • Possibility of targeting only tissues of clinical interest
  • Allows viral vectors to reach the central and peripheral nervous system
description: Borea Therapeutics is an innovative start-up based in Milan, founded by Paul Heppenstall and EMBLEM, a technology transfer partner of the European Moleculare Biology Laboratory. It has developed a gene therapy platform through which viral vectors derived from adeno-associated viruses (AAV) are chemically modified to strategically alter their tropism, to target in vivo only the tissues of clinical interest, operating on gene transfer selectivity and reduction of the vector dose necessary to achieve the therapeutic effect.
enablingTechnologies: Gene therapy platform
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications: The company’s innovative technology could enable viral vectors to reach areas like the central nervous system (CNS) and peripheral nervous system (PNS), thus opening the door to new therapeutic options.

title: Biosensing
abstract: Biosensing has the objective of developing, industrializing, producing and marketing diagnostic devices which, starting from issues related to human pathologies, can subsequently evolve with the same technologies also in the food and environmental analysis fields.
competitiveAdvantages:
The innovation of Technology lies in:

  1. in the modification and functionalization methods of the sensor, in the immobilization procedure of the bioreceptor and in the related signal analysis software capable of both unique elements for each Biomarker;
  2. in the engineering of an analysis Cell that will contain the Biosensor and which will allow the sample to be deposited on the sensitive part of the immunosensor, this Cell will be "disposable" and the same for each Biomarker.
description: Biosensing aims to develop, validate, and market diagnostic devices (Point of Care Testing), thanks to a technological platform based on supramolecular chemistry and nanotechnologies and interfaced with smartphones to produce rapid and inexpensive devices with a level of accuracy comparable to traditional laboratory tests.
enablingTechnologies: Italian patent holder: n. 102021000030893 granted on 01/08/2024 “Electrode for the detection of analytes, related biosensor and production process” and n. 102022000001490 granted on 01/31/2024 “Electrochemical biosensors including resorcarenes”
mainApplications: Electrochemical and/or optical sensors modified with nanostructured materials, coupled to interactions between enzymatic molecules or antibodies and analytes of clinical, toxicological, food and environmental interest
payoff: POCT products based on distinctive technological platform
revenueModel: Completion of POCT development and commercial launch in the B2B market and subsequently in the B2C market
targetCustomers: B2B market: analysis laboratories, pharmacies and hospitals and B2C market

abstract: Service to support researchers for animal pharmacological testing in the field of hemato-oncology and oncology research, through technical-scientific consultancy activities and services throughout the entire trial process.

Unlike direct competitors, toClinics offers:

  • Statistical analysis, tables, graphs and figure design also for scientific works and publications;
  • Proteomic analyses, immunohistochemical analyses, next generation sequencing analyses
payoff: Animal pharmacological testing activities with a focus on the oncology-hematology and oncology fields
revenueModel: A consultation will have an hourly cost starting from 50 euro. To carry out the entire study the cost can range from a minimum of 10,000 euro to a maximum of 30,000 euro. Since the service is modular, the cost may vary based on the consultancy that will be requested during the study
targetCustomers: Researchers in the pharmaco-oncology field (hemato-oncologist, oncologist, chemist-pharmaceutical), IRCCS, CNR and pharmaceutical-biotech companies that develop oncology drug

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: GEO-K
abstract: GEO-K specialized in the extraction and advanced analysis of geospatial data from satellites and drones. We offer innovative and customized geoinformation products, based on satellite data and drone acquisitions, to meet specific needs.
businessTraction:
• Aeronautica Militare ("EUMETNET"): extreme weather forecasting
  • ASI ("AISAR"): processing of SAR data on board
  • ESA ("URBANA"): urban planning analysis, urban environmental parameters and impacts on people/infrastructure; DeepCompression app (image compression) for the ESA CubeSat mission Φ-sat-2
  • e-GEOS Spa ("IRIDE")
    campaign review
competitiveAdvantages:
• Cutting-edge, customized services and solutions;
  • Enhanced reliability through optimized neural networks trained on large multinational datasets;
  • Comprehensive temporal coverage with microwave imagery;
  • High precision in data interpretation;
  • Continuous skill development through collaborations with research laboratories and the European Space Agency.
competitiveScenario: The competitiveness is based on innovation in satellite observation and geospatial data management. Collaboration with the University of Tor Vergata provides access to academic resources, and funding for R&D. GEO-K develops scalable and customized solutions through a deep understanding of data and sector-specific needs, supported by an advanced remote sensing lab and multidisciplinary expertise.
description: GEO-K offers advanced Geospatial Artificial Intelligence solutions, combining artificial intelligence with geospatial data to extract concrete and useful information for strategic decision-making in various sectors. Whether it's monitoring agriculture, planning urban development, or managing natural resources, we offer tailored solutions and the support of a multidisciplinary team in interpreting data. This enables us to optimize operations, reduce costs, and gain a competitive edge in the relevant sector.
enablingTechnologies: Satellite imagery, Geographic Information Systems (GIS), Drone imagery, Artificial Intelligence (AI)
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications: The application of artificial intelligence to satellite and drone data enables the rapid transformation of geospatial information into actionable parameters, directly integrating them into decision-making and operational processes for more efficient and timely management. Key applications include: updating territorial statistics, environmental monitoring, forest resource management, natural risk assessment, agricultural optimization, and decision support in construction, infrastructure, and real estate.

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Roma Tor Vergata

payoff: We care for the future of the Earth: innovative and customized solutions through advanced analysis of geospatial data from satellites and drones.
revenueModel:
GEO-K creates value for its clients through 2 main models:

  • Pay-Per-Project Commission Model: tailored solutions to meet the specific needs of the client (e.g., advanced analyses, customized reports)
  • Consultancy & Professional Services Modelongoing: consultancy for customized geospatial solutions.
targetCustomers: Public entities (such as local and regional administrations, ministries and government agencies, research institutions, and universities) and private entities (cooperatives and consortia in the agrifood sector, agroindustry, tourism, and land management) that require geoinformation and environmental monitoring solutions.

title: VoiceWise
abstract: VoiceWise offers an advanced voice analysis system with health and health monitoring applications.
businessTraction: Collaboration with health and technology companies.
competitiveAdvantages: Advanced voice analysis to detect health changes with AI technology, improving preventive diagnostics.
competitiveScenario: The eHealth and health monitoring sector with a focus on innovative voice solutions and data security.
description:
VoiceWise develops artificial intelligence-based speech analysis hardware and software that can provide patient health feedback. By analyzing voice samples with powerful signal processing algorithms, artificial intelligence and machine learning, VoiceWise detects anomalies that require your attention.
Voicewise_pitch2024

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: BioLT
abstract: BioLT is developing a biotechnological platform based on bioactive liposomes to combat drug-resistant infectious diseases.
businessTraction: Collaboration with universities and research institutes.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Stimulating the innate immune response against pathogens;
  • Provide alternative and complementary antimicrobial treatment;
  • Possibility of carrying the antimicrobial in a single formulation enhancing its effect in a combined action.
competitiveScenario: At the moment, given the novelty of use, there are no direct competitors being our complementary and complementary solution to antibiotic treatments.
description:
BioLT has developed liposome-based formulations with demonstrated pro-microbicidal and anti-inflammatory properties that can:

  • Increase innate immune response and reduce inflammation;
  • in combined treatments, increase the effectiveness against intracellular pathogens while the antibiotic attacks those extracellular ones;
  • To deliver antimicrobials in a single therapeutic formulation.
    BioLT_pitch2024
enablingTechnologies: Biotechnology platforms.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000

payoff: BioLT: beyond the antibiotics to fight MDR
revenueModel: Sale of solutions to pharmaceutical companies and/or transfer of part of the capital to potential investors.

title: FluidX
abstract: FluidX develops an information tool, called Fast-Workflow, capable of automatically managing all phases of the fluid-dynamic analysis process, with considerable savings in time and resources.
businessTraction:
• EGB s.r.l
  • XIBO s.r.l
  • Angelantoni Test Technologies s.r.l
  • CMC s.p.a
  • Loccioni - AEA s.r.l
  • DATA4 ITALY s.p.a
  • Ing. Francesco Di Maria
competitiveAdvantages:
• Adaptation to the most varied business needs;
  • Approach to research in the field of computational fluid-dynamics analysis based on predictive, accurate and precise analyses, quickly and based on the context and industrial requests
competitiveScenario: The direct competitors identified are: Powertech Engineering s.r.l, Nais s.r.l and R&D CFD s.r.l. Compared to the competitors just mentioned, the proposed approach involves the automation of computational fluid-dynamics simulation processes. Furthermore, it offers the possibility of quickly carrying out parametric explorations to evaluate the effect of varying the quantities of interest
description: The entrepreneurial project was born from the experience gained by the research group led by Professor Michele Battistoni, within the Engineering Department of the University of Perugia. The service offered consists of the development and testing of Fast-Workflow: an IT tool designed specifically and customized for the management and automation of the simulation workflow in the field of computational fluid-dynamics

• Computational fluid-dynamics
  • Python language

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: ThinkQuantum
abstract: ThinkQuantum designs, develops and commercialises devices for secure communications and random number generation based on quantum features, precision optical-mechanical instrumentation and both software and hardware solutions for research, defence and aerospace applications.
businessTraction:
• QUDICE Horizon Project
  • QUID Project Call: DIGITAL-2021-QCI-01 (EU Secure Quantum Communication Infrastructure)
  • Member of the FPA (Framework Partnership Agreements) with title Quantum Secure Networks Partnership EU Call: HORIZON-CL4-2021-DIGITAL-EMERGING-02
  • GAOM - Generic Adaptive Optics for Optical Communication and Quantum Key Distribution', funded by ESA call AO/1-10936/22/NL/NDGAOM
  • Robust Entanglement Source: prototype photon pair source for satellite missions.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Possibility of certifying the randomness of the numbers generated without a full
    calibration of the devices used
  • Intrinsic long-term stability
  • Bit quantum from record error rate
  • Higher security standards compared to random number generators based on deterministic algorithms
  • Efficient self-synchronisation based on Qubit, thanks to which no additional fibres are required
  • Fast installation
  • Possibility to implement complex network topologie
  • Flexible design for customised solutions
  • High data throughput
competitiveScenario:
Most competitors are from outside the EU.
The most active companies are: Id Quantique (IdQ), Toshiba, QuantumCTek. In recent years, several EU start-ups have entered the market.
description: ThinkQuantum offers complete solutions for IT security and communication systems based on quantum technologies. These solutions embrace fibre, free-space and hybrid communications links in complex networks. ThinkQuantum devices are based on patented solutions and can be easily integrated into existing telecommunications networks.
enablingTechnologies:
• QKD Quantum key distribution
  • QRNG Quantum random number generator
  • Qubit4Sync: new synchronisation technique for QKD
  • iPognac: qubit encoder with low error rate and high stability
fundingStageDescription:
The company has validated and commercialised in the market for more than 2 years.
During this same period, it has established itself as one of the leading players in its sector.
Team scaling objectives: product and market expansion.
mainApplications:
• Security systems
  • Classical cryptographic services
  • Communication systems with moving platforms (drones, high-altitude platforms, aircraft, ships)
  • TLC and ICT networks
  • Data centres
  • Space stations and large space integrators (Thales, Airbus, OHB)
  • Infrastructure operators (ENEL, RFI, etc.)
  • Universities and research centres, for the creation of a national quantum network
payoff: Quantum-based technology solutions for computer security and communication systems
revenueModel:
• Device design, manufacture and sales
  • Feasibility studies and consultancy on quantum technologies
targetCustomers:
QKD for terrestrial applications based on fibre and/or free space

  • Network & Management Service providers: TLC, Trains, Energy, Defence, Avionic, Automotive
  • ICT and cryptographic service providers
  • Data protection for banking, insurance, Energy & Service Mgmt

QKD for satellite-based space applications

  • Government agencies

QRNG

  • ICT and cryptographic service providers
  • Server and ICT manufacturers
