title: BT-InnoVaChem
abstract: BT-InnoVaChem develops sustainable processes for antimicrobial compounds for industrial and healthcare uses.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Innovation in the field of antimicrobial compounds with eco-sustainable processes, usable in both the civil and military sectors;
  • Biological tests have shown that the antibacterial agent produced by BT-InnoVaChem has an antibacterial action up to 15 times greater than one of the most widely used natural antiseptic agents in industry.
competitiveScenario: BT-InnoVaChem is distinguished by its ability to develop antimicrobial compounds with an eco-sustainable and low impact production process.
description:
BT-InnoVaChem takes a sustainable approach to the production of new and effective active ingredients, particularly molecules of biomedical interest. It also designs and develops new formulations for personal care and environmental products without the use of substances that are harmful or dangerous to man and the environment.

BT-IVC_pitch
enablingTechnologies: Innovative synthesis processes and technologies for the production of antimicrobial compounds with antibacterial, antifungal and antiviral properties.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
Antimicrobial compounds in the health and industrial fields. The technology developed allows for the efficient and sustainable production of a powerful antibacterial agent that can be used in multiple products. The main applications include:

  • Liquid for surface disinfection (including hospital-level)
  • products for apiculture
  • Medical products (such as respiratory infections, expectorants or for the treatment of onychomycosis)
  • Home and personal care products.

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Roma Tor Vergata

payoff: A sustainable approach to chemical innovation
revenueModel: Production and sale of antimicrobial compounds, potentially licensed to public and private customers.
targetCustomers: Health and industrial sectors

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Renuvait
abstract: Renuvait supports the formulation of new products or the improvement of those present in the Portfolio, with an increase in quality and performance which determines a positive impact on the transport properties of active molecules and ingredients in terms of ABSORPTION, RELEASE and STABILITY.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Greater activity with a reduced dose of active ingredient
  • Greater chemical-physical stability of the compounds and possibility of selectively reaching target tissues and organs, consequently decreasing any systemic overdoses
  • Diversification, i.e. the ability to produce different forms of administration starting from the same nanoformulate
  • Enhancement of biotechnological products, also deriving from microalgae
  • Recovery and Upcycling of biomolecules present in agro-industrial waste products
  • Biodegradable and microplastic-free matrices
competitiveScenario: Competitors use microparticles (between 1 and 1000 µm) or nanoparticles (dimensions smaller than 100 nm). Our approach differs due to the encapsulation in particles with dimensions between 100 and 1000 nm, which we define as fine particles (fP), which allow us to obtain a larger surface area of ​​action than microparticles without however incurring the problems of nanomaterials.
description: The result of years of rigorous research, Renuvait scientists have developed an innovative technology to solve the problems of EFFICACY, BIOAVAILABILITY and STABILITY of biologically active compounds through a distribution platform that we define as "molecular delivery" based on nano- and micro-processes. encapsulation. Renuvait recognizes the innovative and fundamental role of fine particles (100-1000 nm) as the method of choice for the transport of compounds and intends to actively contribute to their development and widespread use, through a holistic approach.
enablingTechnologies:
• "Molecular delivery"
  • Biodegradable particles (fine particles 100-1000 nm)
  • Transdermal delivery
  • Up-cycling
  • Intestinal absorption
  • Controlled release
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
Renuvait currently focuses on enhancing antioxidants to counteract oxidative stress, premature aging and prevent cardiovascular and neurodegenerative diseases.
Applications:

  • Cosmetics
  • Nutraceuticals
  • Pharmaceuticals
  • Targeted delivery of active ingredients and phytostimulants in the hydroponic and agricultural sector
  • Recovery and up-cycling of agro-industrial waste products
  • Development of antimicrobial nano-platforms to counter the proliferation of antibiotic resistance
  • Expansion of “molecular delivery” to Pet Care
payoff: Adding value to your molecules
revenueModel:
Renuvait has a BtoB business model through which it obtains revenue through different types of activities:

  • R&D services and feasibility studies
  • Process integration services
  • Batch production and consultancy
targetCustomers: Renuvait intends to offer its customers active in the sectors of Cosmetics, Nutraceuticals, Pharmaceuticals, up to the Agro-industry, modular packages for the implementation of innovative solutions based on bioactive molecules made effective and enhanced by the use of bio-nanotechnologies.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: WISEcivil
abstract: WISEcivil specialises in the field of existing buildings, which are often characterised by structural insufficiency and fragility as well as high vulnerability to seismic actions. WISEcivil carries out research and development, consultancy and design activities with a wide range of new techniques.
competitiveAdvantages:
1. High technological know-how: The DD has an extremely solid research background that makes it unique on the market. In 2025, it will be the only device of its kind tested inside the structure in an operational environment thanks to 3D tests conducted on a vibrating table, achieving a TRL9;
  2. Bi-directional behaviour: The DD is installed in the beam-column nodes of the main structure and, unlike similar products already on the market, it also acts in the orthogonal direction, leading to significant savings in economic terms.
description: WISEcivil specialises in the field of existing buildings, which are often characterised by structural insufficiency and fragility as well as high vulnerability to seismic actions. WISEcivil carries out research and development, consultancy and design activities to broaden the conception of new techniques and solutions for structural reinforcement.spectrum: from numerical and experimental modelling of structures and structural details, to the design of rehabilitation interventions and adaptation to current standards through.
enablingTechnologies: Software
mainApplications: The Double Damp (DD) device was designed to be installed on existing prefabricated reinforced concrete and prestressed concrete buildings, typically used for production and commercial activities, both industrial and artisanal, with the aim of fully preserving the building in the event of an earthquake. The use of DD makes it possible to safeguard human life, first and foremost, and the building itself, including production plants, equipment, stocks and all the goods present.
payoff: Works of ideas in Structural Engineering
targetCustomers: Existing prefabricated reinforced concrete and prestressed concrete buildings are typically used for manufacturing and commercial activities, both industrial and craft.

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: LP Tech
abstract: LP Tech produces prosthetic moulds directly in the operating room, fully restoring shape and function, reducing the surgical learning curve and number of specialists involved, ensuring almost unlimited repeatability.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Surgical practice is improved and simplified, as the number of specialists employed in the operating room will be reduced to one;
  • The mould is fully sterilisable and can be reused several times for the same patient, should he or she have to undergo explantation due to infection (6-20% of cases reported in the literature) or rupture of the prosthesis (1-2% reported in the literature);
  • The product is ready for marketing.
description: LP Tech designs, manufactures, markets and repairs medical devices such as prostheses, endoprostheses, orthoses and aids, which are manufactured by means of form-fitting with innovative methods and/or the intersection of innovative and traditional systems, either by using newly developed materials, mainly silicones and technical polymers for 3D printing, or widely used materials. LP Tech produces prosthetic molds directly in the operating room, restoring shape and function, reducing the surgical learning curve and number of specialists involved, ensuring high repeatability.
enablingTechnologies: 3D printing
mainApplications:
This is a reinterpretation of the method used to make prostheses for cranioplasty surgery currently in use in major neurosurgical clinics, with the aim of reducing time and maximising patient recovery through optimal aesthetics.

The target market is the biomedical market and in particular, the market for prostheses, bone substitutes and custom-made cranioplasties.
payoff: Life Protecting Technologies
revenueModel: B2B, with public and private hospitals as customers and neurosurgeons as end users.
targetCustomers: The production of cranioplasties is mainly aimed at public or private hospitals with a neurosurgery department.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Mithril Minds
abstract: Mithril Minds develops generative AI-based solutions to simplify compliance and administrative processes. Its first platform, LUNA, is the first in Italy to use Artificial Intelligence to automate and optimize the analysis of regulations such as GDPR, ISO and calls for tenders.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Cost reduction: automates compliance processes, cutting down on consultancy and management costs;
  • Efficiency and productivity: supports staff by increasing their productivity;
  • Regulatory adaptability: manages complex standards (e.g. GDPR, ISO) with automatic and modular updates;
  • Reduction of risks and penalties: minimises misinterpretation in concrete cases and ensures accuracy;
  • Flexibility and scalability: it adapts to various industries and grows with business needs;
  • Source access: proprietary database for authoritative and up-to-date source based responses.
competitiveScenario: LUNA stands out from its competitors for its specialization on Italian legislation and the use of a proprietary database of sources. Unlike big tech like Microsoft and IBM or other RegTech, LUNA provides detailed answers based on Italian sources and leverages Generative AI for greater flexibility and a significant increase in productivity compared to legacy software.
description: Italian companies are facing increasing complexity in their compliance management, with high costs and the risk of sanctions. The "LUNA" platform, based on Generative AI, was designed by Mithril Minds to alleviate these burdens, offering a proprietary DB and LLMmodels capable of interpreting complex regulations and adapting to business needs, especially in the context of GDPR, ISO and procurement. By automating audits and generating compliant documents, LUNA significantly reduces costs and hours of work dedicated to compliance, freeing up valuable resources for the company.
enablingTechnologies: LUNA uses AI solutions, Language Models (LLM), Retrieval Augmented Generation (RAG) and a proprietary orchestration system. Its database also collects up-to-date regulatory sources, while a modular interface allows for analysis, verification and generation of relevant content.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
• Automated regulatory verification: Precise analysis of regulations, reducing the risk of errors and penalties;
  • Generation of compliant content: Automatic creation of compliance documentation (manuals, responses to calls for proposals, etc.);
  • Intuitive and modular interface: Allows dialogue and research on regulatory sources, adapting to various sectors and business sizes;
  • Proprietary database (DB-MM): Access to up-to-date regulations for detailed and relevant answers;
  • Integration with business workflows: Specific adaptation for complex processes of large companies.

owners.name: Alma Mater Studiorum Università di Bologna

payoff: Generative AI for administrative compliance and automation
revenueModel: The revenue model for Mithril Minds is based on flexible SaaS subscriptions, calculated according to the number of consultations, activated forms and users in the team. This scalable approach allows you to adapt the offer to the needs of companies of different sizes, generating recurring revenues.
targetCustomers: Mithril Minds' target customers include Italian companies and public administrations of all sizes and sectors that manage regulatory compliance. The potential market is substantial considering the gradual addition of regulations over time and expansion to other EU countries.

trl.label: 3 - Experimental proof of concept

title: SPlastica
abstract: SPlastica produces SP-Milk compounds, an innovative material that can be processed like fossil plastics. The objects made of SP-Milk, being however based on natural polymers, are not plastic by definition and can be thrown into the collection of moisture.
businessTraction:
Interactions with:

  • Department of Chemical Science and Technology, University of Rome Tor Vergata
  • EEN
  • Ometec Srl
  • Lazio Innova Spa
  • University of Naples
  • Emec Spa
  • Dairy farms
  • Companies in the packaging sector
competitiveAdvantages: SP-Milk is made from natural polymers, such as paper, but unlike paper and wood it can be processed industrially like plastics, making it compostable and environmentally sustainable like paper, but versatile and easily workable like plastic. Being produced from food waste, it does not include the use of arable land, as often happens in the production of other types of bioplastics, thus avoiding the related problems associated with soil depletion and also cutting down, a cost item in the production process.
competitiveScenario:
Differences between SP-Milk and competitors:

  • Produced from organic waste, does not use land for crops
  • Compostable in the house
  • If released into the environment, it rapidly biodegrades in both soil and sea
  • 100% natural polymer based
  • Stable under normal conditions of use and heat
  • Suitable for use with industrial machines for plastics production
  • Production with lower CO2 emissions
description: SPlastica produces SP-Milk granules, an innovative material that can be industrially processed like fossil plastics. Bioplastics currently on the market have biodegradation problems if released inadvertently or imprudently into soil. Therefore, bioplastics cannot be used for the production of disposable articles. Articles made of SP-Milk, being based exclusively on natural polymers, do not fall under the definition of "plastic" and can therefore be used for the production of disposable articles, as can paper.
enablingTechnologies: Industrial extrusion, injection moulding
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
SP-Milk is produced in the form of granules, which have multiple applications: from rigid packaging to toys, from medical to high-tech sector and the final product is easily applicable both in large and small distribution. The main applications are:

  • disposable materials (cutlery, plates, glasses, coffee sticks, etc.)
  • food packaging
  • cosmetic packaging
  • non-woven fabric (TNT) based on SP-Milk
  • toys

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Roma Tor Vergata

payoff: Splastica: it’s not plastic!
revenueModel:
• Consultancy services for material customisation;
  • Advice on the production of bioplastic material from other organic waste;
  • Production and sale of SP-Milk granules.
targetCustomers:
• Services: companies interested in using SP-Milk as a raw material in production processes. SPlastica has developed services related to the demand for bioplastics from different industrial sectors, ensuring benefits through the production of a completely biodegradable material both in sea water and in soil.
  • Granulate sales: plastics processing companies.

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: AGREENMENT
abstract: Agreenment has developed CARBOND, an innovative system to quantify and value ecosystem services deriving from carbon sequestration in agricultural soils. Through advanced simulations, CARBOND optimises soil management and incentivises economic mechanisms that benefit agriculture and the environment.
businessTraction:
• Agreement with ZESPRI for commercial application;
  • Collaboration with the University of Basilicata and with CREA - AA for the development, testing and validation phases of the results obtained;
  • Partnership with e.RATIO s.r.l. for the software design and development phase.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Economic valorization of ecosystem services related to soil carbon, encouraging sustainable practices;
  • Integrated and user-friendly platform that offers simulations at territorial and particle scale;
  • Simplified use of the APEX model, open-source and scientifically validated, for accurate analyses of agricultural and environmental management;
  • Support for strategic decisions-making for public and private entities, aligning public and private interests;
  • Adaptability to different agricultural and territorial contexts, with the possibility of simulating land use change scenarios.
competitiveScenario: CARBOND stands out from competitors such as Soil Capital (Belgium), TreeDom (Italy) and Madaprojects (Italy) for its integrated approach to the valuation of ecosystem services in addition to carbon sequestration. While other tools focus on carbon credits, CARBOND uses the APEX model for detailed analyses of fertility, water cycle and nutrients, offering full support to public and private entities
description: The start-up focuses on the inadequate valuation of ecosystem services (ES) related to soil organic carbon sequestration (SOC) resulting from the implementation of sustainable agricultural practices. The scarcity of concrete tools hinders the quantification and monetisation of these benefits. Agreenment has developed CARBOND, an innovative system that optimises soil management, incentivises economic mechanisms that benefit agriculture and the environment and facilitates the adoption of regenerative practices, contributing to the efficient management of territories. Pitch Deck Agreenment
enablingTechnologies:
• Big Data Analytics for processing agronomic and environmental data
  • Platform/App for accessing and managing simulations
  • Cloud Computing for storage and scalable calculation
  • System Integration with models such as APEX for predictive analysis and land use scenarios
  • Blockchain (under development)
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
• Support to farmers in the adoption of sustainable practices and in the economic valorization of ecosystem services through incentive mechanisms. Creation of an eco-oriented label;
  • Monitoring and territorial planning for public bodies and land managers;
  • Simulation of land use change scenarios to reduce erosion, desertification and environmental impacts;
  • Integration with EU policies and national plans on sustainability and environmental protection;
  • Application of carbon credits and regenerative agriculture in emerging markets.
payoff: Transform soil into an economic resource by enhancing the ecosystem services resulting from sustainable agriculture
revenueModel: The aim is to monetize through subscriptions to the platform, customized consulting services for entities and producer organizations, and commissions on carbon credits generated. The model is scalable, extendable to other regions, integrable with carbon credit markets and environmental incentives.
targetCustomers:
• Agricultural companies and consortia (POs) interested in enhancing ecosystem services;
  • Public bodies for territorial planning and management;
  • Environmental organisations and NGOs for conservation projects;
  • Carbon credit market operators and sustainability investors;
  • Consulting firms in the agro-environmental sector.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: SENSE4MED
abstract: Sense4Med, an innovative SME, develops devices with applications in various sectors. Its aim is to provide integrated solutions that meet market needs and help improve people’s quality of life.
businessTraction: An investment contract with Scientifica Venture Capital and Lazio Innova. In addition, Horizon Europe EIC 2023 Pathfinder Open of the European Union, Horizon Europe EIC, grant agreement number 101130395.
competitiveAdvantages:
The advantages of the Sense4Med solution are manifold:

  • Sustainability: sensors are made of paper, an environmentally friendly and biodegradable material;
  • Ease of use: the sensors are intuitive and require minimal training for non-specialist personnel;
  • Low cost: Low-cost paper and manufacturing techniques make devices widely accessible;
  • Versatility: they can be used in different areas, from biomedicine to agrifood and environmental contaminants detection.
competitiveScenario: Sense4Med roadmap focuses on the biomedical sector, with a focus on rare diseases, an area increasingly recognised and supported at European level. In June 2023, the European Commission highlighted the importance of biosensors as innovative tools for managing more serious rare diseases, reinforcing the commitment to advanced diagnostic solutions.
description:
Sense4Med, founded in 2019 and spin-off of the University of Rome 'Tor Vergata', is a world leader in paper sensor research. The company develops electrochemical sensors printed on filter and office paper using screen printing with conductive inks. These devices, sustainable and low-cost, are internationally recognised for 'point-of-care' solutions. Although it also operates in agrifood, defense and environment, the main focus of Sense4Med is in biomedicine, with the aim of making diagnosis and monitoring of pathologies more accessible.
Pitch
enablingTechnologies: The technology based on paper-printed electrochemical biosensors represents a cutting edge in the field of scientific research and advantages such as high sensitivity, ease of use and speed, which allows us to analyze quickly being the instant response.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: Sense4Med mainly focuses on the development of paper-based electrochemical sensors, considered its "Killer Application". These devices are used in the biomedical field for point-of-care diagnostic monitoring. In addition to the sanitary field, sensors can also be used in agrifood, environment and defense. Thanks to their sustainability, ease of use and low paper costs, these devices are a versatile and innovative solution.

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Roma Tor Vergata

payoff: Smart sensors for sustainable life: from hospital to home-spital
revenueModel: The proceeds will be used to introduce the device developed by Sense4Med to the European market, with a focus on cystic fibrosis diagnosis and monitoring, facilitating access to innovative technologies and faster diagnosis in the medical field.
targetCustomers: Sense4Med focuses mainly on target customers such as doctors and healthcare personnel. Ease of use is essential, as it responds to the needs of stressful clinical contexts where speed and effectiveness are essential. Another advantage is the portability, which makes it easier to use in emergency situations.

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: B.Re.D
abstract: BReD applies the results of research conducted at the Polytechnic in innovative contexts, and develops new products and services in the field of diagnostics, evaluation, monitoring, recovery and conservation of buildings.
competitiveAdvantages: Optimization of information content and digital product management processes, promotion of a collaborative approach between specialists, enabling remote working methods
description: The Company deals with: designing and conducting investigations into the state of conservation of existing buildings; provide services for on-site and/or laboratory diagnostics, both destructive and non-destructive; provide services for the analysis of pathologies and failures in existing buildings; provide services on innovative materials for the recovery of existing buildings; provide operational assistance and consultancy services, aimed at public and private entities, in the sector of recovery of existing building heritage, also with reference to historic buildings and cultural heritage
enablingTechnologies: HBIM, GIS, VR
mainApplications: Diagnostics and monitoring of buildings, through experimental measurement techniques (e.g. thermographic recordings, radar scans, high and low frequency microseismic measurements and tomographies, sclerometric, magnetometric, penetrometric tests, tests with flat jacks, video-endoscopic inspections, monitoring sensors) and digital technologies (HBIM, GIS, photogrammetric models, VR) for rendering environments and data on the performance and state of conservation of buildings, including historic ones.
payoff: Innovative diagnostics for building conservation.
targetCustomers: Public administrations, private managers of large building assets, construction companies, diagnostic/monitoring product/service companies

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: PolySenSe Innovations
abstract: Polysense Innovations was born to offer innovative solutions within the gas sensor technology market.
competitiveAdvantages: The QEPAS and LITES techniques are unique in the panorama of solutions in the field of gas spectroscopy, thanks to the modularity of the components which allow the measurement apparatus to be adapted to different gaseous species by replacing only the laser source. The sensitive elements exhibit a very wide band response and the levels of compaction and robustness are compatible with in-situ and real time detection.
description: Polysense Innovations was born to offer innovative solutions within the gas sensor technology market. The innovative techniques implemented and developed by Polysense are mainly Quartz-Enhanced Photoacoustic Spectroscopy (QEPAS) and Light-Induced Thermoelastic Spectroscopy (LITES) and use piezoelectric resonators in quartz and lithium niobate as sensitive elements, in acoustic detectors and optical detectors mode.
enablingTechnologies: QEPAS, Big Data Analytics, IoT
mainApplications:
• Control of industrial processes
  • Detection of toxic gas leaks
  • Environmental monitoring
  • Sustainable oil exploration
  • Breath analysis
payoff: Design, prototyping, innovation.
targetCustomers: Companies in the petrochemical sector, companies in the electronics sector, research centers, public administrations.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Plant Flow
abstract: Plant Flow accelerates the screening and phenotyping activity in plant-science by using the most solid methods of investigation of plant ecophysiology: gas exchange analysis and fluorimetry.
competitiveAdvantages:
PFS offers its scientific expertise and its own experimental and technological solutions through the analysis service to its clients, Thus, this means it delates the need for large initial investments in equipment and staff training for client companies. PFS provides:

  • Tailor-made solutions, with customized experimental setup;
  • Proprietary equipment, optimized growth protocols, standardized and reproducible analyses
description: Plant Flow Solutions (PFS) team aims to improve the scalability and accuracy of physiological measurements, such as the analysis of CO2 and H2O fluxes between plants and the atmosphere, commonly referred to as gas exchange analysis. These analysis are the most detailed and effective tool for understanding plant performance.
enablingTechnologies:
• Whole plant gas exchange analysis with automated platform and PFS technology;
  • Traditional gas exchange analysis (IRGA and porometer);
  • fluorimetric analysis
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
PFS' activity responds to the growing needs of various industries, which demand more precise and effective analyses and technologies to highlight the effects of their products on plant performance:

  • the study of plant responses to environmental stress;
  • phenotyping activities to support the development and characterisation of new cultivars from breeding or genome editing;
  • performance testing with physiological analyses to be integrated into the test activity offered by the test facility.
payoff: Measure, Optimize, Accelerate.
targetCustomers: European bio-stimulants producers, breaders and research organisations

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: DNAswitch
abstract: DNAswitch aims to cure Huntington's disease, which currently lacks effective treatments. Its mission is to introduce a drug that can stop neurodegeneration, filling the gap between scientific research and clinical application.
businessTraction:
• G-Factor Golinelli Foundation acceleration programme
  • Winners of Start Cup Veneto 2021, a business plan competition organised by the University of Padua, the University of Verona and the Iuav University of Venice
  • Second prize winners in the ‘concept teams’ category of the GISU competition 2022, Urban Innovation and Entrepreneurship Competition, promoted by the Guangzhou International Sister Cities University Alliance (GISU), organised in collaboration with the University of Padua
competitiveAdvantages:
• New therapies for currently untreatable polyQ diseases
  • New therapies for Huntington's disease
  • Therapy based on the delivery of a gene with intrinsic therapeutic activity, as opposed to previously used approaches based on the reduction of toxic protein production
competitiveScenario:
Wave Life Sciencs and Roche have developed antisense oligonucleotides, to be repeatedly intrastrially or intrathecally administered, which aim to reduce the mutated huntingtin protein.

uniQure's AMT-130 is the first true gene therapy in phase II clinical trial: it uses adenoviral vectors to reduce the production of mutated HTT.
description:
DNAswitch's mission is to develop a gene therapy to treat Huntington's disease, for which there is currently no effective cure.

Huntington's disease is a rare neurodegenerative disorder characterised by an glutamine (Q) amino acid abnormal repeat in the huntingtin gene, resulting in a toxic effect of the mutant protein. The used approach is based on the delivery of a therapeutic gene via adeno-associated vectors (AAV) or mRNA, in order to protect neurons from this mutant protein's toxic effects while preserving their vitality.
enablingTechnologies: Gene Therapy
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
• Huntington's disease gene therapy
  • Gene therapy for polyQ diseases: spinocerebellar ataxias (SCA1, SCA2, SCA6, SCA7, SCA17; Machado-Joseph disease (MJD/SCA3); Huntington's disease (HD); dentate-rhombic-pallid-luisiana atrophy (DRPLA); spinal and bulbar muscular atrophy, X-linked 1 (SMAX1/SBMA)
payoff: Biotechnology research and gene therapy treatments serving people with Huntington's disease.
revenueModel: To cope with the high costs of this ambitious project, DNAswitch uses strategic partnerships. Revenues are expected only in the exit phase, when the product will have reached an advanced stage of development and will therefore represent a less risky investment for a future buyer.
targetCustomers: Pharmaceutical companies

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: WINGED
abstract: Winged designs and develops Bioraffineria technological platforms for the exploitation of agro-food waste through integrated processes to create high added value products and energy (direct and biofuels).
competitiveAdvantages:
1. Excellent technical and scientific experience of the working team.
  2. Real opportunity to turn costs (waste and effluent treatment) into business (high-value products) through processes with low environmental impact and high economic profitability.
  3. Possibility of aggregation of multiple entities in the territory.
competitiveScenario:
• Primary producers in the agri-food supply chain;
  • secondary producers (intermediates for the cosmetic and pharmaceutical industries);
  • energy suppliers.

The competitive scenario concerns the small number of companies and professional firms capable of building integrated biorefinery plants through technology transfer of advanced research in the areas of green extraction of bioactive compounds
description: Winged operates in the Circular Economy field, designing and developing biorefinery technology platforms for the valorization of agrifood waste, and creating value for the entire supply chain and the Environment. The company's activities are focused on the valorization of agrifood waste through integrated processes to produce high value-added products and energy (direct and biofuels). Technological solutions are built based on the needs and opportunities of producers, bio districts and territories, in order to provide new business opportunities and make rural economies more resilient.
enablingTechnologies:
• Advanced technologies for waste traceability;
  • Advanced technologies for the extraction of active compounds from waste (with low environmental impact);
  • Advanced technologies for the conversion of biomass with high moisture content into energy.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
1. Reliable feasibility studies for supply chain technological innovation;
  2. Integrated solutions with the specific orography and social fabric of the area;
  3. Design and development of solutions for value recovery and integrated waste management from traditional supply chains such as wine, oil and fisheries.
payoff: We turn waste into growth opportunities
revenueModel:
1. Advisory services for conducting feasibility studies and support for financing plans.
  2. Implementation of executive projects of biorefinery, through the evaluation also of direct involvement in the investment and subsequent operation of the plants.
targetCustomers: Primary producers in the agribusiness supply chain; secondary producers (intermediates for the cosmetics and pharmaceutical industries); energy suppliers

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: BEST Design
abstract: BEST Design (Bim Engineering STart-up) operates in the field of digital evolution in the construction sector, offering support for the configuration of systems and processes enabled by digital technologies oriented towards BIM (Building Information Modelling).
competitiveAdvantages: The Digital Twin system is able to guarantee a high level of safety, reliability and interoperability thanks to the joint use of intelligent sensors, data processing, and automation techniques. Furthermore, it represents an innovation in the field, as it is dedicated to multiple areas at the same time (for example, energy and structural), unlike competitors who are specific to the energy or structural sectors, and dedicated to industrial processes and not to the built environment.
competitiveScenario: Since this is a highly technological and specialized product, today there are no "turnkey" systems for the construction sector capable of providing a Digital Twin system but only home automation applications mainly oriented towards domestic assembly, therefore without aggregation and simulations on the data.
description: BEST Design operates in the field of digital evolution in the construction sector with the aim to develope digital management models consisting of the integration of data and information content in synergy with the structural, technological, morphological, and plant engineering aspects in the life cycle of buildings and urban systems. These management models (also called Digital Twin) allow the implementation of the flows necessary for the production, management and transmission of information and their connection with monitoring and evaluation systems of the life cycle of buildings.
enablingTechnologies: The use of digital methods and technologies such as BIM, IoT, Big Data and Artificial Intelligence allow the digital twin to reflect real-time operating conditions and simulate possible future scenarios through appropriately trained data models.
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications: BEST is committed to the development of a Digital Twin system for the management of buildings, which contributes to the digitalisation of resources and the planning of maintenance activities, with a consequent reduction in operating expenses and related risks. This system allows consumption, maintenance, and safety to be managed simultaneously and effectively, making it useful for monitoring the building from every point of view, and also scalable at the smart city level.
payoff: Digital twins for building management
targetCustomers: Museum managers, laboratory infrastructures, public administration

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: ExtraGEO
abstract: ExtraGEO provides services aimed at the development of the geosites, from basic research to their promotion and valorisation. ExtraGEO carries out dissemination projects in schools of all levels.
businessTraction: Sponsors: Shell, Total, FEEM (Fondazione Eni Enrico Mattei)
competitiveAdvantages: School dissemination services are structured (theory, practice, field) and fill an important gap in training of Earth Sciences, for which school teachers with degrees in geology are few. Basilicata hosts an interesting number of geosites, many of which have been identified, protected and enhanced thanks to the contribution of the spin off.
competitiveScenario: There is no structured competitive scenario in the operational context of the spin-off
description:
ExtraGEO's activities aim at geoconservation, i.e. the protection of the geological heritage through basic research, safety and valorisation interventions. With school projects, “place awareness” is increased in young generations, in order to instill good environmental management practices.

Our activities

Gallery
enablingTechnologies:
• For school setting: flipped classroom, learning by doing, cooperative learning, scaffolding, educational workshops
  • For GEOSITES: SAPR, GIS, ICT
fundingStageDescription: Industrial partnerships are are being developed.
mainApplications:
• School education
  • Enhancement of the territory
  • Geotourism
  • Applied research
payoff: Geology for community
revenueModel: Inclusion of the proposed training activities in the PCTO projects. Support from sponsoring companies. Regional law n. 32/2015 on the protection of geological heritage. Partnership with associations and institutions.
targetCustomers:
• School: students of all levels
  • Geotourism: general public (tourists and residents), schools, associations
  • Geoconservation: administrations, companies, associations.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: Mate
abstract: Mate works at the development and marketing of models for the estimation of the physical risk due to weather and climate-related extreme events. Those models are applied in the insurance, real-estate and financial sectors.
businessTraction:
• Commercial agreement with Guy Carpenter for the development of a model for estimating hail damage (signed)
  • Agreement with AssoFond (association of Italian foundries) for participation in tenders of the Lombardy Region
  • Agreement (under signature) with Victor Insurance Italy for the development of a parametric model for the agricultural sector
  • Agreement (under signature) with Impact SGR for the development of climate hazard indicators
competitiveAdvantages:
• reduces exposure to credit risk
  • Accurately and up-to-date risk estimation using state-of-the-art data and models
  • Speeds up and automates damage assessment processes
  • Provides easy access to information relevant for the customer’s strategic development.

Mate proposes risk transfer systems tailored to the needs of the individual, and offers comprehensive and innovative solutions, Integrate climate risk assessment into business development strategies to undertake adaptation actions that reduce damage and increase profits.
competitiveScenario:
Companies providing historical risk assessments for (re)insurance services (acute physical risk with expertise on the chronic) that offer climate risk assessments for financial institutions (products associated with physical assets: mortgages, real estate, project finance).

Others have updated climate change disaster models (ClimateWise, for real estate portfolios).
description: Mate has developed models for estimating physical risk from extreme weather and climate events (such as floods, droughts, hail and heat waves) in the current scenario and in future climate change scenarios. The models for estimating physical risk were then applied to specific sectors to estimate the economic damage due to extreme events; for example, the model for estimating drought risk was applied to compute the cro yield losses in various areas located in Northern Italy.
enablingTechnologies: AI, Big Data Analytics, Cloud computing
mainApplications:
1. development of models for the estimation of risk due to extreme events (for example, floods, droughts, heat waves, etc.) in the agri-food sector
  2. development of climate hazard indicators for different types of weather-realed extremes
  3. development of models for the estimation of the economic damage associated to weather extremes

owners.name: Scuola Universitaria Superiore IUSS di Pavia

payoff: From Risk to Sustainability
revenueModel:
• Licence
  • Platform with subscription
targetCustomers: Insurance companies, banks, real-estate and financial companies

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: Aindo
abstract: The synthetic data platform for businesses that want to change the world.
businessTraction: EIC Accelerator 2024-2025: €2.1 million research grant, followed by a possible co-investment from the European Investment Bank (EIB)
competitiveAdvantages:
• Improve ETL performance and boost throughput to its highest level
  • Automatically annotate data and open up endless opportunities
  • Effortlessly apply business intelligence methods ranging from statistics to advanced artificial intelligence
  • Visualise your data in intuitive dashboards
  • Provide secure data access to third-party stakeholders
  • Open up new revenue streams by trading in data assets
description: Aindo offers data value chain management solutions based on the generation of synthetic data: many companies (e.g., in health care or finance) sit on large amounts of data, which are of great value but cannot be used due to privacy regulation issues. Synthetic data allows the use of sensitive data on a large scale and in compliance with international standards: Aindo allows companies to analyze the data they hold by means of artificial data that give the same answers as the original data.
enablingTechnologies: AI, Big Data Analytics, System Integration, Synthetic Data
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications:
Aindo's synthetic data is artificial, yet highly realistic. It enables AI development without bias, and data shortage while enhancing privacy.

  • Obtain privacy protecting, utility-preserving synthetic data for secure exchange and analysis.
  • Analyze and extract valuable information from data.
  • Exchange or directly monetize your data.
  • Automatically convert unstructured data to structured data.
  • Compatibilize data sources, even if they are collected in different systems and formats.

owners.name: Scuola Internazionale Superiore di Studi Avanzati - SISSA

payoff: Make AI innovation safe, fair, and efficient
targetCustomers: SMEs, Healthcare, Fintech, Big Companies, Industry

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: 4AI
abstract: 4AI aims to develop artificial intelligence applied to sport, mainly in the amateur sector, innovating statistical analysis in sporting events through the automated recording and extraction of statistics and highlights via computer vision.
businessTraction: 4AI S.R.L. has signed commercial agreements with various sports bodies and technology companies. We work with local sports centers to install our cameras and platforms. We have partnerships with cloud providers such as AWS for data storage. Additionally, we collaborate with universities to develop and improve our artificial intelligence and computer vision algorithms.
competitiveAdvantages: The 4AI S.R.L. solution offers unique advantages. It democratizes access to artificial intelligence and computer vision technologies, allowing amateur sports to benefit from detailed analysis and real-time highlights. Strengths include ease of use and competitive costs, making the service accessible to a wide audience. Scalability allows it to be adapted to different sports and contexts, improving the user experience and increasing the competitiveness of teams.
competitiveScenario: The 4AI S.R.L. solution it differentiates itself from direct competitors such as Pixellot and Veo by offering a service that is also accessible to the amateur and amateur sector, with lower costs and ease of use. Compared to indirect competitors, such as MYSP, 4AI provides advanced statistical analysis in real time, significantly improving the user experience.
description: 4AI S.R.L. has developed a service that uses artificial intelligence and computer vision to analyze sporting events. We solve the lack of advanced statistical analysis tools in the amateur and amateur sectors, currently reserved for professional sport. Our solution automatically records matches and generates detailed statistics and highlights in real time, improving competitiveness at affordable costs. Current limitations: Need for more data for AI models and data security during service delivery.
enablingTechnologies: The technologies underlying the solution proposed by 4AI S.R.L. include: AI, Computer Vision, Platform/App, Cloud Computing, Big Data Analytics, IoT.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications: The killer application mainly focuses on the analysis of amateur and amateur sporting events, offering automatic match recording, generation of detailed statistics and real-time highlights. This is our killer application. Other possible applications include use in the professional sports sector to improve athlete performance, in education for motor skills analysis and potentially in the security sector to monitor movements and activities in sensitive areas.
payoff: Join the revolution!
revenueModel: 4AI S.R.L. intends to monetize through monthly subscriptions for access to the platform and initial camera installations. Scalability is guaranteed by the possibility of adapting the service to different sports and contexts, broadening the target market.
targetCustomers: The potential customers of 4AI S.R.L.: amateur and amateur sports centres, sports schools, sports clubs and associations, coaches and individual athletes. The service may also be of interest to organizers of local tournaments and championships, expanding to various sports disciplines.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: Fast Computing
abstract: FAST Computing is a SISSA startup born within the SISSA mathLab, a laboratory dedicated to the development of computational technologies. it has developed several software libraries based on reduced-order modeling, an effective solution for real-time simulation.
businessTraction:
Scuola Internazionale Superiore di Studi Avanzati - SISSA, Fincantieri Spa, Cetena,

Electrolux, Dompè, Wärtsilä, Alfa Romeo Sauber, Volkswagen, Galdi
competitiveAdvantages:
• Environmental sustainability
  • Reduced energy and computational costs
  • Applications for every use
  • Reduced time-to-market
competitiveScenario: The target market is enterprises in need of advanced computational services in the areas of simulations, big data, big modeling, machine learning and artificial intelligence; Fast Computing has years of developing Reduced Order Modeling at a high scientific level.
description: FAST Computing is a SISSA startup born within the SISSA mathLab, an applied mathematics laboratory dedicated to the development of computational technologies. In recent years, thanks to a €1.6 million grant from the European Research Council under the AROMA-CFD project, the startup has developed several software libraries based on reduced-order modeling, which is an effective solution for real-time simulation.
enablingTechnologies: IoT, Digital Twin, Machine Learning, Big Data Anaylitics, AI
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications:
• Query processes: data assimilation, inverse problems, shape optimization require numerical solution of the same mathematical model with different parameters.
  • Decision support systems, Digital Twin: fast, real-time response is needed to continuously analyze incoming data and provide support in many operational contexts.
  • Sustainability, cost and time reduction: accelerating the industrial pipeline based on simulations has an impact on economic and time resources.

owners.name: Scuola Internazionale Superiore di Studi Avanzati - SISSA

payoff: We develop innovative mathematical models to lead real innovation in industry
targetCustomers: SMEs, Industry, Big Companies

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Materys
abstract: Materys aims to transform the materials and chemicals R&D industry. We employ cutting-edge atomistic numerical simulations and cloud-based High-Performance-Computing, seamlessly managing complex simulations to offer materials characterization as a service.
businessTraction: MATERYS relies on close partnerships with research institutes around the world and with the QUANTUM ESPRESSO Foundation (QEF), a nonprofit organization involved in the management and development of QUANTUM ESPRESSO(TM) software.
competitiveAdvantages:
Key advantages include:

  • Faster and broader exploration of chemical space
  • More efficient and targeted experimentation
  • Reduce complex or hazardous experimentation
  • Insights into materials behavior under varying conditions
  • Link structure/chemistry to application function
  • High quality, high volume data
  • Minimize time-consuming tasks
  • Consistent and reproducible results
competitiveScenario: A SISSA-accredited start-up, it collaborates with a vigorous Condensed Matter group and owns QUANTUM ESPRESSO(TM), one of the world's most powerful and widely used open-source software for quantum simulations, which allows large complex molecular systems to be treated with unprecedented efficiency thanks to sophisticated algorithms that harness the power of exascale machines.
description: At the heart of Materys's mission is a larger, transformational ambition. We aim to facilitate a transition from an era defined by resource extraction to one inspired by creation and innovation. Our goal is to re-imagine a future where scarcity gives way to abundance, a world where the potential for discovery and innovation in materials science is within everyone's reach. Our vision at Materys is to catalyze a paradigm shift in the industry, democratizing the use of advanced nanoscale materials design tools.
enablingTechnologies:
• Powerful, custom-built atomistic simulation workflows
  • Seamless management of complex simulations
  • Top-tier high-throughput capability
  • APIs for effortless integration
  • User-centric & powerful graphical user interfaces
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
• Leverage the Materys platform for lean, time-efficient, and cost-effective materials research and development
  • Leverage the power of quantum simulations to maintain leadership in key technologies
  • Materys platform enables improved services, integration of atomistic simulations into ICME pipelines, and smoothing the platform itself for existing machine learning applications

owners.name: Scuola Internazionale Superiore di Studi Avanzati - SISSA

payoff: Creating Abundance, Atom by Atom
revenueModel: The computational workflows offered will be deployed as SaaS, allowing the functionality of QUANTUM ESPRESSO(TM) codes to be incorporated into simple black-box procedural operations that can be easily executed on cloud and exascale machines.
targetCustomers: Companies, SMEs

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Hemera
abstract: Hemera is developing REMaST®, a cell therapy that aims to be the world’s first therapy capable of effectively regenerating neural tissues for the treatment of spinal cord injury and includes extensions to other neuro-degenerative conditions.
businessTraction: Winner of the "Italian Master Startup Award" - IMSA 2024
competitiveAdvantages: To date, there is no cure for motor, functional, and sensory damage, caused by spinal cord injury. REMaST® is a candidate for the first treatment for nerve tissue regeneration in patients with acute spinal cord injury. REMaST has a high safety profile due to the autologous nature of the product, not genetically modified and validated in pre-clinical studies. It has been certified as an Advanced Cell Therapy (ATMPs) and designated as an Orphan Drug (ODD) by the EMA, with potential applications in other neuro-degenerative conditions
description:
Hemera is a biotech company specialized in regenerative medicine for neurological diseases founded in 2021 with the objective of accelerating the clinical development of an autologous cellular therapy for nerve tissue regeneration for the treatment of lesions of the spinal cord, to date without care. More than 500,000 people worldwide suffer spinal cord injury every year, with severe quality of life impairment and high health care costs. Hemera aims to restore a perspective of autonomy to the patient with spinal cord injury.
Teaser
enablingTechnologies: REMaST® uses macrophages from the patient, obtained from his blood and instructed in vitro for 7 days in a hostile environment. This process creates a "cell bioreactor" called REMaST®: Regenerative-Educated-Macrophages-Self-Transplantation.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications: REMaST® is a cell therapy candidate to be the world’s first neural tissue regeneration therapy, targeting spinal cord injury and with potential extensions to other neurodegenerative conditions. The therapy uses immune cells of the patient (macrophages), trained in vitro to optimize their repair capacity even in hostile environments such as damaged spinal cord. When applied near the lesion, REMaST interact with the microenvironment and cells in the marrow, promoting nerve tissue regeneration.
payoff: Healing Spinal Cord Lesions
targetCustomers: The REMaST therapy currently under study is applied to severe spinal cord injury when the trauma has occurred within a few weeks and the injury is such that it does not allow spontaneous motor recovery or through rehabilitation programs.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: Bayesian Estimation for Engineering Solutions (BEES)
abstract: BEES develops models for prediction and inference with a particular focus on quantifying uncertainty, supporting decision-making in areas such as: weather risk, predictive manufacturing, neuroscience.
businessTraction: Collabotations with: REMTEC srl (Asola - IT), Cogne Acciai Speciali spa (Aosta - IT), BESA GmbH (Munich - DE)
competitiveAdvantages:
BEES is characterized by the use of white box models, which provide immediate interpretations of results.

In addition, the use of Bayesian models allows for natural quantification of uncertainty and exploration of plausible alternative scenarios.
description: BEES develops models for prediction and inference with a particular focus on quantifying uncertainty, turning complex data into clear insights, supporting decision-making in key areas such as: Weather risk assessment (BE-Weather, a stochastic generator capable of simulating meteorological scenarios based on historical data); the predictive manufacturing (BE-Steel, a set of artificial intelligence models); the B-brain, a highly automated software for localising neural activity from M/EEG data (BE-Brain).
enablingTechnologies: NA
mainApplications:
• BE-Weather: in all areas where weather risk assessment is crucial, including land management, precision agriculture and renewable energies;
  • BE-Steel: application in the steel industry for process variables prediction;
  • BE-Brain: in the treatment of epilepsy, an accurate estimation of the epileptogenic area becomes crucial for pre-surgical evaluation of drug-resistant patients.
payoff: Less effort, more knowledge
targetCustomers: Anyone who needs to extract information from their data through the use of sophisticated models.

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: Inferendo
abstract: Visidea is a recommendation system based on visual search, collaborative filtering, content-based and k-nearest neighbors that allows e-commerce sites to personalize user navigation and increase sales.
businessTraction: About twenty e-commerce companies are using the Visidea solution on their sites.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Search by image within the e-commerce site
  • Increased website ROI
  • Increased user satisfaction and engagement/loyalty
  • Available as a plugin for several e-commerce software, including Shopify, Magento and Prestashop, and can also be installed on proprietary software
competitiveScenario:
The main competitors offer visual search and product recommendation services, such as:

  • Visual search and product recommendation services already integrated into e-commerce platforms (Magento,Shopify,Prestashop,WordPress)
  • Other AI services specialize in product recommendation and visual search

Visidea values ​​the use of AI algorithms to analyze images and suggest suitable products.
description:
Visidea is a plug&play recommendation system based on AI and deep learning technology. The software helps e-commerce improve conversion rates, increase ROI and customer satisfaction through customized product suggestions. The system analyzes images of the e-commerce catalog, the history of end-user behavior and actions taken in real time, providing targeted product suggestions that can be appreciated by the user. The service is cloud software as a service, integrated with e-commerce platforms through plugins or APIs.

VisideaDeck_Investors
enablingTechnologies: Artificial Intelligence
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications: Visual search. The software uses complex algorithms such as visual search, collaborative filtering, content-based and k-nearest neighbors to suggest products similar to those purchased or searched for by previous users
payoff: Visual Search, Semantic Search and Product Recommendations for e-commerce websites
revenueModel: Cloud software service that provides product recommendations for existing e-commerce sites via plugins and APIs. This service uses AI and machine learning algorithms to provide personalized recommendations to customers, improving the online shopping experience and increasing conversions.
targetCustomers: Visidea's target customers are e-commerce businesses looking to improve the online customer experience by increasing conversions and reducing search time. These customers turn to Visidea for a visual search solution that allows them to offer personalized suggestions to customers, increasing the likelihood of purchase.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Trust Up
abstract: Trust Up aims to provide hardware-assisted security solutions and services to protect the confidentiality and integrity of data being processed in unreliable environments.
businessTraction: Consultancy for Bit4Id-Namirial to provide a confidential computing solution for the protected execution of quantum resistant cryptographic primitives.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Data security during processing
  • High performance
  • Flexibility in memory usage.
competitiveScenario: Companies in the same field are SCONE, iExec, Opaque. Our solution brings the added value of combining TEE with HE and WebAssembly.
description: The company offers 3 types of TEE security solutions. Fair TEE Security: uses dedicated runtimes for the almost transparent TEE port of unmodified applications. High TEE Security: Leverages VISE methodology by combining TEE and HE to enable dedicated application porting. Super TEE Security: provides a robust two-way sandbox based on WebAssembly to ensure protection even against malicious developers. Each option scales differently with ease of setup, TCB size, resource usage and complexity to meet different security needs.
enablingTechnologies: Trusted Execution Environment, Homomorphic Encryption, WebAssembly
mainApplications: The virtual Secure Enclave (VISE) combines Trusted Execution Environment and Homomorphic Encryption effectively, providing protection from malicious memory accesses by privileged users, while limiting the inherent problems of the two techniques. VISE relies on a distributed model to create and preserve chain-of-trust from the field to the cloud. In this approach, the computing task to implement HE is moved from the client’s local host to the TEE of the cloud service provider.

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Napoli Parthenope

payoff: Cutting edge solutions for Confidential Computing
revenueModel: Trust Up monetizes TEE-fication service aimed at supporting companies in the use of confidential computing technologies
targetCustomers: Companies operating in the IT sector.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Italian Leech Farm (ILFARM)
abstract: First innovative Italian startup that breeds and supplies certified and quality medicinal leeches for research and wellness, as well as offering in vivo toxicological and pharmacological tests, using leeches as an alternative experimental model in compliance with the 3Rs.
businessTraction:
Research contracts with public and private companies:

  • collaboration with IRCCS MultiMedica for studies angiogenesis and inflammation in the field of immuno-oncology, cardiovascular diseases and regenerative medicine;
  • collaboration within the European project SCIENARIO (coordinated by the University of Eastern Piedmont) to evaluate the environmental and human health risk induced by per- and polyfluoralkyl substances (PFAS), used in a wide range of consumer and industrial products.
competitiveAdvantages: Compared to our European competitors, the ILFARM members, due to their know-how and specific technical skills acquired over the years of work in the research field, aim to be the first to produce genetically modified leeches and derived cell lines, which can be used as alternative methods to vertebrates in animal experimentation, in accordance with DE 2010/63/EU. Furthermore, ILFARM, as a startup accredited by the University of Insubria, will collaborate with it on research projects and in the training of students and doctoral candidates.
competitiveScenario: Compared to other companies present in Europe,thanks to the thirty years of experience of its members in the field of scientific research, ILFARM not only offers in vivo toxicological and pharmacological tests, but thanks to the R&D sector aims to identify bioactive leech molecules, produce transgenic leeches and derived cell lines.
description: ILFARM will satisfy the growing demand for leeches in Italy, currently purchased abroad with high shipping costs, by also proposing an alternative model to research as required by the European Directive 2010/63/EU for testing on sentient animals. It also promotes the protection of lake ecosystems, in accordance with the EU Biodiversity Strategy. ILFARM will promote quicker availability of leeches in Italy, to be used in therapeutic and scientific fields.
enablingTechnologies: None
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications: Leech represents a precious resource for both scientific research and human health. In the scientific research field it represents a valid alternative experimental model to vertebrates, widely used to study the mechanisms that regulate the immune response and tissue regeneration. In the medical and therapeutic field, leeches possess, due to the molecules present in their saliva, elevated anticoagulant, pain-relieving and anti-inflammatory effects and can be used for the treatment of numerous pathologies.
payoff: Quality leeches for research, environment and wellness
revenueModel: An increase in the demand for leeches (15-20%) in the various sectors is estimated over the next three years, especially in scientific research. ILFARM plans to cover this demand, especially for the Italian market, entering also in the European one with specific and highly innovative products.
targetCustomers: ILFARM's customers are national and international hospitals, where plastic surgery and microsurgery are practiced, private and academic research centers, naturopathy clinics, veterinary clinics, animal farms and pharmaceutical companies. Private costumers can also benefit of ILFARM's product.

The models developed by TensorLoops are optimized for different types of hardware and different computational capabilities so as to meet the needs of different types of customers.

It has a proprietary solution for the optimal real-time management of Renewable Energy Communities, with Machine Learning techniques and evolutionary algorithms.

TensorLoops focuses on the design of systems based on language models and algorithms for intelligent energy management. TensorLoops is committed to driving digital transformation for businesses and governments by offering cutting-edge tools and technologies to improve business efficiency, sustainability and quality of life.

revenueModel: TensorLoops operates with highly flexible product and pricing policies to adapt to the needs of an evolving market. In addition to remuneration deriving from consultancy and design activities, software products are released with pricing based on subscription, use or license.

TensorLoops intends to intercept in particular those private or public entities that have already undertaken a transformation process with respect to Industry 4.0 or digital revolution models, as well as providing services for the nascent Energy Communities.

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: Diagnostics and Applications for Radiotherapy Technology and Simulations (DARTS)
abstract: DARTS aims to calculate the dose due to the interaction of radiation with matter, both of human and environmental origin, for industrial and commercial purposes, for example radioprotection and radiotherapy.
businessTraction:
Collaborations active or in the process of being activated:

  • the proton therapy network present in Italy (CNAO - Pavia, APSS - Trento)
  • Paul Scherrer Institute with registered office in Villigen PSI, Switzerland (€15k per year to use the dose engine)

It boasts close contacts and collaborations with some of the leading European companies and laboratories (e.g. MAASTRO and MedAustron in Holland and Austria respectively), Nuclear Physics IFJ PAN in Krakow and SIT (Sordina IORT Technologies).
competitiveAdvantages: A fast MonteCarlo software that uses GPU hardware capable of simulating particle (radiation) transport in heterogeneous media. The dose-engine was implemented by including the physical models for the radiation-matter interaction in the tissues of interest and allows rapid dose calculation with applications in the medical and industrial fields. Available through Python libraries, it is compatible with any software and platform allowing easy integration with pre-existing tools. It has already been adopted in various therapy and research centers across Europe.
competitiveScenario: The software developed by DARTS implements full MonteCarlo algorithms that exploit the power of parallel computing on GPUs, unlike the main dose calculation software implemented, for example, by RayStation (from the RaySearch Stockholm company, Sweden) or by Eclipse ( of the Varian company, PaloAlto California) that use analytical algorithms or MC simulations on CPU
description: DARTS operates by commercially valorising its research activity relating to the study, understanding and modeling of the interaction between radiation and matter. This activity is carried out through the development of algorithms and software capable of providing tools for rapid dose calculation in various fields of commercial interest. The scientific and professional skills offer the possibility for DARTS to support companies and treatment centers in providing leading-edge technological solutions to the challenges posed today, for example, by external beam radiotherapy.
enablingTechnologies: The technology underlying the proposed solution and services is GPU hardware acceleration for calculations carried out on the dose absorbed by tissues and materials. DARTS leverages expertise in ultra-fast Monte Carlo simulations performed via parallel computing.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications: Un software fast MonteCarlo che utilizza hardware GPU in grado di simulare il trasporto delle particelle (radiazione) in mezzi eterogenei. Il dose-engine è stato implementato includendo i modelli fisici per l'interazione radiazione-materia nei tessuti di interesse e permette un rapido calcolo della dose con applicazioni nell’ambito medico ed industriale. Disponibile tramite librerie python è compatibile con qualsiasi software e piattaforma permettendo una facile integrazione con strumenti pre-esistenti. E’ già stato adottato in vari centri di terapia e ricerca in tutta Europa.
payoff: The solution in the field of radiation applications in the medical and industrial fields
revenueModel: DARTS is financed through the share capital of the members, the contracts for the service relating to the ultra-fast dose calculation (€15k/year for centers that use the dose engine), the contracts being defined with companies operating in the radiotherapy sector.
targetCustomers: Multinationals operating in the sector of radiotherapy with external beams and not only such as IBA and SIT and treatment centers (e.g. PSI, APSS, CNAO, MAASTRO) which in the European panorama represent the places where it is possible to be treated with beams of protons and carbon ions with state-of-the-art technology.

competitiveScenario: Competing Companies: Gamma Technologies, Convergent Science, AVL, Siemens, R&D CFD (spin-off università di Modena), Alma Automotive (spin-off università di Bologna), NAIS (Spin-off università di Bologna), Powertech.
description: Sursum-Mi provides software and services in the area of fluid dynamic simulation of internal combustion engines, fluid machines, and propulsion systems. In particular, Gasdyn one-dimensional simulation software and Lib-ICE computational library for CFD simulations. Sursum-Mi industrializes the computational models developed by the ICEG group of Politecnico di Milano making them available to companies by providing them with simulation methodologies (including appropriate graphical interfaces for pre- and post-processing).
enablingTechnologies: Simulation
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: Fluid dynamics simulation of endothermic engines. Other applications: simulation of positive displacement and reciprocating compressors, simulation of electrified propulsion systems (thermal management cooling), simulation of heat pump components, simulation of thermal energy recovery systems (expanders).
payoff: Modeling the future
revenueModel: Sale of software licenses at defined price, customized training (OpenFOAM-Gasdyn) on specific offering, coaching companies in early stage of developing numerical simulation methodologies on specific offering.
targetCustomers: Companies that manufacture heat engines, companies that perform third-party heat engine simulations, companies that manufacture heat engine components, motorsports, and companies that work in the field of power generation.

title: Mineralogical Solutions for Industry and Environment
abstract: Mineralogical Solutions offers various consulting, scientific research and analysis services in the field of applied mineralogy, with a particular focus on the industrial sector (mining, raw materials, ceramics and materials) and the environment (silica, asbestos, waste and recovery materials)
competitiveAdvantages:
• Proven experience in scientific research regarding analytical materials and methodologies
  • Laboratory with advanced instrumentation
description: MINERALOGICAL SOLUTIONS is a spin-off of the University of Modena and Reggio Emilia specialized in the field of applied mineralogy. Mineralogical Solutions advises companies and centers operating in the ceramic, mining, chemical, construction and environmental sectors to face challenges in the field of productive and technological innovation. Our strong point is the knowledge of raw materials and their transformations that, together with the rapid and accurate analysis of materials, allows us to address and give an answer to your requests.
enablingTechnologies:
• XRF, XRD, SEM-EDS for material characterization
  • XRPD for qualitative mineralogical analysis on powders
  • Laser granulometer
mainApplications:
Services:

  • complete characterization of raw materials, finished products of industry, defects and patinas of alteration, crusts etc. (XRF, XRD, SEM-EDS, etc.)
  • Minero-petrographic analysis in thin section of mortars, grouts, sediments etc.
  • thermal analysis of raw materials and finished products of the industry
  • qualitative mineralogical analysis on powders (XRPD) of raw materials and finished products of the industry
  • quantitative mineralogical analysis (XRPD - Rietveld method) of raw materials and finished products of industry.

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Modena e Reggio Emilia
