trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Specto
abstract: Specto Photonics develops and markets next-generation miniaturized Brillouin spectrometers. This technology enables optical measurement of viscoelastic properties in the volume of biological organisms with high optical resolution.
competitiveAdvantages: Existing technologies to access micro-mechanical information require physical contact, making them destructive and unable to probe into the volume of cells and tissues. Specto overcomes these fundamental limitations through a Brillouin spectrometer fully integrated in silicon chips. This spectroscopy technique can optically measure mechanical properties noninvasively and with high optical resolution.
description: Specto Photonics develops and markets state-of-the-art systems for Brillouin spectroscopy and microscopy. Our main product is a miniaturized Brillouin spectrometer, while we have also created a compact optical filter with very high extinction ratio for Brillouin microscopy applications. Our team of experts is a recognized leader in Brillouin spectroscopy, ensuring the highest expertise for our products.
enablingTechnologies: The fundamental enabling technology for Specto Photonics' flagship product is Silicon Photonics, which enables the integration of sophisticated optical functionalities at a chip level using Photonics Integrated Circuits (PICs).
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: Specto's solution will revolutionize biomechanical research and industry by providing a noninvasive and highly accurate method for measuring micromechanical properties. Academic institutions could benefit from in vivo measurements of viscoelastic properties of cells and tissues, leading to the discovery of new therapies and diagnostic methods.
payoff: SPECTROSCOPY SOLUTIONS FOR MECHANOBIOLOGY
revenueModel: The company plans to generate revenue by selling its devices and associated services, including training, support, and maintenance, and by sublicensing its patents.
targetCustomers: Specto's customers are academic institutions and industries in the life sciences, chemistry, and materials sciences.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: rehub
abstract: Rehub develops new technologies to give new value to all that glass waste that is not recycled for logistical, historical or supply chain reasons, combining human knowledge (tradition, craftsmanship, research, design, art) with new technologies.
businessTraction:
Currently, agreements have been signed for the free transfer of by-products (glass waste) with 5 glass factories in Murano. rehub is part of the permanent glass research cluster “GLASS” (IUAV and Ca' Foscari University of Venice).

rehub's customers include companies such as the L'Oreal group, Peserico and Golden Goose. In December 2023, the MAXXI museum in Rome wanted to include objects created by rehub within the museum's permanent collection.
competitiveAdvantages: Safe process for the operator (no harmful substances or alcohols are used) which allows the creation of sustainable products, made entirely with secondary raw materials, re-recyclable again (using the same process), resistant to chemical and atmospheric agents and with a good mechanical resistance.
competitiveScenario: Non-recyclable glass waste is normally analyzed and can be crushed and resold as sand in the infrastructure and construction sector. This sand is also used in sports as a filler for playing fields with synthetic grass. Unfortunately, only a small portion of this waste is converted into sand. Most end up in landfill.
description:
Not all glass can be recycled. Only glass packaging has an efficient recycling chain; everything else (artistic glass, glasses, lamps, eyeglass lenses, laminated and laminated glass used in architecture) very often ends up in landfill, creating enormous economic and environmental damage.

It is estimated that around 130 million pieces of non-recyclable glass waste are produced globally each year.

At rehub we have developed a new and innovative process to give new value to these wastes: we transform them into a workable paste at room temperature.
enablingTechnologies:
• Patent process of transformation of waste into paste and subsequent modeling (industrial invention - method for glass processing) 01/24
  • Extruder patent for 3D printing (industrial invention and utility model - Device for extrusion of glass-based compounds for additive manufacturing processes) 06/22
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
The glass paste obtained from glass waste is shaped using the most common industrial processes (lamination, injection,...) but also 3D printed with a proprietary extruder.

The versatility of the paste allows for the creation of a wide range of new products, surfaces, and coatings. rehub is currently focusing on the valorization of waste from the Murano furnaces, for selected fashion & design companies (capsule collections).

However, the solution also allows us to reevaluate other types of glass coming from industry & large-scale production, giving value to a waste material destined for landfill.
payoff: rehub gives new value to non-recyclable glass waste
revenueModel:
Creation of capsule collections for companies in the fashion/design sector.

The customer pays for the design and/or production of objects made using the proprietary process and starting from the customer's or Murano partner companies' waste.
targetCustomers: Fashion, design and furniture companies. rehub's products have the furniture market as their primary target market.

title: LIFT Energy
abstract: Stabilization treatment for lithium metal anodes that allows their use as rechargeable anodes, production of stabilized anodes and assembly of batteries containing such electrodes.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Rechargeability of lithium metal anodes
  • Greater energy density
  • Lower weight of the final battery with the same charge
  • Stabilization of lithium metal in quiescent batteries.
description: Surface treatment of lithium metal with which a uniform layer is obtained on the lithium metal anode, thanks to which it can be subjected to countless cycles. The process is easily scalable, transformable and, by modulating the operating conditions, operable continuously. Further objects of the startup's work are the production of stabilized lithium metal anodes for lithium metal batteries and the assembly of lithium metal batteries that exploit the greater energy density and rechargeability of these electrodes.
enablingTechnologies: Energy Storage; Electric Vehicles; Smart mobility; Implantable Medical Devices
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications: Aerospace, Drones, Automotive, Smart-mobility, Biomedical
payoff: WE LIFT THE ENERGY OF BATTERIES
revenueModel: B2B or IP Licensing
targetCustomers: Battery Manufacturer

title: UPTOEARTH ITALIA
abstract: UptoEarth Italia is an innovative start-up and spin-off of the IUAV University of Venice, engaged in the design of software and hardware in the field of ICT technologies, the Internet of Things (IoT), Earth Observation (EO) and robotics applied to Agriculture 4.0.
businessTraction: UptoEarth Italy has active collaborations to participate in joint research projects and for technical consultancy (with the University of Padua) and business (with t²i, certified incubator and accredited Patlib Center), as a spin-off of the IUAV University of Venice, access a dynamic business ecosystem. It also integrates the expertise and contacts of the partner Uptoearth GmbH, a subsidiary of the ESA Business Incubation Centre in Darmstadt, to expand the business model.
competitiveAdvantages: CLAUS improves the operational efficiency of current decision support systems, making them more convenient and effective for farmers. Thanks to its innovative movement system, it guarantees extended coverage even in inaccessible or covered areas. Through the use of sensors, satellite data and AI algorithms, it also allows a significant reduction in the use of pesticides.
competitiveScenario: CLAUS differs from its competitors who offer IoT for precision agriculture (e.g. PLANTUM - Argentina; NETSENS - Italy, LIBELIUM - Spain) thanks to its unique autonomy and mobility through metal cable, which allows user-friendly operationfriendly without constant human interventions and extensive field coverage, increasing efficiency and reducing costs.
description: UptoEarth Italia is a start-up that deals with software and hardware innovation and design in the field of ICT technologies, the Internet of Things (IoT), Earth Observation (EO) and robotics applied to agriculture (agriculture 4.0). The company aims to optimize resources, reduce the use of pesticides and fertilizers harmful to the soil, reduce environmental impact, increase yield and product quality, in particular for a reduction in the impact of the agricultural sector, combating climate change, and for a sustainable future.
enablingTechnologies:
• Artificial Intelligence for agricultural data analysis
  • IoT for connectivity and remote control
  • Advanced sensors for environmental monitoring
  • Automation and robotics to collect data and manage autonomous fields
  • ICT, GIS & Earth Observation, Digital Twin, Augmented Reality and Virtual Reality
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: UptoEarth Italia stands out in the agricultural sector with CLAUS, the highly technological and patented device that combines the agility of a drone with the power of the iot. CLAUS is a funicular motorized hardware that uses a metal cable to move within agricultural production systems, in particular, to collect data and perform specific functions in agricultural or industrial environments where the soil is covered by crops, materials or other elements.
payoff: Research and innovation for tomorrow’s agriculture. We believe there is no Planet B
revenueModel: UptoEarth Italia offers technical consulting services, commercial agreements with agritech companies, sales of the device and related image analysis services also in customized packages. CLAUS is scalable through integration with DSS systems and ease of use.
targetCustomers:
CLAUS’s business model is B2B and mainly aims to:

  • agritech companies that can directly use or integrate the system in their technological solutions
  • agronomists who can offer technical advice and use the system to provide specialized support to their customers
  • research institutions, universities and study centres for data collection and study and research projects.

trl.label: 6 - Demonstration of technology in an industrial environment

title: Fibereuse Tech
abstract: Fibereuse Tech develops a cyber-physical system based on a demand-driven approach to optimize and control the dimensional distribution of continuous mechanical size-reduction processes of composite materials, enabling high-value-added recycling solutions.
businessTraction: Several companies have expressed interest in composite material recycling, and functional consulting activities have been carried out with some of them to validate our solutions.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Currently, almost all end-of-life composite products with fiberglass reinforcement are disposed of in landfills. Thanks to Fibereuse Tech's technology, it is possible to recover these materials and valorize them in high-value applications
  • Process costs are reduced by 66% compared to standard solutions, and the quantity of reusable material meeting specifications is increased by 81%
  • New products can include anywhere from 10% to 50% recycled material.
description: Fibereuse Tech implements circular economy solutions in the composite materials sector by integrating the entire value chain in a cross-sectorial way. We transform waste into new high-value-added products, eliminating landfill. Thanks to Fibereuse Tech's technology, it is possible to predict the dimensional distribution of grind material. Depending on the characteristics of the material to be treated and to be obtained, the desired dimensional distribution, energy and tool consumption, and thus process costs, are optimized through software that leverages machine learning and analytical models.
enablingTechnologies: The technology consists of a cyber-physical system based on Machine Learning algorithms, stochastic and analytical models. The necessary hardware technologies include a mechanical size reduction machinery and an image acquisition system via cameras.
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications:
• Design of recycling plants for composite materials from scratch or integration of Fibereuse Tech technology into existing recycling facilities
  • Technical consultancy and design services for third parties on new products and related processes incorporating recycled glass fiber composite
  • The technology, initially optimized for composite materials, is potentially applicable to any size reduction process in any sector
  • Size reduction tests to verify the recyclability of end-of-life composite materials are also performed.
payoff: Recycling composite materials
targetCustomers:
Fibereuse Tech customers are:

  • manufacturing companies in the field of composite materials that have production waste that currently disposes in landfills
  • manufacturing companies that want to include shares of recycled material in their production processes
  • companies dealing with waste management.

title: Develop-Players
abstract: The first cognitive enhancement video game platform for kids with DSA and ADHD, designed for families, schools and professionals.
businessTraction:
• 100 schools in regions of Italy
  • 2500 students used PROFFILO
competitiveAdvantages: Our empowerment video games allow you to work on cognitive fragilities while having fun. Much research has shown the effectiveness of gamification in learning and education. Involvement and gaming experience allow you to work on the motivation, needed to increase the likelihood of an effective improvement in skills. Proffilo, the video game screening, allows to reduce the time of early recognition, which at the moment is entrusted to the tests "paper and pencil", with much longer times of administration and correction.
description: Develop-Players develops digital games based on neuropsychological research and the use of artificial intelligence techniques to enhance the learning potential of each with attention to the individual characteristics of people and to offer the opportunity for better growth throughout life.
enablingTechnologies: Our products are part of dtx devices (Digital Therapeutics) and therefore we are part of the Digital Health sector. We use AI (,machine learning, in particular), Cloud Computing (AWS) and Telehealth (in particular tele-assessment).
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
Development of serious games: learning video games for students with neurodevelopmental disorders (DSA and/or ADHD).

In particular:

  • Proffilo: profiling game, helps teachers and professionals in screening and early recognition of DSA. In a few minutes, cognitive functions related to learning are analyzed, which, in people with DSA, are fragile. It also promotes personalised teaching
  • cognitive enhancement video games (Eye-Riders, Follow-me, SAM): through a training strengthen attention, visuospaziale memory and phonological skills in people with DSA

owners.name: Alma Mater Studiorum Università di Bologna

payoff: Potential knows no limits
revenueModel: DTx products will be sold to schools and families. Schools will acquire an annual or multi-year license to carry out screening and cognitive enhancement programs for children and adolescents.
targetCustomers: With our video games we turn to schools, professionals and also directly to families with children who have Neurodevelopmental Disorders, in particular Specific Learning Disorders (DSA) and Attention Disorders (ADHD).

abstract: CibuSalus supports its clients in promoting initiatives and concrete actions in the regions that favour, thanks to a transdisciplinary approach, sustainable food policies protecting global health and encouraging healthy lifestyles.

CibuSalus offers consulting to organisations and companies to develop projects for healthy and sustainable food.

In the current historical and social context, the way food is produced, transported, distributed and consumed has significant impacts on the global ecosystem. Poor nutrition is one of the risk factors for chronic noncommunicable diseases, responsible for more than 70% of global deaths. We help our clients promote concrete actions for sustainable food policies through a transdisciplinary approach.

  • APP development

revenueModel: B2B

title: Ubiquitous
abstract: The startup helps companies scale Edge AI solutions and reduce edge fleet costs.
competitiveAdvantages: Ubiquitous reduce the development times and costs of your Artificial Intelligence and Computer Vision solutions for Edge and IoT devices. With Ubiquitous you install, update and control your applications with just a few clicks and resolve any problems by remotely accessing your devices - all through the simple and intuitive ubidash interface. Edge computing is tailored for continuous, real-time solutions. By managing data close to its source, latency is reduced, allowing you to capture immediately actionable information.
description: Ubiquitous offers an Artificial Intelligence and Computer Vision application management platform for Edge and IoT devices. The platform allows you to optimize AI consumption to improve its performance with cameras and IoT devices and facilitate their deployment and control on each device. The optimization algorithms also allow you to support Edge Computing devices powered by renewable energy. Everything will be controllable from a customizable dashboard that can be integrated with the customer's needs.
enablingTechnologies: Computer Vision, Artificial Intelligence, Edge AI, Dashboard, IoT, Edge Computing, Cloud Computing, Edge Orchestration
mainApplications:
Ubiquitous offers two main products:

  • Ubiwork, an edge device management framework that simplifies the design and integration of energy-efficient AI algorithms optimized for edge devices as well as the control and maintenance of each device from remote;
  • Ubidash, a dashboard that allows you to simplify the monitoring of data produced by devices through a simple and customizable interface.
payoff: Bring Artificial Intelligence to your Edge and IoT devices
revenueModel: Access to the services integrated into the platform is available through a monthly subscription model. In case it is necessary to integrate the platform with external services or for the development of custom Computer Vision solutions, we also offer tailor-made consultancy services.
targetCustomers: The products and services are aimed at any company operating in the field of Industry 4.0, Smart Agriculture, Environmental Monitoring and Smart City. Some application examples of our solution include: recognition of defective products, production monitoring, real-time monitoring and surveillance, recognition of dangerous behavior or anomalies.

title: iBMB - initiatives for Bio-Materials Behaviour
abstract: iBMB develops tools to predict cancer progression and response to new treatments, targeted at personalized therapies for cancer patients. To date he has developed 3 revolutionary products: CancerMate, TASCairfoils, SHRIMPAK.

CancerMate is a software that implements an in-silico platform for cancer clinical and pharmaceutical research and therapy. The software enables virtual drug repositioning/development, for fully sustainable scenarios implemented in in-silico replicas (avatars) of patients. CancerMate creates an immersive experience when integrated with augmented reality (AR) tools, strengthening specialists' knowledge and judgment on the outcome of therapy and improves clinical efficiency with a positive impact on costs (for example, avoiding unnecessary clinical costs necessary).

title: EdiVite
abstract: EdiVite S.r.l. is an innovative start-up pioneering the application of New Generation Techniques (NGT), involved in developing innovative plant prototypes with improved characteristics through the use of DNA-free genome editing for sustainable viticulture.
businessTraction:
R&D Collaborations:

  • University of Padua;
  • University of Naples;
  • University of Catania;
  • E&J Gallo Winery (California - USA);
  • Imperal College (London - UK).
competitiveAdvantages:
EdiVite has the commercial advantage of being currently the first company in the world to have successfully implemented editing technology on grapevines for the improvement of biotechnologically relevant traits without the insertion of foreign DNA. The enhanced plant prototypes ensure:

  • reduction in the use of high environmental impact phytosanitary products;;
  • preservation of the original genetic makeup and valuable qualitative characteristics;
  • production of a "clean" product, highly sought after by consumers.
competitiveScenario: Nowadays, genetically improved grapevine clones produced using genome editing DNA-free technology are not available on the market. Potential competitors include research centers capable of developing the technology, but currently focused on varieties of limited commercial relevance, at least for Europe.
description: EdiVite aims to address the challenges of modern viticulture by developing grapevine genotypes with improved characteristics, for the advancement of sustainable and economically viable vineyard management. The company's objective is to develop and apply innovative methods in grapevines compared to conventional breeding, and to produce plant prototypes with enhanced features such as disease resistance, adaptation to climate change and quality improvement, through the use of DNA-free genome editing using the CRISPR/Cas9 system.
enablingTechnologies:
• Production of embryogenic calli from grapevine plants;
  • Isolation of grapevine protoplasts and regeneration of the whole plant;
  • Application of DNA-free genome editing on grapevine protoplasts;
  • Functional characterization of edited plants.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: Development of genetically improved innovative plant prototypes for specific traits of interest using cutting-edge technologies.
payoff: Genome Editing in grapevine
revenueModel:
• Sale of genetically improved grapevine prototypes;
  • Services providing.
targetCustomers: Private agreements with Italian and international plant nursery and winemaking companies.

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: RESinTec
abstract: Academic Spin-Off of the University of Basilicata specializing in the design and management of civil works and infrastructure.
businessTraction: Memoranda of understanding with several Municipalities in the area
competitiveAdvantages: Application of models and methods developed on individual buildings and at urban scale for software and app development.
competitiveScenario: RESinTec offers higher education and specialization. Research and development in academia
description:
Our proposal is framed in the field of rehabilitation, enhancement and management of historical-artistic-architectural heritage, contributing to the development and dissemination of new innovative models that include seismic risk mitigation and the need for safety. Another essential aspect concerns the development and application of tools aimed at analyzing the economic effects, both direct and indirect, associated with the possible occurrence of seismic events in order to propose economically sustainable refunctionalization and retrofitting interventions.

Pitch deck RESinTec
enablingTechnologies: None
fundingStageDescription: None
mainApplications: Solutions based on resilient models and cost-benefit analysis.
payoff: Resilience, Innovation, Technology
revenueModel: The application of the proposed models implemented may be applicable to both P.A. and private individuals
targetCustomers: Public Administration and private individuals

trl.label: 1 - Observation of fundamental principles

title: Environmental Engineering Services
abstract: EES develops advanced solutions in the field of environmental engineering, with a focus on the management and control of water resources. EES integrates methodologies and models from scientific research, adapting them to the needs of companies and local communities.
competitiveAdvantages:
The EES solution provides tangible benefits in sustainability, efficiency, and resilience over traditional solutions, specifically:

  • offering economic savings and a low environmental impact; proactive management and fast resolution of inefficiencies;
  • contribution to environmental and natural preservation;
  • resilience against climate change, adaptable to various conditions and demands;
  • reduced operational costs and prolonged infrastructure lifespan;
  • improved decision-making support for effective water resource planning and management.
competitiveScenario: EES occupies a unique niche market due to the specificity and innovation of its software, currently lacking direct and indirect competitors. While companies in the sector develop more standardized solutions, public entities can be potential clients for EES, which exploits this market gap by offering customized and advanced approaches.
description: EES offers innovative solutions in the field of environmental engineering, aiming to optimize water management for public entities and companies. Addressing the challenges of water scarcity and inefficiencies due to outdated infrastructure and suboptimal technologies, EES leverages technological innovation and scientific advancements to enhance water management efficiency. By integrating smart sensors, modern remote control systems, and advanced data analysis software, EES ensures accurate monitoring and promotes sustainable water resource management.
enablingTechnologies: In the future, the numerical algorithm will evolve to integrate with advanced virtual and augmented reality systems, as well as with analytical platforms powered by artificial intelligence and IoT sensors.
fundingStageDescription: EES is seeking funding by participating in national and regional financing calls, to support and accelerate the development of its innovations
mainApplications: Recently, EES has been working on developing an advanced numerical model to optimize water and energy consumption in water distribution networks. This model is designed to integrate with IoT sensors placed throughout the network and with virtual simulation software, aiming to increase efficiency, reduce costs, and enhance resilience in water resource management. This innovative approach has potential applications ranging from agriculture to smart cities, and from the industrial sector to the energy sector.
payoff: Let's design our sustainable future together
revenueModel: EES can generate revenue through specialized consulting services for the implementation of software in water networks, software customizations to meet specific needs, development of additional features upon request, and advanced data analysis services.
targetCustomers: EES's potential clients range from water utility managers looking for solutions to reduce losses and enhance the efficiency of their systems, to companies in the water and purification sector focused on cost reduction and service improvement, all the way to agricultural enterprises and irrigation consortia interested in efficient irrigation to optimize yields and minimize waste.

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: E.R.M.E.S.
abstract: E.R.M.E.S. provides useful and pragmatic support on different closely interconnected topics such as sustainability and engagement, social entrepreneurship, corporate governance and business restructuring (turnaround), growth strategies and risk management processes.
businessTraction: Confagricolture, Terra è Vita, Collectibus, Gruppo Stratego, Manpower, Transizione ecologica solidale, Georgeson, Mab Group
competitiveAdvantages: Promotion and growth of a real culture of the world of active shareholders and investors through particular attention to environmental social governance issues, towards listed and unlisted companies, placing the focus on sustainable development, the prediction of business crises and of re-orientation for all those companies in declining conditions, but also in the case of new business opportunities.
description: The Start Up aims to offer applied research services in management, aimed at developing and promoting an active shareholder culture towards companies and investors. It pays great attention to environmental, social and corporate governance issues, with a view to sustainable development, forecasting business crises, and re-orienting the sustainable reconversion of new businesses or companies in crisis.
enablingTechnologies: Developed theoretical and practical skills, applied research and consultancy services of high scientific value in the fields of corporate governance, risk management, sustainable industrial restructuring and reconversion.
mainApplications:
• ESG & Engagement: linked to corporate governance best practices and active shareholder structure;
  • Enterprise Risk Management: linked to integrated risk management;
  • Restructuring and Compliance: linked to business crises, restructuring processes and the construction of rating systems;
  • Sustainable Development: linked to strategic, industrial and financial plans, support in the Elite program of the Italian Stock Exchange, Change Management in crisis situations and sustainable reconversion processes, integration of digital innovation tools;
  • Observatory called "ESG Ability".
payoff: Engagement, Restructuring, Management, Enterprise, Sustainability
revenueModel: The company aims to consolidate and expand its activities by maintaining strong collaboration with businesses, public bodies and academic institutions, with strong potential for growth and innovation in the field of corporate sustainability.
targetCustomers: Institutional investors, owners and managers of companies, public bodies.

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Needleye Robotics (NDLY)
abstract: Needleye offers a small AI-guided robot to carry out biopsy or focal treatment of prostate cancer in an all-in-one solution, helping radiologists and urologists to minimize the diagnostic error and achieve a rapid and effective therapy.
businessTraction:
• Università di Verona, Dipartimento di Urologia: specifications analysis and testing of the prototype.
  • Università di Friburgo, Dipartimento di Urologia: specifications analysis and testing of the prototype.
  • ACMIT: development of the mechanical prototype and production of the first series of devices.
  • Day One: development of the Business Model and Business Plan.
competitiveAdvantages:
The solution proposed by NDLY is based on the founders' decades of experience in medical automation and robotics and includes:

1- Deep learning algorithms for

  • automatic identification of the prostate and potential lesions in MRI, and of the prostate in US images.
  • intelligent fusion of MR and US images.

2- Optimization algorithms for

  • minimize the number of needle entry points into the patient to achieve all biopsy objectives.
  • compensate for patient movements and needle trajectory.

3- Needle display
competitiveScenario:
• Autonomous Robotics for automatic needle pointing based on the target chosen by the doctor and compensation for patient movements
  • AI for segmentation of the prostate and lesions on MRI and of the prostate in US images
  • Fusion of MR and US images using the biomechanical model of the prostate

The only competitor is MonaLisa by Biobot (Singapore) which doesn't allow the flexibility offered by our product
description:
Prostate biopsy is subject to 30% misdiagnosis due to:

  • failure to recognize prostate contours and lesions on magnetic resonance (MR) images;
  • imprecise superimposition of MRIs on US images;
  • lack of precision in inserting the biopsy needle;
  • lack of standardization of the procedure.

The proprietary methods developed by NDLY and the robotic guidance of the biopsy needle allow us to reduce the errors introduced, transforming a procedure that depends on the operator's experience into a standard and automatic process.
enablingTechnologies:
• Autonomous Robotics
  • AI models for image processing
  • Biomechanical models for image fusion
  • Models for patient movement compensation
fundingStageDescription: Received a grant from EIC Transition for 2.5 Mil Euro
mainApplications: The system developed by NDLY aims to change the way in which prostate biopsy is performed, following the latest European clinical indications. Furthermore, prostate cancer therapy is changing, moving from radical surgery to focal treatment which will require accurate positioning such as that provided by the NDLY system. Thanks to its modularity, the device for guiding the needle and the ultrasound probe can be adapted to other anatomical areas, to perform biopsies and percutaneous therapies on organs other than the prostate.
payoff: Reshaping prostate cancer diagnosis and therapy through AI-powered robotics
revenueModel: Sales, pay per use, leasing
targetCustomers: Hospitals, private clinics and analysis laboratories.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: Knoway Systems (Knoway)
abstract: Knoway Systems develops innovative services and software tools for the digitalization, preservation, use and enhancement of cultural heritage and for the promotion of tourism. We promote a culture that is free and accessible to all, without barriers or limits.
competitiveAdvantages:
The process of digitization with BooKeeper is simple, fast and fluid, does not require any post-production, automatically produces material compliant with the guidelines of the PND and the CEI. BooKeeper can also be used by non-specialists.

The Digital Library is a portal open to every institution, archive or library that wants to make its paper heritage available to the community because the access management allows you to have complete control over the material. The portal presents a flexible and customizable metadata implementation.
competitiveScenario:
Unlike BooKeeper, the digitization systems on the market do not automatically produce digital material in compliance with the guidelines of the PND and the CEI, but force the user to engage in post-production once the scans are made, lengthening considerably the times and demanding specific competences.

Main competitors: Metis, G.A.P., Atiz, Book2net.
description: Knoway Systems develops innovative software tools and services for the digitalization, preservation and use of cultural heritage and the promotion of tourism. The aim is to offer a high-quality cultural experience, allowing you to explore the cultural heritage in an innovative and engaging way. Knoway aims to collaborate with museums, libraries, archives and other cultural institutions to safeguard and enhance cultural and tourist heritage and create new culture.
enablingTechnologies: Computer vision, Edge detection, Photo360, Virtual Tours
mainApplications:
• BooKeeper system: paper heritage digitization system that produces images and metadata (METS, MAG) that comply with the PND and CEI guidelines automatically and without any post-production
  • Digital Library platform: consultation portal for reading, advanced search, notes, transcripts, with tools for managing the catalogue such as tags, customizable collections and metadata and material ownership management mechanisms such as watermarks and access restrictions
  • Innovative use of cultural heritage: virtual tours, 3D surveys, photo360.
payoff: A simple Way to protect Knowledge
revenueModel:
• B2C
  • B2B
  • B2G
targetCustomers:
• Libraries
  • Historical archives, Diocesan archives
  • Museums, Cultural institutions
  • Associations, Collectors
  • Memory Houses
  • Academies
  • Public administration
  • University
  • Private
  • Companies and companies offering restoration, cataloguing and inventory services

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: VIRIDIS
abstract: VIRIDIS aims to develop new technologies and commercialise innovative systems for the agro-industrial and food sectors to improve production processes and repurpose waste and by-products.
businessTraction: Granarolo, Soresina, Waxy, SIAD
competitiveAdvantages: The strengths compared to traditional treatment processes are a reduction in energy and water consumption, with obvious and consistent reduction in environmental impact, as well as a sharp contraction (up to 1/20) in costs associated with food fluid sanitization/sterilization processes.
competitiveScenario: The agri-food sector represents one of the strengths of the national economy, with a total supply chain estimated at 500 billion euros, i.e., just under a third of GDP.
description: VIRIDIS aims to provide innovative solutions and technologies, commercializing the related systems, for the food sectors, starting with the dairy and agro-industrial sectors, aimed at improving existing processes and valorizing the related waste and by-products.
enablingTechnologies: The technology on which this process is based exploits a mechanism of bacterial thermo/photoinactivation by infrared radiation. The process is currently covered by a patent owned by WAXY S.r.l., which will be the partner of choice in the business project of the established start-up.
mainApplications:
• Reduced environmental impact;
  • Reduced treatment time;
  • Modularity of plant development;
  • Improved quality and preservation of nutritional and functional properties of products;
  • reduced treatment costs.
payoff: Innovative technologies and systems for the agro-industrial and food sectors
revenueModel: The activity of the nascent Company, which, through the established scientific expertise of the founding partners and industrial synergies with strategic partners (such as Granarolo, Soresina, Waxy, SIAD), aims to provide concrete and innovative solutions to the needs of the food market.
targetCustomers: Agri-tech companies

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: XFlieS
abstract: XFlieS is involved in the development, production, and marketing of high-tech products/services, focusing on insect farming for the bioconversion of agri-food waste. This involves managing farming systems and optimizing insect diets to achieve specific protein and lipid profiles.
businessTraction: IPIFF: Internation platform of insects for feed and food; PROTIX NL: European sector leader
competitiveAdvantages:
• Environmental Sustainability: the solution contributes to waste reduction and the reduction of environmental impact associated with organic waste disposal. This sustainable approach can help mitigate waste disposal issues and promote circularity in the economy.
  • Efficiency in Resource Utilization: the solution enables efficient use of resources by transforming agro-food waste into valuable resources such as protein feeds for animals or ingredients for food and feed products.
competitiveScenario:
Startups and emerging companies are developing similar solutions for insect farming and the bioconversion of agro-food waste.
Large food and feed companies might develop their own insect production capabilities or seek strategic partnerships with innovative startups to access this new source of ingredients.
description:
The academic spin-off XFlieS has an organizational structure divided into a Scientific and a Technical-Scientific area, with the proposers acting as founding members. The Scientific area focuses on standardization, development, and supervision of activities, while the Technical-Scientific area manages production, human resources, finances, sales, and marketing. The company specializes in the development, production, and marketing of high-tech products/services, with a focus on insect farming for the bioconversion of agri-food waste.

Pitch deck XFlieS
enablingTechnologies: Not currently planned
mainApplications:
• Development of Innovative Products: these products could include pet foods, dietary supplements for humans, or feed additives for livestock, leveraging the nutritional benefits of insects and contributing to the reduction of food waste.
  • Customized Feeding Systems: through data analysis and machine learning, the startup could develop customized feeding systems for insects, optimized to achieve specific profiles of desired proteins and lipids.
payoff: Feeding the future!
revenueModel:
1. Sale of Farming Products
  2. Offering additional services such as consultancy on insect farming, farm monitoring, or technical support to breeders interested in using insects for the bioconversion of their waste
  3. Licenses and Patents
targetCustomers:
• Food industries might be interested in purchasing farmed insects for the production of innovative and sustainable foods.
  • Feed industries could utilize farmed insects as a source of proteins and lipids for the production of animal feeds, catering to poultry, swine, fish, or even pet feeds.
  • Farmers and producers of agro-food waste

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: RI-PRESE
abstract: RI-PRESE memory keepers deals with the protection of private, family, corporate and public audiovisual heritage, through digitization, restoration and enhancement services, and/or storytelling and communication projects, conservation and protection of heritage, memory and social identity.
competitiveAdvantages:
• The life cycle of a film is 60 years and for a magnetic tape 25 years. There is a need to safeguard a very large number of private, family, business, collective memories. Very few companies digitize both formats. RI-PRESE provides both of these processes
  • Memories recorded through audiovisual media are often not cared for and/or enhanced. RI-PRESE offers services in heritage protection, preservation and enhancement, communication and innovative content (virtual & augmented reality, data visualization, interaction design, geomapping/geotagging).
description:
• SERVICES for CITIZENS: interventions to digitize private memories with government support, calls and partnerships, crowdfunding campaigns
  • SERVICES for BUSINESSES: digitization of analog films, cataloging, enhancement and communication projects
  • SERVICES for LOCAL ADMINISTRATIONS: supporting projects for digitization and preservation of local cultural heritage
  • SERVICES for CULTURAL or CINEMATOGRAPHIC PRODUCTIONS: archiving of audiovisual content for documentaries, exhibitions, publications, performances
  • OTHER SERVICES: technical services and training
enablingTechnologies: Solutions, services and product related to innovation and digitization processes through ultra-high resolution frame-by-frame scanning systems and enhancement through new media, virtual&augmented reality, data visualization & interaction design, geomapping/geotagging
mainApplications: Highly innovative and ultra-high resolution digitization and enhancement of audiovisual media such as film and magnetic tapes
payoff: Memory keepers - We believe in the right to memory, and we believe that preserving one's past means nurturing one's future
targetCustomers:
• Companies
  • Local governments
  • Citizens
  • Cultural or film productions

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: HySafe
abstract: HySafe aims to the development and sale of products for reducing vibrations of civil and industrial structures and mechanical parts and products for the implementation and stabilisation of large roofs, temporary crosswalks.
competitiveAdvantages: The device is compact and has a limited footprint on the structure compared with existing tuned-mass dampers; therefore, it can be architecturally and structurally integrated without altering the building's plan-elevation profile. The device does not require any power supply. This reduces costs and makes it effective even in case of unfavorable and concomitant earthquake events such as a power outage. The nonlinear hysteretic behavior of the device makes it effective and robust with respect to uncertainties in the structural characteristics of the building.
description: The invention consists of a mechanical device that, when installed on civil or industrial structures exposed to dynamic forcing, greatly reduces the magnitude of vibrations while improving both the level of safety and functionality. The device consists of an oscillating mass connected to the structure by steel or shape memory alloy ropes. When the structure is stressed, kinetic energy is transferred to the mass, which, by oscillating relatively to the structure, applies recall forces on it such that its motion is limited.
enablingTechnologies: Rope design is done in part through machine learning algorithms.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
The main applications of the technology are:

  1. Seismic risk reduction of various structures (both new and existing civil buildings, bell towers)
  2. Vibration control in sensitive structures such as off-shore wind towers, cable cars, mechanical equipment, marine, aeronautical, railway, aerospace)
  3. In particular, the implementation form of the technology under development is designed for seismic risk reduction of multi-story reinforced concrete and steel buildings.
payoff: Reinventing vibration damping
revenueModel: B2B model, in which specialized design is provided to design firms, and device supply and maintenance to construction companies. Production and maintenance will be outsourced to an external company that will act as our partner.
targetCustomers: The main clients are construction companies and design firms.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: Ninetek Innovazioni per l'Agro-industria
abstract: Ninetek offers hardware (sensor technology) and software solutions for monitoring agro-industry plants/processes, with specific reference to the olive-oil, dairy, wine and fruit and vegetable sectors, food packaging and energy saving.
businessTraction:
Frequent collaborations are active with the following partners, with whom testing and development activities have been shared: Oranfrizer srl, Scordia (CT) - TAS srl, Ceresole D'Alba (CN) - F.lli Satriani, Potenza (PZ).

Ninetek is innovator partner in the H2020 European project "MyPack"
competitiveAdvantages: The strength of the proposed solutions is the high level of customization of the systems based on specific customer needs, which contrasts with the rigidity of similar systems on the market.
competitiveScenario: The design and creation of prototypes in the laboratory allows us to offer companies solutions that have already been extensively studied and tested, but above all customized based on customer needs. Compared to competitors, in the Basilicata region there are no direct competitors but business services companies that offer services oriented towards chemical and sensorial analysis.
description: The project idea is based on the development of products (sensors, prototypes) made as part of the research activity, and adaptable to specific production contexts, but not present on the market (current limit). Ninetek proposes (a) a system for controlling the controlled atmosphere in refrigerated warehouses dedicated to the storage of fruit and vegetables, (b) the application of an innovative packaging system capable of extending the shelf life of fresh food products, and (c) a web-based monitor for measuring energy consumption in food industry (Web energy).
enablingTechnologies: The services and products offered make use of technologies such as IoT, Cloud Computing and Big Data Analytics.
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications: Ninetek has developed modular and customizable hardware and software prototypes for process control in various agribusiness sectors. The start-up activity has also expanded to offering services for testing food packaging systems, and for measuring energy consumption in the food industry.
payoff: Innovative sensors and machines for food/agriculture industry application
revenueModel: The business model is based on the differentiation of the products offered, compared to a basic package, for the specific needs of the customer, also depending on the production sector to which they belong. For some solutions, a SAAS (software as a service) type model is proposed.
targetCustomers: The companies belong to the category of pasta factories, oil mills and fruit and vegetable preservation and processing companies.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: StarFInn
abstract: StarFInn srls is a company founded in 2016 as an Academic Spin-off with the aim of transferring the know-how gained in the field of Yeast Microbiology in over 20 years of research activities to companies operating in the wine, beer, bread and bakery products sector.
businessTraction: The spin-off has a fruitful collaboration with the company AEB S.p.A, and with local wine cellars
competitiveAdvantages: The use of commercial yeasts distributed by multinational companies has led to a flattening of the organoleptic quality of finished products. Instead, the use of specific strains, selected according to both the food matrix to be fermented and the finished product to be obtained, would be appropriate. This ensures not only a smooth fermentation process, but also the preservation of the organoleptic typicality of fermented products, which can be compromised by the use of non-specifically selected starter cultures
competitiveScenario: StarFInn's offerings include 'customised' types of services and products (in the sense of starter yeasts) that provide the potential customer with a quid pluris compared to the services offered by competitors. In the south of Italy, there are no copetitors offering similar services, constituting an advantage in having a point of reference in southern Italy in this sector.
description: The activities are aimed at investigating and applying innovative laboratory techniques, useful for obtaining quality fermented products 'tailor-made' for the company with the yeasts selected ad hoc for the clients. StarFInn's core business consists precisely in supplying target companies with 'customised' yeasts, appropriately selected from the starting food matrices, capable of enhancing the intrinsic characteristics of the product, exploiting the biodiversity present among the spontaneous microflora, to obtain an exclusive, non-imitable and tailor-made product.
enablingTechnologies:
Cloud Computing, Big Data Analytics.

StarFInn owns the following patents:

  • "Yeast strain Saccharomyces cerevisiae species" patent n° 0001414462 of 10/03/2015;
  • "Drying-resistant wine strain of Hanseniaspora uvarum" N° 102018000003203
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
• Selection and distribution of specific yeasts for cellars, breweries, bakeries and companies producing baked goods
  • Storage of yeast strains
  • Environmental, supply chain and process microbiological control
  • Training and scientific dissemination
  • Consultancy and feasibility studies
payoff: Starter For Innovation
revenueModel: The spinoff, in order to provide target companies with customised yeasts, intends to set up a plant for the production of yeast in cream or dried form, aiming to become a reference point in southern Italy.
targetCustomers: Wine cellars, microbreweries, bakeries.

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: ViVita
abstract: From agri-food waste to health products: dermocosmetics, food supplements, substance-based medical devices and foods for special medical purposes, with particular attention to sustainability and the environment.
businessTraction: Unindustria, Lazio region
competitiveAdvantages:
• Use of natural resources: active ingredients extracted from plant matrices, mainly from the recovery and transformation of waste, plant by-products and processing residues of agri-food companies (green economy, circular economy);
  • Reduce the use of preservatives, encouraging the use of substances that are also safe for pregnant women and children;
  • Reduction of costs and consumption of ethanol and water;
  • Circular economy: waste becomes raw material for a new production cycle.
description: ViVita aims to contribute to the well-being of the individual, designing and developing high-quality and innovative medical devices, dermocosmetics and food supplements, with particular attention to sustainability and the environment.
enablingTechnologies: HPLC/DAD and NMR chromatographic techniques and use of latest generation, ecological and energy efficient machinery, such as the Rotavapor Buchi R-220 pro.
mainApplications: Dercosmetics and supplements based on VITINIX®, an active ingredient of natural origin obtained from grape seeds starting from unfermented pomace.
payoff: Vivita products for your well-being
revenueModel: The dissemination and commercial strategy is multi-channel, aimed at the physical market (offline) and the e-commerce market, also making use of scientific representatives to broaden the information and promotion network of the products.
targetCustomers: B2C, health and well-being

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: Sicurezza 4.0
abstract: The main objective of Security 4.0 is to create new Apps for the simplification and digitalisation of security services to offer to the business world, in order to improve the level of worker protection.
businessTraction: Confindustria, Gruppo Acea SpA, Federfarma, Manpower, Acciaierie d'Italia, Conferesercenti
competitiveAdvantages: Applications (Apps) that can simplify safety procedures and facilitate the digitization of services offered to companies, allowing for an increased level of protection for workers and improving efficiency in the management of occupational safety regulations. easy to use, handy and always up-to-date
description: Sicurezza 4.0 has as its object the development of new technologies and systems, aimed at the implementation of theories, techniques and good management and operational practices regarding security through the creation of computer codes and applications (apps) in the field of design and management of the safety of complex systems, of the territory, of infrastructures, of work and of the protection of workers' health, offering the world of businesses and administrations technological and organizational solutions and encouraging the digitalisation of the related services.
enablingTechnologies: Computer codes and Applications
mainApplications:
Available applications:

  • AudioSafety: all information, instructions and procedures for occupational and fire safety at your fingertips
  • SafetyControl: high vigilance at a glance, on the smooth running of all management, safety and health activities
  • SafetyCheck: tracking and certification of operational supervision by supervisors, and high supervision by Managers and Employers
  • SafetyCodex: all legislation and important legal information on occupational safety, updated daily.
payoff: Digital innovation for total worker protection
revenueModel: The costs for the creation of the Apps have already been incurred and the current contracts allow for regular management and continuous development of the Apps
targetCustomers: Companies interested in the apps for process digitalization and the main mandatory legal processes for workplace safety for more efficient, standardized, tracked and verifiably verifiable implementation.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Actor
abstract: ACTOR offers Advanced Analytics and Artificial Intelligence services to better manage resources, contain costs, maximize the efficiency and productivity of the company.
businessTraction: ACT- OperationsResearch Srl, NextWare Srl
competitiveAdvantages: ACTOR creates fast mathematical algorithms based on operational research and mathematical optimization techniques. Using these methodologies it is possible to exploit the information contained in the available data in order to obtain both complex forecasts and assessments of the impact of possible decisions that arise in different scenarios and different opportunities.
description: ACTOR (Analytics, Control Technologies and Operations Research) is an R&D boutique company that provides services, based on models, methods and control algorithms, optimisation, forecasting and simulation for the design and development of complex systems
enablingTechnologies: Fast mathematical algorithms based on operational research and mathematical optimization techniques
mainApplications:
ACTOR develops optimization, control, prediction and simulation models and algorithms in different contexts, such as:

  • Excellent design in engineering
  • Optimization and simulation in the management of healthcare systems
  • Optimization of itineraries in the cruise sector
  • Consumption forecasts in the energy sector
  • Sales forecasts in large-scale retail trade
  • Failure detection in the fashion sector
payoff: Advanced Analytics and Artificial Intelligence for the design and management of complex systems
revenueModel: Allocation to reserves of significant portions of the profits achieved and used for investment expenses without having to resort to credit
targetCustomers: Decision makers of companies and organizations involved in the production of goods and services

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Rozes
abstract: Rozes developed AI algorithms to pre-recognise the risk of engaging in business with potentially dangerous and financially unstable companies with a fast, simple, predictive and reliable service.
businessTraction:
Rozes came third in 'Startup Marathon' final in Verona, the contest for start-ups promoted by Area Science Park, UniCredit and Fondazione Comunica.

The Rozes index has been integrated into the new Provisio intelligence module, Corvallis -Tinexta Group's solution for comprehensive and sophisticated new customer acquisition, verification that enables end-to-end management of AML (Anti Money Laundering) processes.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Time-saving when analysing data
  • Information storage in a single cloud computing platform
  • Software integration capability
  • Real-time insight on companies and individuals participating in tenders and contracts by detecting any single centre of interest, through massive import and export of participants via CSV, aggregated analysis via scatter, geographical analysis and risk matrix

Rozes is considered by Chartis Research to be among the top 50 companies in the World in the fight against Financial Crime.
competitiveScenario: Risk Management software on the market evaluates organisation business risks through sociological and behavioural analysis, but not through economic analysis (Crime & Tech) or through the master data analyses (iCribis and Cerved Visius). Compared to competitors, the Rozes index ensures up to 95 % accuracy, offers an accurate accounting point of view and very high predictivity.
description:
Rozes' mission is to safeguard entrepreneurs, companies and the public administration by guaranteeing simple, fast and universal access to information.
Rozes' services allow companies an enhanced ability to analyse data and to control customers and suppliers through the creation of individual or cluster reports and real-time monitoring. Rozes developed an index to measure the similarity of a company's financial statements with companies linked to organised crime, through AI models.
enablingTechnologies: Machine learning, Artificial Intelligence
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
• Customer and supplier verification
  • Insolvency risk control
  • Risk analysis and assessment
  • Corporate decision-making processes
  • Predictive Analyses on Business Risk
  • Training, Consultancy and Change Management
payoff: With Rozes, one click is all it takes to see how solid your customers' and prospects' position is.
revenueModel: Rozes is a SAS SaaS - Security Software As A Service
targetCustomers:
• Banks
  • Insurance companies
  • Organisations
  • Venture capital companies
  • Financial institutions
  • Public Administration
  • Industrial companies
  • Business Consumer

Visioscientiae deals with research, development and distribution of industrial software platforms. The company operates both in the field of algorithms and technologies of Artificial Intelligence and Big Data both in the creation and guidance of Hi-Tech companies.

Among the fields in which Visioscientiae has implemented its algorithms and software platforms based on artificial intelligence, we can list Smart Cities & Mobility, Medicine & Healthcare, Finance & Business, Tourism and Business Process Automation.

  • Smart Mobility

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Motus ml
abstract: Motus ml offers the first Edge AI that allows advanced analysis in an incremental, resilient to changes and in real-time.
businessTraction:
Development with RAI Way and Thales a Proof of Value for the beginning of 2023 that validate the solution, then enter the market of predictive maintenance.

Many years of collaboration are underway with universities and research centers such as: Politecnico di Milano, Waikato University, University of Pisa, Siemens-Research Energy System (RSE).

Finally, they are incubated for a year at the Hurban Hub in Piacenza where they are carrying out a path of acceleration
competitiveAdvantages:
• Cloud-independent: incremental learning allows you to get a custom model for each device; this allows its application on machines and facilities in remote areas
  • Accessible: The proposed ML techniques cost less to engineer the entire AI solution than the ML models currently in use in the Cloud
  • Embeddable in enterprise data analytics infrastructure: The SML models employed consume little computational resources, and are easily integrated into existing infrastructure, whether cloud, edge or hybrid
competitiveScenario:
Two main categories of competing companies that provide solutions for the implementation on Edge devices or IoT models of Machine Learning:

  • Edge Impulse, Imagimob and SensiML: Offer more comprehensive databases, tools, libraries and solutions for edge ML applications
  • Ekkono, Latent AI, Plumerai and Xailient: focus on specific technologies in data science and ML stack
description: Motus.ml offers a new IoT automation solution based on Streaming Machine Learning, capable of learning in an incremental and resilient way, continuously updating its models with one data at a time and automatically managing non-stationary data. Streaming Machine Learning techniques can be used directly at the edge of the network: in this way it is possible to analyze all the data generated by peripheral sensors, reducing the costs of analysis on cloud platforms and thus drastically reducing the risk of exposing sensitive data on the network
enablingTechnologies: AI, IoT, AIoT, Machine Learning
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications: Predictive maintenance of radio-base transmissions located in isolated areas and therefore not easily reached in a short time
payoff: Give data an edge.
revenueModel: B2B based on the in-house development of the proprietary SDK while, as for the hardware, we will turn to a solution partner manufacturer, supplier and installer of hardware and devices IoT
targetCustomers: Target sectors include companies with machines and plants in remote areas, potentially disconnected from the network or with little connectivity. In these extreme scenarios the competitive advantages of Motus ml AI are maximized. In particular, we focus on predictive machine maintenance, anticipating faults in advance and reducing downtime as much as possible.

title: EPTATRONIX
abstract: EPTATRONIX develops innovative IoT systems to automate products and processes and optimize resources in different sectors.

The proposals are based on technological solutions in the field of industrial sensors, IoT - Social IoT (SIoT), cloud Networking, telemetry and telematics Machine to Machine (M2M), Low Power Wide Area (LPWA) networks, distributed and synchronized monitoring systems, distributed sensor calibration
enablingTechnologies: IoT, SIoT, LPWA networks, M2M telematics
mainApplications: The realization of a management software for industry 4.0, which integrates all the relevant business processes of a company (sales, purchases, warehouse management, accounting, etc.) strongly oriented to iot and run entirely on cloud. The main novelty of the software offered will be the integration with the Lysis platform, that will allow not only to perform all the classic operations of an ERP but will also be able to directly and indirectly manage all connected devices constituting the entire company
payoff: Cloud services for integrated systems
targetCustomers: Public and private entities

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: Dhiria
abstract: DHIRIA develops "as-a-service" machine and deep learning solutions for encrypted data processing by integrating Homomorphic Encryption-based computing solutions.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Machine learning solutions for time series (prediction, classification, clustering and anomaly detection), texts (classification and clustering), images (anomaly detection)
  • Diversified solutions: paas for experienced users, to select the specifications of the algorithms based on their needs and to create a product "ad hoc"; for the less experienced, a ready-to-use solution that typifies the information needs and directs the choices between the predefined categories
  • MLaaS services on encrypted data by integrating Homomorphic Encryption-based computing solutions
competitiveScenario:
• Direct competitors: big players (IBM, Microsoft, Amazon, Google) and companies (Itron, Inpher, Chainalytics, Epica) that offer X-learning-aaS (Forecasting-aaS, Prediction-aaS) products
  • Cryptographic technology providers: intermediate solutions, enabling the implementation of Forecasting-/Analytics-aaS services in a condition of privacy preserving (Zamak, Duality Tech, Cosmian, Galois, AWS)
description: DHIRIA develops machine and deep learning solutions in an "as-a-service" mode to process user data in an encrypted manner by integrating Homomorphic Encryption (HE) based computing solutions. By leveraging HE properties, users can encrypt their data locally via a public key, send it to a properly coded machine/deep learning service that operates on the Cloud (provided through the machine and deep-learning-as-a-service approach) and receive results that are decrypted locally by the user via the private key
enablingTechnologies: Homomorphic Encryption (HE), Machine and Deep Learning, AI, Cloud Computing
mainApplications: The large processing capacity and high memory availability of cloud computing systems are able to effectively and efficiently intercept the ever-increasing requests for processing and memory of machine algorithms and, in particular, deep learning
payoff: Intelligence in Artificial Intelligence
revenueModel:
Analytics (ML/DL) as a service declined in 2 different configurations depending on the expertises of the end user:

  • "Self-service analytics - in PaaS" for specialized users
  • "Assisted analytics - in SaaS" for less experienced users
targetCustomers: Companies in sectors such as Banking/Insurance, Health, Public Administration, Judicial, Military

title: Graftonica
abstract: Graphtonic produces micro and nanometric additives for the plastic/rubber sector, thanks to compatibilization techniques between inorganic (functional) and polymeric (structural) materials.
businessTraction: Projects with Tetrapak, Antenna company, Luxottica, Trelleborg, Teaflex, Sir industriale, Serenity, Prysmian, Printgraph, Mediaca, IPS, Mappy, Lindt, Intercos, Diapath, Cembre, Camozzi, Caffaro, RTM breda

  • Technical-scientific assistance on advanced methodologies and instrumentation in production and quality control
description:
Grafton develops products and services in the plastic/rubber sector, specialising in the study and production of prototypes based on nano and micro-polymer composites. The activity is divided into three macro-areas:

  • Strategic material advice, aimed at solving specific problems
  • Prototyping new materials or upgrading existing materials
  • Production of own materials: Graftlight-additive for lighting technology, Graftclay-additive for the automotive sector, materials for the creation of medical puppets for healthcare sector, biobased wood-based composite
enablingTechnologies: Additive Manufacturing
mainApplications: Thanks to innovative compatibilization techniques, the company has successfully developed a range of innovative materials and devices, both proprietary and for third parties, ranging in different sectors including electronics, automotive, construction, medical materials.
payoff: Grafting technologies
revenueModel: Direct sales of services and products, royalty revenues on products
targetCustomers: Companies that want to develop new materials or improve their own in the field of polymers and composites

abstract: OaCP develops and supplies laboratories with diagnostic products for oncology and infectious diseases that can reduce the time and cost required to perform the tests.

  • Commercial/Technological: IVD and IVDR obtained, ongoing partnerships with Roche, and distributors in Europe, Japan, and Switzerland

  2. Reduction of test time from 2 working days to 2 hours

abstract: SINBIOSYS develops biocompatible silicon nanoscristalls (SiQD) that can be used as markers in different contexts, from laboratory diagnostics to tracking and sorting of materials.

title: Piùlento
abstract: Piùlento realizes light infrastructure projects for slow mobility and public spaces and develops applications to support design and management.

  • Municipality of Piacenza: redevelopment project along the Po and the connection between the riverside and the historic center

Piùlento transforms academic research into concrete actions, focusing on lightweight infrastructure projects for slow mobility and public spaces. In response to the growing importance of walking and cycling mobility, highlighted by the pandemic, Piùlento plays a key role in three areas:

  1. Implementation of projects in the field, acting as a link between research and society

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: SELIGENDA Membrane Technologies
abstract: SELIGENDA aims to replace or hybridize conventional and expensive downstream processing platforms (mostly based on chromatographic separation units) for purification of biomolecules with the next generation of integrated membrane systems.
businessTraction: Collaboration with the European Commission
competitiveAdvantages: The proposed platform, in addition to overcoming the limitations of the chromatographic technique (intermittent capture cycles, elution, washing, resin regeneration, waste and waste management), it does not require chemicals or solvents normally necessary for the regeneration of the columns, making the downstream process also attractive for environmental sustainability. The modularity of membrane operations ensures flexibility, simplicity of scale-up, advanced control, allowing continuous operations (continuos manufacturing) for high productivity
competitiveScenario: Competitors: companies in the chromatography market for pharmaceutical and biotechnology applications (GE Healthcare, Repligen, Pall Life Sciences,...) and chromatographic instruments (Agilent Tech, Waters Corp, Shimadzu,...). The strength of the chromatograph is reliability in purification. Among the most critical weaknesses: high cost of resins, need to work in batch
description: SELIGENDA is engaged in R&D, production and marketing of innovative and efficient membrane separation technologies for biotechnology, biomedical and pharmaceutical applications. SELIGENDA revolutionizes the current downstream process (DSP) of biological therapies, developing new generation membrane systems operating according to the paradigm of Continuous Production. SELIGENDA also acts as a CDMO for the creation of new DSP solutions specific to pharmaceutical companies and provides consulting services for design, prototyping and scale-up of membrane operations
enablingTechnologies: Purification systems, crystallization systems
mainApplications:
• Engineered nanostructured membranes and/or molecular recognition properties by selective separation - in the form of crystalline or amorphous precipitate - of biomolecules, including active pharmaceutical principles (selection of polymorphs, separation of enantiomers)proteins, monoclonal antibodies and their derivatives
  • Purification process, engineered according to "continuous manufacturing", flexible (thanks to the intrinsic modularity of membrane processes), eco-sustainable (no use of organic eluents), economical (use of low-cost polymer materials)
payoff: Innovation in Downstream Processing
revenueModel:
• Consulting for the development of advanced separation processes for various industrial applications
  • Design and manufacture of membrane modules in various configurations: standard geometry, spiral wound, hollow fibers, plate and frame etc.
targetCustomers:
• Pharmaceutical companies and/or manufacturers/direct users of mAbs
  • Companies using membrane plants/modules for the advanced purification of specific compounds
  • CDMOs that develop advanced purification processes (Downstream Processing) based on membrane technology that can replace conventional chromatography platforms
  • R&D collaborations with companies within the environmental field

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: QTI
abstract: The first Italian company of Quantum Key Distribution (QKD), QTI develops and manufactures industrial-grade systems for quantum networks, for unconditional security of communications.
businessTraction: Telsy Spa has invested in the shares of QTI. Telsy and QTI have concluded a commercial agreement
competitiveAdvantages: The customer who chooses a QKD solution can boast a technological superiority over competitors, ensure the best security standard on the market for communication and data storage and therefore better protect their customers. Security in data transmission is guaranteed with respect to future technologies and the threat of the quantum computer. It ensures the security of encrypted data in the future and its integrity also compared to the threat store now & decrypt later
competitiveScenario: As compared to competitors, QTI is the only QKD company that is part of a large group of telecommunications operators (TIM Group)
description: QTI develops and manufactures industrial systems for quantum networks and communications security. Quell-X is a Quantum Key Distribution system consisting of an Alice and a Bob unit capable of generating quantum cryptographic keys for ultra-secure data communication. The system can be integrated with signal regeneration nodes - trusted nodes - to reach long distances (greater than 100km, otherwise standard detectors are sufficient). The systems operate both in the C band and in the O band (that is, both in dark-fiber mode and in coexistence with classical communication data)
enablingTechnologies: Lasers, classical communications, single-photon detectors, quantum random number generators
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications:
• Cryptographic key distribution infrastructure
  • Data center security
  • Protection of medical data
  • National and transnational backbones
  • Long distance key distribution based on trusted nodes
  • Key distribution on reconfigurable networks (star, ring, software defined networks)
  • Governmental and financial data security
  • Critical infrastructure security: airports, ports, gas-distribution and power-grids distribution
payoff: Quantum Turn-Key Solutions
targetCustomers: Government customers, business, military organizations, international organizations

title: SNAP4
abstract: The flexible and dynamic platform to put the city/industry in full control of its operational objectives.
competitiveAdvantages: SNAP4 offers services and develops applications based on completely open source technologies that allow to implement solutions of digital twin and decision support in smart city and industry 4.0 in a sustainable way and eliminating the problem of technology lock-in

SNAP4 covers from data acquisition (any format and protocol), to secure management, applies analysis algorithms for predictions, detection of anomalies, preventive warnings, predictive maintenance, calculation of KPIs, up to data viewing from external apps via API. The solution aggregates and correlates any data, facilitating the creation of apps and visualization dashboards by standardizing domains, parameters and different contexts
