trl.label: 1 - Observation of fundamental principles

title: MaTOX
abstract: MaTOX s.r.l. manufactures and markets diagnostic kits for the monitoring and control of the surface pollution of sanitary work environments from toxic compounds, for the protection of the health of operators.
businessTraction: The entire procedure has been validated according to the guidelines of the European Medicines Agency (EMA) and has already been tested in situ in one of the largest hospital complexes in Campania, the Hospital San Giovanni di Dio and Ruggi d'Aragona. The kit has been tested on surfaces made of different materials (hoods, work benches, office furniture), always being performing, to guarantee an effective, usable and versatile collection method
competitiveAdvantages:
• Easy and quick to use method
  • Economic to produce
  • Ensures accurate results regardless of operator competence
  • During the collection (wipe) of the sample from the surfaces, it does not require specialized personnel
  • After sampling with the kit, the sample may be sent to any laboratory capable of analysing the molecules adsorbed during the sampling operation from the surfaces
competitiveScenario:
Similar diagnostic kits (Exposure Control, ChemoGlo, Berner, ChemoAlert) have 2 main limitations that MaTOX overcomes:

  • perform in real time the quality control of the picking procedure, making the results independent of the operator’s manual skills
  • allow the test results to be obtained from the MaTOX laboratory, or any laboratory with LC/MS system
description: MaTOX s.r.l. (Environmental Monitoring and Toxicology) manufactures and markets diagnostic kits based on wipe test for monitoring and control of surface pollution of sanitary work environments from toxic compounds for operators, which drugs used for the preparation of chemotherapy. Wipe tests can be analyzed via LC-MS/MS. The use of MaTOX kits allows you to quickly identify areas of higher chemical risk, allowing the implementation of corrective actions to safeguard the health of health professionals exposed
enablingTechnologies: Wipe-test, mass spectrometry (LC-MS/MS)
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications:
• Monitoring of health environments to detect contamination by toxic compounds
  • Monitoring of environments for chemical contamination
payoff: "Stay safe, work safe", solutions for the environmental monitoring and occupational safety
targetCustomers: Facilities in which potentially toxic drugs are manipulated and used, such as public/private hospitals, antiblastic drug handling units (U.F.A), pharmacies, research laboratories, private clinics, IRCCS, veterinary clinics, pharmaceutical companies, and any structure/environment in which the personnel may come into contact with dangerous polluting material

title: M2TEST
abstract: M2TEST develops the BES TEST, an examination for the evaluation of the quality of the bone structure useful for the diagnosis, monitoring and prevention of alterations in the bone structure.
businessTraction: BNP Paribas Group, Findomestic, Maico Sordità: they have introduced the BES TEST in the company welfare offering prevention paths for bone health
competitiveAdvantages:
• Prediction of the response to stress and resistance, also identifies osteopenic people with previous osteoporotic fractures, not diagnosed with routine examination (densitometry, MOC-DEXA)
  • Can be used in prevention: early identification of changes in bone structure, and can be performed safely even at a young age
  • Repeatable: the analyses and therefore the bone changes can be evaluated even after 4-6 months with the BES TEST, allowing the evaluation of the current therapy and any changes (customization)
  • Quick and convenient analysis
competitiveScenario: Competitor: MOC-DEXA, reference for diagnosis of osteoporosis. Evaluate the mineral content, but predict fractures in only 40-50% of cases, since these often occur in subjects that do not have reductions in bone mineral content. BES TEST integrates, without overlapping, the densitometric examination, which is more expensive, requires more execution time and exposes more to radiation
description: M2TEST has developed the BES TEST, an examination for the evaluation of the quality of the bone structure useful for diagnosis, monitoring and prevention of alterations in the bone structure. The BES TEST is based on the simulation of the application of forces on the "virtual biopsy" of the bone architecture of the patient, obtained from radiographic images. Through the test it is possible to determine the structural quality of the bone, that is the ability to withstand the loads up to the fracture threshold, by simulations of the behavior of the trabecular architecture visible from the X-ray
enablingTechnologies: Data analysis, Imaging
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
• Primary osteoporosis and secondary osteoporosis (nephrology, oncology, diseases and use of drugs that lead to an increase in bone fragility), where today the methods used do not allow proper control and follow up of the patient
  • Can also be used in prevention and monitoring of bone changes in the short term
payoff: The future for the diagnosis, monitoring and prevention of fragility fractures.
revenueModel:
Saas, with 2 types of offers:

  • Subscription plan: based on economies of scale. XS/S/M/L packages, from max. €25, to min. €18 /analysis
  • Single analysis payment (€30): ideal for screening days (pharmacies, corporate welfare, small medical centers for monthly tests) or for initial tests by centers
targetCustomers: Medical and private multi-specialty clinics, hospitals

title: InSimili
abstract: InSimili aims to improve the drug selection process thanks to an innovative cell culture device. By limiting the number of incorrectly selected drugs, and thus limiting failures in the clinical phase, InSimili makes the process faster and more effective.
businessTraction: Collaborations with: Università di Bologna, IRST Meldola, Fondazione RiMed
competitiveAdvantages:
The main differentiators of InSimili technology are:

  • Experimental conditions closer to those of the human body (increasing testing efficacy and reliability)
  • InSimili technology can be integrated into traditional Petri dishes and micro-wells, so industry can quickly adopt them into their existing equipment
  • A large number of cell lines and cultures relevant to the experiment can be used
  • Ease of use
competitiveScenario: The main technology categories on the market that aim to respond to the need for experimentation closer to the actual physiological conditions are: 1) Hypoxic hoods; 2) Microfluidics; 3) Organoids and 3D cell cultures
description: InSimili has developed an integrated device for standard cell culture, featuring an experimental environment much closer and resembling the human body tissue environment and its physiology, to make the preclinical drug-testing phase more effective, allowing companies that depend heavily on the results of the drug selection process to save time and money. The device, already tested and validated by three different research institutes, is disposable, suitable for large-scale screening and directly implementable in laboratory plastics
enablingTechnologies: Innovative technologies
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications: Drug screening and selection

title: Zenit Smart Polycrystals
abstract: Zenit strives to bring quality and sustainability to the international markets of medical lasers and high-power industrial lasers, automotive, lighting and scintillation detectors through the use of polycrystals obtained through new additive manufacturing processes.
competitiveAdvantages:
Possibility of creating polycrystalline materials that, compared to the materials based on monocrystalls conventionally used:

  • have lower production costs and times
  • can have complex shapes and an internal structure of the dopant that leads to an increase in the efficiency of the components
competitiveScenario:
Zenit aims to serve the solid-state laser systems market. Zenit polycrystals are an alternative to traditional single crystals:

  • better heat dissipation during emission processes
  • minimized degradation of performance caused by thermal gradients and related optical effects
  • reduced production costs
  • design & performance optimization of the laser source for different applications
  • flexible shape & composition
description: Zenit Smart Polycrystals is an innovative start-up and a spin-off of the Italian National Research Council (CNR) founded in the ceramic district of Faenza (Italy). With the support of national and international funds, the group led by Laura Esposito has patented a process that exploits the 3D printing to shape transparent polycrystalline components with complex geometries and chemical composition that can vary in three dimensions.
enablingTechnologies: Transparent ceramics, 3D printing
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
• Solid-state lasers: to increase the quality and efficiency of laser radiation. Zenit transparent ceramic polycrystalls are structured in composition and shape, reducing the effects of thermal gradients and parasitic emissions that are generated during laser emission
  • Phosphor-based scintillators: polycrystalline scintillators that are faster to produce, less expensive, and more flexible as shapes compared to monocrystalline
  • Automotive laser headlights: polycrystalline to convert the blue light of laser diodes into white light, with customizable shapes and sizes
payoff: Polycrystals for innovative applications
revenueModel: B2B
targetCustomers: Manufacturers of solid-state lasers and laser crystals, manufacturers of scintillators and automotive industry

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: HST
abstract: Design, manufacture and commercialization of an innovative strain sensor based on a resonant MEMS device with a resolution of over a factor of 1000 compared to the devices currently on the market.
businessTraction:
• Collaboration with the company Bonfiglioli Riduttori s.p.a. for the development of an "intelligent" gear motor capable of improving its performance based on torque monitoring and rotation speed thanks to the application of high resolution MEMS sensors. If the validation is successful, the company will include the product in their offer
  • IMM-CNR headquarters in Bologna
  • STEMS-CNR headquarters in Ferrara
competitiveAdvantages: Resonant MEMS allow to reach resolution limits several orders of magnitude higher than traditional technology, covering a multitude of applications that require resolution below the microstrain and acquisition bands higher than khz. The sensor is able to measure physical quantities due to elastic deformation on a material, without full scale limits. The production costs of the MEMS are scalable with size and quantity produced, potentially reaching equal to the sensors "low" market, without detriment to performance
competitiveScenario: Competitors for strain gauge sensors/load cells are large multinationals. The types of strain gauges are varied and exploit different physical principles (resistive, piezoresistive, fiber optic, vibrating wire,...), with limit of resolution above the microstrain. The best sensors have high costs and long integration times in data reading, limiting them in applications
description: Design, manufacture and marketing of products based on a very high resolution MEMS strain sensor, up to 1000 times more sensitive than the equivalent sensors currently on the market, with significantly reduced thermal drift, making the sensor suitable for industrial environments.
enablingTechnologies: Advanced manufacturing solutions, Industrial internet and IoT, Sensors and micro/nanosystems
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
• Gearmotors/bearings: speed, Torque, torque distribution, unbalance conditions, temperature
  • Screws: torque, tension and temperature
  • Truck/wheels: loaded weight and dynamics
  • Hydraulic motor & pump: fluid pressure, flow, temperature, efficiency, cavitation
  • Mechanical structure: load and deformation in critical areas
  • Pressure tank/cylinder: pressure, deformation, temperature and fatigue
  • Hydraulic cylinder: pressure, deformation, temperature and fatigue
payoff: HighSenseTech
revenueModel: The prototypes will be delivered at a unit cost of €250. The expected spin-off revenue for the deployment of the first prototype gear motors will rise from €25,000 (100 sensors to €250 per sensor) in 2024 to €300,000 in 2025 (2,000 sensors to €150 per sensor)
targetCustomers: Industrial sectors where it is necessary to carry out strain measurements with sensors that guarantee high resolutions (which are not currently available on the market), small size and low consumption. For example, for the Emilia-Romagna region, the industry of automatic machines for packaging and robotics

title: H-Cube
abstract: H-Cube develops and manufactures smart clothes for professional athletes. The H-Cube T-shirt (H-Tee) monitors thermal homeostasis, biomechanical activity and heart activity during physical activity and post-training recovery, analyzing data via AI to report performance indicators.
businessTraction:
• Planned PoC with 2 Serie A teams, a football insurance company and 3 collections of sportswear brands in development
  • Incentive Smart&Start
  • Funded by Archangel Adventure
competitiveAdvantages:
• Convenience: data can be acquired over a long period of time thanks to the innovative position of the electrodes for the ECG signal
  • Versatility: the choice of acquiring ECG allows the device to have multiple applications, such as the medical field for diagnosis and treatment of cardiovascular diseases, not only for sports use
  • Reliability: common wearables (e.g. smartwatch/bracelets) are based on LED technology (sensitive to ambient light and motion) to obtain an estimation signal (photoplethysmogram, PPG) not as accurate as the ECG for assessing heart variability (HRV)
competitiveScenario:
Supersapiens (Atlanta, US), direct competitor: patch for real-time blood sugar control, wearable for 14 days, transmits highly accurate data via bluetooth to an application, inducing positive behavior change.

H-Tee offers high functional comfort, instant monitoring (training), and continuous (6-8h after the session), providing different physical parameters
description: H-Cube develops and manufactures sensorized clothing to monitor professional athletes during training and recovery. The product is a T-shirt (H-Tee) with electrodes on the sleeves (for the 2-lead ECG signal), and a chest unit (Ti-Patch) based on flexible electronics. The Ti-Patch has bluetooth transmitter, infrared thermometer, triaxial accelerometer and device to process the ECG signal. The data is transmitted via bluetooth to an application that, via algorithm based on AI, provides the user with information regarding: welfare, sport, medical insurance
enablingTechnologies: IoT, flexible electronics, E-textiles, artificial intelligence, system integration, telehealth
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
• Welfare: monitoring of stress level, postural health, state of movement and disease risk
  • Sport: quantification of muscle stress level, injury risk assessment, recovery ratio, body heating efficiency, physical activity monitoring
  • Medical insurance: daily health indicator
  • Tele-monitoring/control of cardiovascular diseases thanks to the clinical use of the acquired data
  • Medical: the product can be applied in the medical field due to the nature of the data being acquired (ECG and body temperature)
payoff: The new era of sportswear
revenueModel: Bundle consisting of t-shirts, patches and app subscription. The t-shirt will be sold at a price of 30 € while the patch is included with the subscription of the application at a price of 150 € and the subscription at a price of 30 € per month.
targetCustomers: Sports field: athletic trainers interested in technologies that support the achievement of optimal physical condition, for support also in the prevention of injuries, to define training programs based on data. Sports hobbyists interested in professional technological solutions, able to analyze performance and return a precise picture of the state

title: Green Organic Synthesis (G.O.S.)
abstract: Psoriatrix cosmetic cream for the treatment of psoriatic lesions with anti-inflammatory, moisturizing and exfoliating properties.
businessTraction: Collaboration with the company Dieffetti cosmetics located in Minervino Murge within a PhD project Industrial.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Psoriatix leads to the disappearance of skin lesions in a faster time, 6-8 days, and with a more lasting effect than the products present in pharmacies, so the amount of cream used is lower making the therapy cheaper, there is no side effects and is applicable to patients aged < 12 years
  • The purity of indirubin obtained is more than 95%, with extremely economical extraction method
  • On the market there are no other topical creams for the treatment of psoriasis based on indirubin
competitiveScenario:
• Our methodology avoids the import of plants, limiting costs and transport times
  • Extraction techniques do not obtain pure Indirubin and require further purification. Our methodology provides 95% pure Indirubin
  • Sigma Aldrich sells 10mg of Indirubina at 355€. With Psoriatix, considering the cost of raw materials, the synthesis of 1g of Indirubin costs 2€
description: Psoriasis is an inflammatory disease of chronic-relapsing skin, strongly disabling, affecting between 2 and 5% of the world population. Indirubin, a compound extracted from natural sources with low efficiency and high costs, has been proven effective in relieving the symptoms of psoriasis, already after 14 days, unlike conventional topical therapies poorly effective. G.O.S. has developed a process for the synthesis and purification of Indirubin that is effective, eco-sustainable and low cost.
enablingTechnologies: Use of unconventional solvents such as DESs eutectic mixtures (Deep Eutectic Solvents), obtained from the combination of natural, biodegradable and non-toxic molecules
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications: Indirubin is the active ingredient of Psoriatrix, cosmetic cream for the treatment of psoriatic lesions with anti-inflammatory, moisturizing and exfoliating properties. Topical therapies on the market are mainly cortisone and calcipotriol based, show effects after 14-30 days and have contraindications. Psoriatrix, instead, leads to the disappearance of skin lesions more quickly and with a lasting effect, making the therapy more economical. It can be applied to patients <12 years and has no contraindications

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Bari Aldo Moro

title: Glass to Power (G2P)
abstract: G2P was founded in 2016 with the Vision to contribute to the energy efficiency of buildings imposed by the European Green Deal, and the Mission to market innovative photovoltaic modules to be integrated into building envelopes in the form of individual glazing units.
businessTraction: G2P has consolidated its production chain through a hybrid model. Critical phases, such as the production of Heli-On-specific components and the initial assembly of the photovoltaic device, are carried out in-house, ensuring control over quality and innovation. The subsequent phases, including the production of complex elements and the final assembly of the glass, are carried out with the help of qualified and strategic external partners.
competitiveAdvantages:
• For Nearly Zero Energy Buildings and Positive Energy Buildings
  • Transparency, interior brightness and minimalist design: the frame of the cells is discreet and preserves the aesthetics of the building, even for sophisticated architectural contexts;
  • Performance that can reach 75W/m2
  • Thermal and acoustic insulation comparable to those of traditional double glazing, with protection from humidity and atmospheric agents
  • Versatility and integration: standard dimensions (32mm/52mm/100mm/150mm) or customized. Suitable for curtain walls, skylights, glass roofs and can be integrated with active technologies.
competitiveScenario:
Among BIPV technologies, Heli-On positions itself distinctly:

  • Invisible photovoltaics for sustainable buildings, integrates harmoniously, transforming structures into energy producers without sacrificing design;
  • Integrated and invisible energy production;
  • Full transparency and light control;
  • It contributes to the creation of almost zero energy buildings and Positive Energy Buildings.
description:
Glass to Power -G2P- develops glass for sustainable architecture: photovoltaic technologies that integrate into the design of buildings, improving their energy efficiency.

Heli-On photovoltaic windows are the evolution of glass for sustainable architecture: they integrate the performance of insulating double glazing with the ability to produce energy, making the surfaces active elements, capable of generating electricity for self-sufficient architecture. The integrated photovoltaic frame produces clean electricity, guarantees transparency and offers thermo-acoustic insulation.
enablingTechnologies: The single-crystalline silicon photovoltaic cells are inserted in the photovoltaic insulating double glazing frame, an airtight environment protected from humidity and atmospheric agents, which ensures energy production without altering the thermal/acoustic insulation and solar control properties
mainApplications: Glass to Power solutions, with Heli-On, find application in the Real Estate sector, with a particular interest in buildings with curtain walls, glass roofs and skylights. Our products integrate harmoniously into facades and building envelopes, transforming every structure into an energy producer.
payoff: Glass to Power: the Invisible Energy.
revenueModel:
• Upstream Marketing: we collaborate with engineers and design studios for planning and redevelopment;
  • Downstream Marketing: partnerships with manufacturers of glass windows, fixtures and transformers;
  • Wide range of glass-glass solutions and opaque coverings for high-performance facades.
targetCustomers:
• Construction companies and architectural firms engaged in nZEB and Positive Energy Buildings building projects;
  • “Innovators” and “first adapters” of cutting-edge building technologies;
  • Real estate developers and property managers looking for long-term solutions to the energy efficiency and aesthetic value of their assets.

title: Finapp
abstract: Finapp develops innovative probes for the measurement of water content on a large scale, and compared to the systems currently on the market (electromagnetic sensors, remote sensing, environmental neutron detectors) they are more effective, reliable and less expensive.
businessTraction:
• Le Village by CA Triveneto
  • University of Padua - Faculty of Agriculture, Legnaro
  • IPSP-CNR
  • Politecnico of Turin
  • University of Bologna
  • ARPA Lombardia, ARPA Piemonte, ARPA Veneto
  • Veneto Civil Defence in MOSAIC project
  • First prize at Good Innovation Factory 2023

Quoted among the most promising start-ups by Agostino SCORNAJENCHI, CEO of CDP Venture Capital SGR.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Measurements of soil water content on large areas (a few hectares) and up to 60cm deep
  • Insensitive to soil texture
  • Non-invasive and non-contact measurement (sensor above ground)
  • Pre-localization losses and 10x execution speed compared to current methods
  • Real-time data thanks to the measurement of total incoming cosmic rays - unique on the market
  • High performance: counts up to 3000 neutrons /h
  • Customizable thanks to the modular design, with the use of plastic and metal materials very easy to find, light, less expensive and bulky, in Ecofriendly perspective
competitiveScenario: Finapp proposes an innovative and compact detector that can provide results in a wider area (from 4 to 10 hectares) and in depth, compared to the systems currently in use. The systems on the market provide an 'estimated' measurement starting from a point measure, this device offers an accurate and measured value of the entire analyzed surface.
description:
The FINAPP revolution is particle physics serving environmental sustainability.
The technology is patented: a new generation of CRNS probes using cosmic rays to measure non-contact, large-scale, deep and continuous water, customisable through modular design probes thanks to modular design.

Two versions:

  • Finapp 3: ideal in agriculture, to know the humidity of the soil. Accurate and continuous estimates over time
  • Finapp 5: high sensitivity for the areal estimation of the SWE (Snow Water Equivalent) or the search of aqueducts water losses
    Finapp_company_profile
enablingTechnologies: Silicon PhotoMultipliers (SiPM), platform/app, Cosmic Ray Neutron Sensing
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:

  • Measurement of the amount of water in the soil in agriculture, to implement a correct irrigation strategy
  • Landslide risk pre-allerdation, through the evaluation of mountain slopes saturation
  • Pre-risk exposure with the assessment of the water content in the undergrowth
payoff: The new generation of CRNS probes

title: FIBROSYS
abstract: FIBROSYS is a Research-Based Company with the aim of developing new diagnostic and therapeutic tools to counteract the fibrotic process responsible for the progression of various pathologies.
businessTraction: Ongoing contacts with Investment Funds and Business developers to: complete preclinical phase, start clinical trial, continue with drug discovery of new therapeutic solutions
competitiveAdvantages:
For the described pathologies, available therapeutic strategies limit the functional damage resulting from primary lesions (chronicization or slowing of the evolution of pathologies). The use of mAb anti-BAG3 would allow:

  • early treatment of diseases caused by fibrotic progressive lesions
  • improve the effectiveness of therapeutic strategies with drugs in use and those that are further developed
  • patients stratification, identifying those potentially treatable with anti-BAG3 by using a "companion diagnostic" BAG3-ELISA (kit) to detect the presence of the protein in human serum
competitiveScenario:
• Oncology, infectious diseases: Big Pharma, new Biotech
  • Cardiovascular, rare diseases: Big Pharma

Compared to available solutions, anti-BAG3 covers a greater number of patients, decreases cases of acquired resistance to synthetic drugs, and cases of short & long-term side effects; anti-IFITM2 is active on multiple viral variants, does not cause adverse reactions, is active in immunodepressed patients
description: FIBROSYS develops preclinical diagnostic/therapeutic tools to counteract the fibrotic process. In particular, he identified a form of BAG3 secreted by cancer cells and other cell types as a useful marker for diagnosis and progression of disease. The isolated monoclonal anti-BAG3 antibody was used in vitro and in vivo, with excellent results from laboratory validation tests. The R&D pipeline has 4 lines: oncology (pancreatic cancer); cardiovascular diseases (fibrotic cardiac remodeling); rare diseases (systemic sclerosis); infectious diseases (viral infections)
enablingTechnologies: Monoclonal antibodies (mAb)
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
Humanized Ab anti-BAG3 as therapy for:

  • ONCOLOGY: pancreatic cancer. BAG3 is over-expressed in pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma and other fibrotic tumors
  • CARDIOVASCULAR: post-myocardial infarction fibrosis. Diagnostic kit that detects BAG3 for patient selection/monitoring
  • RARE DISEASES: pulmonary fibrosis in patients with systemic sclerosis. Diagnostic kit that detects BAG3 in serum for patient selection/monitoring

Anti-IFITM2 monoclonal Ab (in development)

  • INFECTIOUS DISEASES: counteract early events from Sars-cov-2 infections (Herpes Simplex Virus-type 1 and 2, Respiratory Syncytial Virus - RSV)
payoff: Tackling the knots

Manufacturer: Reduction of handling time by ~90% and of costs associated with the loss of medical devices by ~60%. All products monitored and displayed.

Pharmacies: Over 90% reduction in handling time. Simplified multifunctional interface. Reduced economic impact of disputes with suppliers. Ministry reports always up-to-date.

Benefits Ministry of Health insights into global distributed medical device usage, usage patterns, user age groups, and critical information for patient home hospitalisation.
description: DITRA SOFTWARE is an innovative start-up, an academic spin-off of the University of Turin. Its activity consists in the development, production and commercialisation of a modern SaaS Cloud platform for the medical/healthcare sector, aimed at radically simplifying the distribution, management, reporting and tracking of medical products throughout their supply chain.
enablingTechnologies: Cloud SaaS for the medical/healthcare sector, aiming to radically simplify the distribution, management, reporting and tracking of medical products throughout their supply chain
mainApplications: Industry 4.0
payoff: We are focused on the digital transformation of the medical device supply chain.
revenueModel: Pay-per-use subscription system profiled according to customer characteristics through which a customisable set of services is accessed.
targetCustomers: Homecare companies, drug/DM manufacturers, pharmacies, wholesalers, distributors, hospitals, clinics, universities, research centres, diagnostic centres.

trl.label: 7 - Demonstration of the prototype in a real operational environment

title: Digital Superconducting Quantum Machines
abstract: DSQM aims to create a superconductive electronic platform capable of surpassing conventional electronics in terms of speed and efficiency. DSQM leverages the newly discovered field effect on elementary superconductors to create a radio frequency (QueSt) Superconductive Quantum Switch.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Multiplexing/demultiplexing of radio frequency signal for the control of superconducting quantum processors: cost reduction of up to -98% for the cabling and conventional electronics part.
  • Multiplexing/Demultiplexing of radiofrequency signal for the control of superconductive sensors multipixel: reduction of the space of reading systems of sensors with high number of pixels (>200).
  • Signal processing electronics for 6G infrastructures: potentially enabling technology. Current semi-consumer technology is not able to effectively process signals with freqeunze > 100 GHz.
competitiveScenario:
We have identified four companies whose solution seems to be a direct competitor to DSQM.

SeeQC SFQuClass processors: superconducting electronics based on Single Flux Quantum technology.

Imec CryoCMOS multiplexer: low temperature CMOS transistor, dissipative nature of technology.

Horse Ridge II of Intel: controller and multiplexer routed "far" from the quantum processor due to the power dissipated.
description: DSQM aims to create a superconducting electronic platform capable of surpassing conventional electronics in terms of speed (up to 100 times higher) and efficiency. It leverages the newly discovered field effect on elementary superconductors to create a radio frequency Superconductive Quantum Switch. In this way, a single cable can control up to 4 qubits. This could be the enabling technology that paves the way for the scalability of quantum computers that are currently limited by the high cost and the little space available inside the chillers.
enablingTechnologies: Quantum Technologies
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
• (Killer) Multiplexing/Demultiplexing of radio frequency signal for the control of superconducting quantum processors.
  • Multiplexing/Demultiplexing of radio frequency signal for the control of superconducting multipixel sensors.
  • Signal processing electronics for 6G infrastructure.
payoff: We create a high-performance superconducting electronics platform for Quantum Technologies.
revenueModel: Direct sales of components in both standard and custom configuration for individual applications.
targetCustomers:
Superconducting computer constructors (Google, IBM, rejects, etc.): increasing the scalability and computational power of their products. Savings on construction costs.

Cryostat manufacturers for high frequency applications: increase in cryostat measuring capacity, saving on construction costs.

title: Dynamic Optics
abstract: Dynamic Optics produces deformable optics for applications in the fields of laser communications, high-power lasers, and microscopy. Dynamic Optics' product range includes deformable mirrors and lenses, as well as wavefront sensors.
competitiveAdvantages: High performances, easiness of use and compactness.
competitiveScenario: Adaptive optics are currently mainly used in the academic world. With this project, we aim to transition to industrial applications.

1) High-performance control system

2) Deformable mirrors resistant to high-power lasers

3) Deformable lenses
mainApplications:
Application 1: Aberration correction system for laser communication between ground and satellite.

Application 2: Aberration correction in high-power lasers with laser sources up to 4 kW.

Application 3: Automatic aberration correction system in microscopy based on deformable lenses.
payoff: Dynamic Optics produces deformable optics for applications in the fields of laser communications, high-power lasers, and microscopy.
revenueModel: Participation in ESA funding for the lasercom part and interaction with industrial customers for the laser and microscopy parts.
targetCustomers: In the lasercom sector, there are companies such as ESA and Airbus. In the laser sector, we plan to work through distributors (in this case Optoprim), and for microscopy through online distributors (such as Edmund Optics).

title: ARCHEOSMART
abstract: The company carries out research, development and marketing of innovative high-tech services for archaeology and cultural heritage.

Many offer technical services and activities for teaching and museum installations, however, only very few have the necessary skills and means to meet the needs arising from that type of activity.

The services provided by the company concern: preventive archaeology, archaeological excavation, photointerpretation, geological and environmental analysis, territorial prospecting, stratigraphic essays, vocational training and teaching, enhancement, musealization and dissemination of historical and archaeological heritage, including the design and construction of exhibition routes.

fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares

The combination of these elements is able to favor the return on investment in comparable times, with a profit margin much higher in the medium-long term.

ENERVA designs hydrogen production and dispensing plants and vehicle hydrogen propulsions, adopting hybrid powertrains with fuel cell systems for road and rail mobility. For the "waste to energy" deals with the energy exploitation of waste biomass (eg organic waste) for the production of biofuels to be fed in Fuel Cell systems with high efficiency and environmental sustainability

  • Polygeneration systems with fuel cells and hydrogen technologies

Companies operating in plant development. Companies operating in powertrain development. Companies operating in hydrogen energy. Companies operating in the waste-to-energy chain.

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: 2SMArtEST
abstract: 2SMArtEST develops tube coupling systems based on shape memory alloys (SMA) for ultra-high vacuum (UHV) applications.
competitiveAdvantages:
• Mechanical integrity and thermal activation capabilities: technologies developed based on SMA have applications in engineering, chemical, and physics, especially in critical and/or hostile operating environments. This represents a significant advantage for UHV systems of particle accelerators in critical areas with very high radioactivity
  • The use of SMA connectors could be advantageous in submarine installations (eg Oil & Gas industry), chemical plants characterized by highly aggressive environments, aeronautical and aerospace applications
competitiveScenario:
Few companies develop SMA-based connection systems for trade/industry (in USA Intrinsic Devices Incorporated and Aerofit LLC: high thermal hysteresis solutions), however our solutions present the following advantages:

  • Use in harsh/critical environments
  • UHV to HP pressure holding and thermal stability
  • Removable and removable couplings
  • Possibility to connect for large diameter pipes (>150mm)
description: 2SMArtEST (Shape Memory Alloy - based SMArt Engineering Solutions and Technologies) is a research project carried out in collaboration between the University of Calabria and the European Organization for Nuclear Research (CERN). The aim of the project is to develop tube coupling systems based on shape memory alloys (SMA) for ultra-high vacuum (UHV, Ultra High Vacuum) applications in particle accelerators. The project started in 2015 and, to date, 1:1 scale prototypes have been developed.
enablingTechnologies: Robotics, Shape Memory Alloy
mainApplications:
• Development and industrialization of innovative actuation systems based on shape memory alloys (SMA)
  • Smart technologies for the mechanical joining of systems operating in pressure regimes from ultra high vacuum to high pressures. Such systems can be remotely controlled and used in radioactive/hostile environments
  • Applications in high energy physics (the first components were installed in CERN’s LHC particle accelerator in Geneva), aerospace, oil & gas and nuclear medicine
payoff: Novel smart pipe couplimg technologies
revenueModel:
• Technical consulting services with respect to the design/development of pipe coupling systems with diameters between about 25 and 150 mm for UHV and HP applications
  • B2B for Oil & Gas, aeronautical/aerospace, thermo-chemical plants, particle physics
targetCustomers:
• Oil & gas industry: couplings for high pressure pipes (⌀ 25-150 mm)
  • Thermochemical systems: couplings for medium/high pressure seals (⌀ 25-150 mm)
  • Aeronautical/aerospace industry: connections of high pressure hydraulic and/or pneumatic drive lines and thermal stability (up to 400 C, ⌀ 10-30 mm)
  • Particle physics: SMA coupling for UHV applications (⌀ 25-150 mm)

title: Sherpa
abstract: Sherpa offers collaborative programming services to support PA, SMEs and Third Sector, with the aim of generating innovative actions for sustainable development by encouraging dialogue in the territories, thanks to the sharing of technological knowledge, scientific, social and relational
businessTraction:

MOSAIC

competitiveScenario: The process of strategic co-decision-making is based on the evidence-based model of maieutic design that starts with dialectical listening, “transduction” of languages, and relating identities, which then become new systems of action, with their artifacts, products, strategies, policies.
description:
Spin-off of the University of Padova, born in 2017, contributes to generating innovative actions for sustainable development by encouraging dialogue in the territories, thanks to the sharing of technological, scientific, social and relational knowledge with companies, PA and Third Sector.

It offers institutions and companies collaborative design services for strategic planning, context analysis, design and implementation of local development policies and social responsibility of business and territory.

It also offers services for the design, construction and management of European partnerships.

  • Service design;
  • Support for European projects: networking, stakeholder engagement, reporting, dissemination;

Environmental Surveys S.r.l. (ENSU) is a Spin-Off of the University of Bari “ALDO MORO” created with the aim of placing on the market the methodologies and professionalism acquired in the sectors of geology and applied geomorphology and developed over the years in the context of national and international scientific research projects.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Ephos
abstract: Ephos is building the essential infrastructure for quantum technologies. We manufacture high-fidelity photonic chips that power the most advanced modular quantum architectures.
businessTraction: 2024: seed round led by Starlight Ventures (US venture capital firm specializing in deep tech investments), with participation from Collaborative Fund, Exor Ventures, 2100 Ventures, Unruly Capital, Green Sands Equity, Silicon Roundabout Ventures, and Club degli Investitori, as well as angel investors
competitiveAdvantages: Ephos has developed a novel technique for building photonic glass-based chips that don’t incorporate silicon. We inscribe waveguides directly into glass. Crucially, our photonic quantum chips experience extremely low interface losses of less than 5 percent. This breakthrough in fidelity allows Ephos’ customers to fully leverage the distinct advantages of photonic based quantum systems.
competitiveScenario: Currently, as a quantum photonic chip manufacturer, Ephos faces competition solely from the Dutch company QuiX. This company leverages a photolithographic manufacturing process and, contrary to Ephos, relies on external fabrication facilities. QuiX commercializes universal photonic processors using a planar technology based on silicon nitride (SiN) instead of glass.
description: Ephos is building the essential infrastructure for quantum technologies. We manufacture high-fidelity photonic chips that power the most advanced modular quantum architectures. We design and build our chips in house, controlling every aspect of the process from materials procurement through software. Our passive and programmable chips deliver the necessary modularity and versatility for quantum technology developers and researchers.
enablingTechnologies: Quantum technolgies
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: Waveguides control the movement of photons or information in a chip. Until recently, the only way of inscribing waveguides into a chip required the use of silicon. The problem is that today’s silicon-based photonic chips demonstrate interface (information) losses of up to 50 percent, fundamentally limiting the development of modular architectures and fault-tolerant quantum computing.
payoff: We build the essential infrastructure for quantum technologies
revenueModel: At this stage we focus our efforts to scale our chip manufacturing capabilities, enhance the features and reliability of our chips, expand our client base, and develop the new generation of products that will form the basis of our future strategy.
targetCustomers: Quantum technolgy companies

title: WiData
abstract: WiData provides solutions in Data Science, Artificial Intelligence, and Internet of Things for data monetization in the Smart City domain.
businessTraction:
WiData describes its traction with its "Xplore" platform which focuses on three business lines:

  • Monitoring the parameters of urban microclimate, particulate matter, heat waves and heat islands fundamental for assessing and improving the quality of the urban environment
  • Local public transport monitoring and optimization
  • Event Turnout: the possibility to monitor event turnout enabling to better manage resources and improve the event experience.

Winner SIOS 2024
competitiveAdvantages:

WiData’s competitive landscape is influenced by several companies and solutions operating in the field of wireless technology, people mobility monitoring and security. Some of the challenges and competitive opportunities for WiData include:

  • Data Analytics Companies

description: WiData is an innovative startup that focuses on developing advanced solutions for data collection and analysis, with a particular focus on managing the flow of people. Their technology leverages the Internet of Things (iot) to collect data from sensors and turn it into valuable information for smart cities, public transport and public spaces. WiData aims to improve the quality of urban life, optimize services and contribute to sustainable growth of cities through data analysis and implementation of smart solutions.

  • IoT
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications: WiData applications range from transportation management to public safety, providing different revenue streams.
payoff: WiData: Turn data into smart solutions for cities of the future.
revenueModel: IoT as a Service for support services related to the monitoring of the flow of people in public places.
targetCustomers: Government agencies, public transport companies and public space managers. These bodies are interested in improving the mobility, safety and experience of citizens.

title: EVEBiofactory
abstract: EVEBiofactory  is a spin-off of the Italian National Research Council (CNR) that created a pioneering platform for the production and engineering of Extracellular Vesicles (EVs) from a green, sustainable source: microalgae.
businessTraction: 1 agreement with a large cosmetic industry (sensitive term) for R&D activity on raw algosome
competitiveAdvantages:
EVE’s algosomes offer unique advantages over both liposomes and vesicles derived from animal sources.

  • With respect to liposomes, algosomes are derived from a green, natural source, which makes them more appealing for the cosmetic market.
  • With respect to EVs derived from animal cells, algosomes can be produced at large scale, are more cost effective and their production presents lower variability.
competitiveScenario: The global EV market is rapidly evolving as demonstrated by recent investment rounds in startups all around the globe (but mostly outside Europe), and also by the large investment in co-development deals, where large pharma companies ask EV-based companies to carry out the pre-clinical and clinical development.
description: EVEBiofactory has the purpose of developing, producing, engineering, and commercializing innovative cellular biotechnologies of high technological value (e.g., extracellular vesicles from unicellular photosynthetic organisms, microalgae). These particular extracellular vesicles, which the EVE team has called "(nano) algosomes", are extracted from microalgae and can be produced on a large scale, with a renewable and sustainable bioprocess starting from an edible source.
enablingTechnologies:
• Patented large scale (GMP-compatible) manifacturing bioprocesses;
  • Patented algosome applications;
  • Customizable algosome engineering platform
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
• Anti-inflammatory and anti-oxidant effector for pharmaceutic and cosmetical industry;

• Drug delivery system (RNA-therapeutics) for pharmaceutic industry;

• Novel biologics for topical administration (i.e., ocular or dermal routes)
payoff: A nature designed drug delivery platform
revenueModel: EVE will structure industrial liaisons with biotech, cosmetics, and pharma companies by 2023, showcasing algosomes to stimulate co-development agreements for the development of new formulations. To raise EVE TRL (TRL4), business development will be devoted to the involvement of pharma companies.
targetCustomers: Pharmaceutical, biotech, and cosmetics industries

trl.label: 4 - Technological validation in a laboratory environment

title: Studium Genetics
abstract: Early diagnosis and prognosis prediction methods in molecular oncology
businessTraction:
• Tomalab (Busto Arsizio, servizio NGS);
  • Aventa (regolatorio);
  • Ing. Mario Ragazzi (responsabile IT)
competitiveAdvantages:
• Unique with high sensitivity (97%), specificity (90%) and accuracy;
  • Non-invasive;
  • Based on next generation sequencing methods;
  • Shipment of the sample at room temperature;
  • Provides diagnostic and prognostic information;
  • High-tech, fast and economical protocol ideal for screening programs.
competitiveScenario: In order to attempt an early diagnosis, an attempt has been made to apply toluidine blue to the oral mucosa, which in some cases has been found to be partially useful in identifying the areas at greatest risk where there is increased cell replication. This technique often generates false positives and false negatives and has been virtually abandoned.
description: Studium Genetics has developed and patented the Oral Carcinoma Risk Algorithm (SG-OCRA) method for the early detection of patients at risk of developing oral squamous cell carcinoma (OSCC) and its precursor, severe dysplasia, by quantitative analysis of DNA methylation using bisulfite Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) on exfoliating oral mucosa samples.
enablingTechnologies: Bisulfite-Next Generation Sequencing and bioinformatic analysis based on cloud computing
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications: The service proposed by Studium Genetics, in collaboration with sequencing laboratories around the world, currently focuses on screening and prognosis of oral cancer. The same test is also being validated in the nasal or oropharyngeal mucosa for use by otolaryngologists.

owners.name: Alma Mater Studiorum Università di Bologna

payoff: Early diagnosis and prognosis prediction methods in molecular oncology
revenueModel: Royalties on complete collection kit sales
targetCustomers: Dentists, maxillofacial surgeons, otolaryngologists

title: WembraneX
abstract: The company, a spin-off of CNR-ITM, produces membranes for industrial processes using an innovative technology that allows for a substantial reduction in fouling and therefore a reduction in the operating costs of water separation or treatment processes.
businessTraction: 2024: investment by Progress Tech Transfer Fund
competitiveAdvantages:
• Superior anti-fouling properties leading to an increase in membrane lifetime of 50% and to an increase in water permeability recovery after fouling of 80%
  • Anti-microbial properties provided by the surfactant AUTEAB which is able to counteract the adhesion and proliferation of microorganisms on the membrane surface (anti-biofouling activity)
  • Intrinsic stability of the coating provided through the polymerization step
  • Customization capabilities to target specific industrial separation problems using the microemulsion formulation and polymerization conditions.
competitiveScenario:
The SAFTEK membranes stand out in comparison to the reference market by improving the following KPI:

  • Reduction in OPEX (Operating Expenses)
  • Use of chemicals for membrane cleaning
  • Replacement of membrane modules
  • Time spent on membrane cleaning
description: The Company aims, as its first target, to step-change the performance of municipal wastewater treatment facilities by significantly reducing membrane fouling, which is their largest operating cost challenge. It also aims as a second target to address complex industrial separation processes in Food and Beverage, Textiles, Pharmaceuticals and Chemicals.
enablingTechnologies: Roll-to-roll process manufacturing
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
• Municipal and industrial wastewater treatment
  • Food and beverage: recovery of biologically active compounds, sterilization
  • Pharma and Biotechnology: concentration and purification s of enzymes and proteins
  • Special Chemistry: filtration of solvents, separation of chemical compounds
payoff: Next generation membranes for efficient wastewater treatment and industrial separations
revenueModel:
Direct sale of the SAFTEK membranes to manufacturers of components and systems operating in water treatment markets.

Development of complementary services will also be evaluated, such as autopsy and membrane characterization.
targetCustomers: WembraneX's target customers are small to medium-sized companies working in the water treatment sector and industrial membrane separation processes.

title: HORT
abstract: "Plant Architecture" allows, through microscopic analysis and morpho-physiological representation, to anticipate, before the presence of the flower, the productive potential of fruit plants.
competitiveAdvantages:
• It represents an evolution of the "flower mapping" method, but providing a greater number of details
  • It describes the main elements of the analyzed plants with a synthetic and visually effective schematic representation, intended for quick reference
  • It also provides data on the vegetative structures forming in the plant (in addition to the reproductive ones), thus offering information on the overall balance and autonomy of the analyzed plants.
description: The "Plant Architecture" service, through microscopic analysis and morpho-physiological representation, sampled prior to the presence of the flower, allows for advance knowledge of the productive potential of fruit plants. It monitors the formation, number and developmental stage of flowers in buds and shoots, providing nurserymen and farmers with a tool to adjust production techniques, identify when to apply cultivation techniques and optimize resources use. It requires specialization and commitment from operators, partially reduced by the computerization in the representation of results.
enablingTechnologies: Data Analysis, Predictive Agricolture
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications:
• Nursery Gardening: assistance for nurserymen to guide plant production techniques and ensure the quality of the plants offered, especially for nurseries specializing in strawberry plants, but also for currants and raspberries
  • Fruit Growing: aims to support in guiding cultivation techniques and provide assurance of the agronomic quality of the plants to be purchased
  • Varietal Development: for manufacturers and breeders, a tool to assess the vegetative-reproductive traits of new varieties in selection
  • Research: providing reliable data for monitoring results in plant physiology.
payoff: Fruiting success starts with knowing your plants
revenueModel: The monetization occurs through the provision of the analysis service with payment for each sample analyzed. The model can be scaled up by implementing the computerization of additional steps in the results processing and representation.
targetCustomers: Italian and European nursery owners, producer organizations, suppliers of quality fruit with a complete supply chain from production to sale.

trl.label: 9 - Complete system demonstration in a real operational environment (functional test with enabling technologies and application to the specific industrial sector)

title: Morecognition
abstract: Remote rehabilitation for post-stroke patients through the use of proprietary devices and apps, for continuous monitoring by the physiotherapist of the progress of their patients.
businessTraction:
• San Camillo Hospital - IRCCS (Venice)
  • Casa Sollievo della Sofferenza di San Giovanni Rotondo (Foggia)
  • Azienda Sanitaria Locale of Turin - ASL TO3 (Hospitals of Rivoli, Susa and Pinerolo)
competitiveAdvantages:
The uniqueness of Morecognition is to offer a new model of care in the field of rehabilitation. In particular:

  • Customization: Remo allows therapists to create, record and manage personalized (and non-packaged) exercises for each patient
  • Neuromuscular: Remo+ measures neuromuscular activity by giving therapists feedback on exercises, tracking progress over time
  • Asynchronous: Remo allows asynchronous tele-rehabilitation sessions at the patient’s home
  • Reason: Remo+ calls patients by phone and automatically involves caregivers
competitiveScenario: The main competitors in Italy are Euleria Health with the product KariKonnect and Digital rehab that wants to propose Aurhea but, at the moment, is not yet on the market. In France MyoTact is aimed at post-stroke and prosthetic patients while a market leader that has moved on rehabilitation plans to companies is Sword Health born in Portugal and now active in the USA.
description: We help post-stroke patients recover the use of the hand, rehabilitating at home under the constant supervision of their physiotherapist. Thanks to the Remo device, we allow patients to exercise daily, following the instructions of their physiotherapist. Through the dedicated app, Remo reminds the patient when and how to do the exercises by increasing his involvement and therapeutic adherence, all this by continuously monitoring progress and motivating patients to treat themselves better.
enablingTechnologies: Telmonitoring, Telerehab
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications:
• rehabilitation of the post-stroke patient’s forearm and hand
  • rehabilitation forearm and hand of neurological pathologies
  • Rehabilitation of the forearm and hand in post-traumatic areas
  • rehabilitation of the whole body
  • wellness exercises in old age
  • personal trainer in sports field
  • control loop of exoskeletons
  • drug test
payoff: Enhanced rehabilitation for greater autonomy
revenueModel: Remo is based on a B2B2C model, in which the solution is presented to the patient by the physiotherapist. To the patient, the Remo+ device is sold directly by Morecognition for one-time use including 90 days of use and then at a fixed cost for the service from the fourth month.
targetCustomers:
• Neurological patients
  • Clinics

G3F implements AI to support the operator in measurements and improve the metrological performance of laser scanners in assembly lines. In the context of the Industrial Internet of Things (IIoT), portable and non-portable measuring instruments are proposed, digitally connected to the factory network, increasing the ability of operators to act in line with Industry 4.0 principles

The startup, unlike competitors on the market, creates efficient materials from an engineering point of view and according to shape functions: structures, mock-up design concepts, unique pieces

Using recycled and natural materials, innovative structural concepts and 3D/4D printing techniques, neWmatt designs and manufactures:

  • mechanical metamaterials and structures with advanced geometric design. Attention to the seismic protection of buildings and reinforcements of fractal composite materials
  • sustainable structures for interior design/household objects (outdoor and landscape lighting, chairs, ornaments, creative jewels), using architecture of tensegrity and bio-inspired shapes
  • sensors/actuators for non-destructive structural monitoring and medical diagnosis

trl.label: 8 - Complete system definition and qualification

title: Viper
abstract: Viper has patented a method to analyze the inferior vena cava, offering the healthcare professional an accurate, immediate output with low variability showing a quantitative processing, easy to interpret and to insert in the report.
businessTraction:
• Division of Cardiology, Regional Hospital Umberto Parini, Aosta (IT)
  • Scuola Superiore Sant'Anna di Pisa (IT)
  • Fondazione Toscana G. Monasterio, Pisa (IT)
  • Department of Medicine, Surgery and Health Sciences, University of Trieste (IT)
  • Department of Neuroscience, University of Turin (IT)
  • Regione Piemonte
competitiveAdvantages: The evaluation of the volemic state of the patients at the moment in the hospitals is often done by the clinician in a subjective way. By processing with our software the same ultrasounds that doctors are accustomed to acquire, clinicians will have available quantitative indices, not operator employees.
competitiveScenario:
Direct competitor is General Electrics (USA), which has developed a similar SW. Main differences:

  • Our SW can work on longitudinal and transverse section of the IVC (GE longitudinal section only)
  • Longitudinal view: our algorithm integrates more information
  • Our SW processes all the frames of the ultrasound video and provides additional indices on the wanted state
description: The patented technology processes inferior vena cava (IVC) ultrasound to assess the patient’s volemic state (degree of hydration) and plan fluid therapy. The evaluation is now made subjectively by the clinician, while our calculations provide quantitative indices, processing ultrasounds without variations of examination mode. Results on healthy subjects showed greater accuracy and repeatability of the measurement than the clinical method. Estimates of volemic status and right atrial pressure have been validated in internal medicine and resuscitation patients.
enablingTechnologies: AI, deep learning, Ultrasound, Biomedical Imaging, Big data Analysis
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications: Right atrial pressure estimation (APE) is now performed with invasive techniques and therefore only under specific circumstances, although the information obtained can be crucial for the patient. Viper wants to offer a prototype for estimating central venous pressure using information extracted from ultrasound scans through AI. Making this information accessible will help doctors in the diagnostic and prognostic process. SW can also be tested on other types of blood vessels, such as arteries, which are also important for assessing the fluid status of patients
payoff: Vein Image Processing for Edge Rendering
revenueModel:
• 2 products: software license, hardware (i.e., frame grabber to extract the ultrasound video) + software
  • 2 channels: distributors and Viper network.

Prices: 750€ for single PC license, 1150€ with the hardware.
targetCustomers: Public and private hospitals

title: Next Vision
abstract: NAIROBI: Intelligent Assistant that interacts with humans to support them in navigating unknown interior spaces by calculating paths from camera images/videos (smartphones, smartglasses) and showing them in Augmented Reality mode

  • Oriient, Navenius: gyroscope signal (inaccurate)
  • Google, Marvelmind: GPS signal (inaccurate)

Next Vision uses image/video analysis, requires no installations and the signal is very accurate allowing you to view a path in augmented reality
description: NAIROBI is an Intelligent Assistant based on AI and Computer Vision algorithms able to interact with humans and support them in navigating unknown interior spaces to reach a point of interest/destination or locate themselves, calculating the paths from images/ videos captured by a camera (eg smartphone) and showing them in Augmented Reality. It applies to different contexts: Industry (avoid suspended loads/dangerous machinery), Cultural Heritage (museums), Assistance and Rehabilitation (for people with disabilities or patients in a hospital), and Daily Life
enablingTechnologies: Augmented Reality, Platform/App
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000

  • Cultural Heritage: guiding visitors into museum
  • Assistance and Rehabilitation: helping people with disabilities in supermarkets or driving patients inside a hospital
  • Expo: guiding visitors through stands
  • Everyday life: driving people into shopping malls, offices or airports
payoff: Build your Next Vision with us!
revenueModel:
B2C, with the possibility of annual licenses.

The offer varies depending on the size of the environments, reachable points of interest, customizations user interface and assistance-support 24/7.
targetCustomers:
Managers/ managers of indoor environments, such as organizers of fairs, museums, hospitals.

Commercial and advertising messages can be integrated into NAIROBI.

title: ROBOSAN
abstract: We are a healthcare-focused robotic startup that provides solutions to automate sample preparation processes at hospital and diagnostic lab pickup points.

competitiveAdvantages:

competitiveScenario: The current solutions for the automation of the pre-analysis phases do not integrate tracking, control, sanitization, sorting and packaging of the test tubes, not guaranteeing the main benefits of ROBOSAN (safety, reliability and efficiency). Indirect competitors are large manufacturers of medical devices (INPECO, Siemens, Roche, Abbott) who could develop a similar product
description: ROBOSAN has patented a robotic platform for hospitals and healthcare facilities to simplify and automate the processes of biological sample preparation directly at the sampling points, in order to reduce the costs of preparation errors and processing times. The platform automatically checks the compliance of the samples, packs them for shipment to the central laboratory and ensures safety thanks to sanitization of samples and their containers, directly at the sampling points. Automatic, efficient solution (samples are ready for analysis), reactive
enablingTechnologies: Information automation, control and tracking, sanitization, automatic packaging, SW for monitoring
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received (family&friends, BAs, crowdfunding) with possible transfers of company shares. Funding range: € 5,000 - 50,000
mainApplications:
• First fully automated robotic platform for the control, tracking, sorting, sanitizing and packaging of biological samples
  • System inserted directly into the picking points, where most of the errors and manual operations are concentrated to cut errors and process times upstream

owners.name: Università degli Studi di Napoli Federico II

payoff: FLEXIBLE PRE-ANALYSIS AUTOMATION
revenueModel: The ROBOSAN platform will be sold to customers with a monthly operating rental formula, in line with industry standards. Our model includes a minimum 24 month rental subscription period, including device and software platform.

Robotic arms have the features to excel in a wide range of harsh environments, including the underwater world, radioactive zones, explosive areas, and space.

trl.label: 5 - Technological validation in an industrial environment

title: CoAImed
abstract: CoAImed (Collaborative development of AI based technologies for medical applications) is active in the fields of artificial intelligence, sensors and biorobotics, and aims to improve the prevention, diagnosis, and treatment of neurodegenerative diseases.
competitiveAdvantages:
WEARnCARE from CoAImed allows you to:

  • improve the quality of care by reducing subjectivity and variability of evaluations, providing objective assessments of the motor skills of PD patients during clinical examinations
  • standardize clinical practice: by digitilizing data and providing automated medical reports to support diagnosis and monitoring
  • improve the use of resources: by reducng the time spent on the neurological examination for the motor evaluation, allowing other specialists to administer the motor test
competitiveScenario:
Objective clinical evaluation of the motor tasks of the PD. Thanks to AI algorithms, WEARnCARE measures bradicinesia and tremor, offering:

  • Motor evaluation of the whole body
  • Compliance with MDS-UPDRS III
  • Plug&play approach, portable and ready to use
  • Automated medical reports, easy and quick to read and interpret
  • Self-administered test via guided procedure under the supervision of specialists
description: CoAImed is an innovative startup with the aim of developing, producing and marketing innovative technological products and services in the fields of artificial intelligence, sensors and biorobotics. CoAImed aims to put innovative technologies based on artificial intelligence at the service of patients' health and well-being, focusing on capturing the interaction between body and brain as a whole, providing doctors and patients with innovative tools and skills based on artificial intelligence to support them throughout their journey.
enablingTechnologies:
• Wearable miniaturized inertial system with 8 sensory units
  • IoT gateway with edge computing for data collection and signal processing
  • Cloud resources and AI algorithms to aggregate information to accurately return it
  • Touchscreen monitor with dedicated dashboard for doctor and patient
fundingStageDescription: Non-repayable funding has been received from entities, without transferring company shares
mainApplications:
WEARnCARE uses AI-based wearable technology to improve the practice of diagnosis, monitoring and follow-up of neurodegenerative diseases, in which motor impairment is related to neurological decline. A system that can improve Parkinson’s management is proposed:

  • saving and optimizing doctors' time
  • objectifying the evaluation of motor performance
  • automatically reporting the diagnosis
  • collecting clinical data outside the hospital

WEARnCARE is a decision support system for the objective evaluation of patients' motor skills
payoff: Development of AI-based technologies for medical application
revenueModel: CoAImed will rely on a specialized distributor to penetrate the clinical market. The WEARnCARE system will cost € 8,000 plus € 4,000 license for services such as training, service and warranty. We expect to be able to exceed 7M€ in revenues at 5 years with a net income of almost 4M€.
targetCustomers:
• Neurologists, for outpatient practice (diagnosis and management of patients with PD)
  • Patients, for its use at home, allowing the clinician to receive objective measurements of patients' motor performance, with evaluation of current therapy

WEARnCARE is designed for patients with mild to moderate PD (stage I-III, Hoehn&Yahr scale, about 80% of the total PD patients)

title: BBSoF
abstract: BBSoF through ACL Quick Check®. evaluates the risk of injury to the anterior cruciate ligament directly on the field, providing a comprehensive biomechanical analysis.
businessTraction:
• Diadora: devices R&D to assess the risk of injury in workers
  • Finstral: biomechanical analysis with the aid of an exoskeleton to investigate improvements at work level
  • Italian Rugby Federation, Calcio Napoli Femminile(...): risk of injuries, performance, physical and biomechanical conditions after injury/surgery
  • Podartis, Orthomedica: collaborations POR 2014-2020, POR 2021-2022
  • Equistases: validation of proprietary (Parkinson, analysis applied to sport)
competitiveAdvantages:
• Quantitative assessment of of injury risk on the field, through a proprietary AI platform that uses technologies such as commercial cameras and plantar pressure systems
  • Customized preventive strategy and threshold planning for the return on the field
  • Patented technology that makes the evaluation unique. The system improves performances and reduces the costs for sports clubs related to injuries
  • ACL Quick Check measures risk directly in the field and in specific tasks of the discipline with the same precision as a laboratory of motion analysis
competitiveScenario: Competitors provide solutions that do not include the definition of lower limb injury risk indices (anterior cruciate ligament). The available motion capture markerless systems are expensive, require dedicated cameras, and biomechanical screening methods require sophisticated tools, dedicated indoor and HW labs that limit the variety and naturalness of gestures
description: BBSoF provides athletes, rehabilitation centers and orthopedic clinics with a tool for biomechanical analysis to prevent lower limb injuries, plan re-entry and optimize performance. The method is based on video markerless systems and foot pressure analysis, providing information in terms of kinematics and kinetics, for each sport and clinical application. Using a database of biomechanical variables, BBSoF develops SW markerless based on AI for the calculation of kinematic variables used in the patented ACL Quick Check method
enablingTechnologies:
• Computer Vision combined with Deep Learning algorithms for the reconstruction of the 3D laying of analyzed subjects
  • Database of healthy and post-injured subjects acquired through cameras and pressure slabs while performing tasks characteristic of various sports: rugby, football, basketball,...
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (VCs). Funding range: € 250,001 - 500,000
mainApplications: Software development in the field of biomechanics applied to sport and clinic.
payoff: Beyond Biomechanics Sport on Field
revenueModel:
Monthly subscriptions (min.12 months); products either via app, or sold through distributors. Packages:

  • Top-level: 4-camera system and pressure plates to estimate biomechanical parameters and accident index
  • User-friendly: simple output with the use of one camera
targetCustomers:
• Professional and amateur athletes
  • Athletic trainers
  • Sports federations
  • Sports teams
  • Practice of sports medicine
  • Orthopaedic clinics
  • Gyms
  • Rehabilitation centres
  • Physiotherapists

DG Twin applies the technology of digital twins and IoT connectivity for the development of products and processes, allowing the collection of real data functional to the pursuit of objectives

title: ATHENA Green Solutions
abstract: ATHENA Green Solutions S.r.l. develops new methodologies, strategies, "environmental friendly" and eco-sustainable products for the recovery of marine contaminated waters, and in general for the abatement of the contaminant load in affected marine areas and for the environmental protection
businessTraction: Interest expressed by Agencies/Companies specialized in the development of solutions for environmental protection safeguarding, waste disposal industries and petrochemical industries. title: Bacfarm
abstract: Bacfarm offers concrete solutions for a changing market. Bacfarm has developed a method to extract biomolecules from the bacterial S-Layer, the outermost membrane of some microorganisms, a unique biological structure from which to extract the components.
businessTraction: • Fondazione Golinelli
competitiveAdvantages:
• Patented process: use of unique patented technology
  • Unique technology able to isolate the biomolecules that make up the bacterial S-Layer
  • The product: the first extraction product comes from Deinococcus radiodurans, from which is extracted Pink Layer, a molecular complex containing deinoxanthin. It is an unprecedented raw material on the market that possesses antioxidant power and UV filter activity.
competitiveScenario: The increasing awareness of the benefits of natural active ingredients and consumers preference for sustainable products are pushing the chemical and cosmetics industries to use natural raw materials. Bacfarm responds to the need of markets to have raw materials obtainable from alternative and sustainable sources, proposing competitive molecules in the category of active ingredients
description: The patented technology uses extremophile bacteria that have developed resistance to extreme environmental conditions such as radiation, high temperatures, high salinity, desiccation. The outer membrane of these organisms, the S-Layer, is designed as a shield to ensure their survival and represents an inexhaustible source for new raw materials with extraordinary biological characteristics, with a huge potential in various fields. Bacfarm develops customized solutions based on the final application, through specific research that makes the new product unique and competitive.
enablingTechnologies: Extraction of biomolecules from bacterial S-Layer.
fundingStageDescription: Funding is being sought or has been received with transfers of company shares (BAs, incubators, accelerators). Funding range: € 50,001 - 250,000
mainApplications:
• Cosmetics and dermatology
  • Nutraceuticals
  • Animal feed

revenueModel: Production and sale of active substances (B2B and B2C)
targetCustomers: Sale of innovative new products to the general public

Data-driven model with which to design and deliver engineered and reconfigurable high-level training and development courses targeted to:

Learning support paths, remote tutoring, project-based learning, and coaching, create a system designed for Digital learning.
